She is requesting a loan to purchase more water by the sack, rice bags and charcoal for her business.  She hopes to send her children to quality schools and build a house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more water by the sack, rice bags, and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Luchadoras se formó con la unión de vA. vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.  Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Ella se definen como mujeres muy trabajadoras y luchadoras que día a día luchan por el sustento de su familia.
La Señora Bonifacia es una de las integrantes del comité, ella tiene una despensa bien surtida con todo tipo de artículos. Todos sus clientes quedan muy admirados con su trabajo. Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 3  hijos y su marido quien trabaja  como Contratista. Se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo. 
La señora Bonifacia  solicita el crédito para la compra de productos para su despensa, como ser comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y otros. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da.
texts.en:
The 'Mujeres Luchadoras' committee was created when a number of neighbors from the town of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together.  The members created a very united group and are capable of jointly carrying out activities that strengthen their team spirit.  They describe themselves as very hard-working and tenacious women who work hard every day to support their families.

Bonifacia is one of the committee's members.  She has a well-stocked store where she sells all kinds of goods.  All of her customers are very impressed with her work.  She has a very united family.  She has three children and her husband works as a contractor.  She is very happy with her business and the training sessions that her group receives.

Bonifacia is requesting this loan to buy products for her store such as food, drinks, dairy products, etc.  She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity that they are giving her.

loans.use: to buy food, drinks, dairy products, etc.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en:
Uk is humble 37-year-old woman who resides in Kompong Chhnang province. She is a tradeswoman who runs a business selling beans. She buys beans from local farms and resells them at the marketplace. Uk earns an average of 3 USD a day. 

Uk is planning to start a new business raising and selling pigs for breeding and for meat. She is therefore requesting a loan from the Kiva partner HKL to purchase pigs. In the future, Uk hopes to improve her family’s living standard and secure them from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase pigs

loans.name: Inom

texts.ru: Ином женат, отец четверых детей. Он опытный предприниматель. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием пшеницы и откормом скота на селе. От проданной пшеницы он получает доходы, также откорм и купля-продажа крупного рогатого скота приносит немалые доходы. Но следует отметить о том что, по словам Инома скот нужно купить своевременно, когда цена на них падает. Сейчас как раз таки такое время. Вот поэтому для приобретения скота, минеральных удобрений и семян ему нужны средства. Этот займ поможет ему расширить его бизнес.
texts.en: Inom is married and is a father of four children.  He is an experienced entrepreneur.  He has been involved in growing wheat and fattening up livestock for over 15 years.  Inom earns an income from sales of wheat, and fattening up and buying-selling cattle brings in a good income as well.  We need to note that, according to Inom's words, livestock purchases need to be timed when their prices drop.  Right now is precisely this time.  Inom needs funds to purchase livestock, mineral fertilizers and seeds.  This loan will help him to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock, mineral fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a married man with two children. One child attends school while the other one is too young for school. Hamisi has a house with neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for his family.

Hamisi has operated a function decoration business for the past 5 years. His potential clients are mostly people around his town who need his services. He faces a major challenge with seasonality because he works during the festive seasons.

With the Kshs 25,000 loan Hamisi wants to purchase lights, cables and wires for his business. He decided to join Yehu Microfinance because of its quality financial services.

loans.use: To purchase lights, cables and wires for his business.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has 2 children. Her husband is a steel bender. Abena has been a small-scale trader at Kokoado in Elmina, Ghana for five years. She uses her income to assist her husband in educating their children. Abena will use the loan to purchase slippers for sale. With the new profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase slippers for sale.

loans.name: Amani

texts.en:
Amani is a 26-year-old lady who has a small retail business at home. She sells home products, mainly to her friends and neighbors.
Amani started this business in order to help and contribute to her family’s income. Now she want buy more products to increase her sales and that is why she has applied for this loan.
Since Amani is a conservative person, she asked her brother-in-law Mohammad to appear in the photo instead.

loans.use: to add more home products to her range.

loans.name: Gh Ayidote Minawanou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amis et qui habitent le même village. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. Le représentant du groupe, du nom de Benoît est celui qui a la main levée sur la photo. Benoît est âgé de 56 ans et vit au Bénin. Benoît n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Benoît est marié à une marchande du nom de Adidja. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a un autre enfant en charge. Benoît vit ensemble avec sa femme et ses enfants. Afin d‘assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Benoît exerce depuis quarante ans environs, la culture du maïs, du piment, de tomate et de gombo qu’il vend dans un marché du Bénin. De façon secondaire, Benoît fait la pêche. Benoît exerce ses activités dans sa région. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Benoît sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GH AYIDOTE MINAWANOU, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The Gh Ayidote Minawanou group consists of four people who are friends and live in the same village. This is the fifth time that the group has sought financial support from ALIDé, to raise the level of its business activities. The representative of the group, named Benoît, is the one with the raised hand in the picture.

Benoît is 56 years old and lives in Benin. He did not attend school. Benoît is married to a retail merchant named Adidja. The couple has six children, all in school and who are their dependents. In addition to their children, the couple has another child to support. Benoît lives together with his wife and children.

To ensure the various family expenses, Benoît has been growing crops for the past forty years: corn, peppers, tomatoes and okra that he sells in a market in Benin. Secondarily, he is also a fisherman. Benoît runs his business activities in the surrounding region.

Seeking to satisfy customers and increase his turnover and income, Benoît is requesting, together with other members of the Gh Ayidote Minawanou group, a fifth credit loan from ALIDé. The first four loans have been repaid in full.

loans.use: Buy vegetable products to grow crops (pepper, tomato and corn).

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra, de 22 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, así como amable y alegre, es conviviente con Santos quien es empleado, vive en compañía de su padre, madre, dos hermanos, su pareja y sus dos hijos de 8 y 2 años de edad, instalados cómodamente  en la casa de sus padres. Mayra se dedica a la venta de comida como menú al medio día y por las noches vende comida rápida como pollos broaster y salchipapas en el frontis de la casa de sus padres, adicional a eso también vende refrescos a pedidos que entrega a los trabajadores de un aserradero que está ubicado muy cerca de donde vive, y también vende plátanos en una mesa en la casa de sus padres. Tiene más 02 años realizando esta actividad, y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su hermano para atender a sus clientes. Le gusta su negocio pues le permite tener un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar, y viendo que la zona es una calle transitado tiene una regular demanda y clientela. Este será el primer préstamo con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de ingredientes para la preparación de comidas, así como la compra de plátanos a precio por mayor.
texts.en:
Mayra, 22, is hardworking and knows what she wants; she is also friendly and happy. Her live-in partner Santos is employed, and they live comfortably in her parents' home with her father, mother, 2 siblings and her two children, ages 8 and 2. 

Mayra sells daily specials at lunch time and at night she sells fast food like rotisserie chicken and salchipapas [sausages with french fries] in front of her parents' house. She also sells sodas that she delivers to the workers in a sawmill not far from where she lives, and she sells plantains on a table in her parents' house. She has been doing this for more than two years and her brother helps her attend to her customers. She likes her business because it allows her to earn money to assist her partner with their household expenses. Her street is well-traveled and so she has regular demand and clientele. 

This will be her first loan with MFP, so she hopes for a small loan that will help her meet her objectives. With the 800 nuevos soles that she requested, she will invest in the purchase of ingredients to make meals, as well as buying plantains at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing meals, as well as plantains.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53-year-old married man, the father of six children. He has worked as a car mechanic for 35 years.  This long experience gave him customers' trust and support. He opened his current garage in 1997, and it is well known in the region.

Ali works hard for his family's happiness, he sacrifices his life for theirs. To provide his children with the best education, Ali requested a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to pay for their school fees.

This is Ali's second experience with Al Majmoua, and his previous one was very impressive, it reflected positively on both his social and financial situations. 

Ali is looking forward to improving and updating his business as much as he can in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Fadwa

texts.en:
Fadwa is a 31-year-old single lady from Aqaba, Jordan.

Fadwa is a tailor with a home-based business and she is requesting a loan of 400 JOD to purchase materials needed in dress-making for trading purposes.

An aspiration of Fadwa is to open a shop for her products so that she can increase her customer base and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in dress-making for trading purposes.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer, 30 years old, is married and has two children, both in school. She has operated a food stall in Bor, South Sudan for three years. Amer is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase beans and rice. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a small scale food vender who sells cooked rice and vegetable stew in Npatado (near Takoradi). She has had some form of formal education as she is a primary graduate. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a mason.

Christiana has been working as a food vender for close to ten years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of rice and vegetables, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a food stand, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of rice and vegetables, thus allowing her to meet rising customer demands

loans.name: Judith's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers in Lugari District with Judith selected as the Kiva representative. Judith has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right side of the photo with her hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to her and the 80 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum.  The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Judith is married and has five children. She is 37 years old and is known as friendly, hardworking, and an experienced farmer.  She is active in her community in groups such as the prayer group and the burial committee.  Judith has been a farmer for 16 years.  She described her harvest as excellent last year, but believes she can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund.  		

Judith joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader.  Judith joined One Acre Fund so that she could get new farming methods, fertilizer and hybrid seeds.  Because she wants to help more farmers, Judith has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative.  Working with One Acre Fund has improved Judith's life because she has more farm training and was able to save money.  In the future, Judith hopes that her profits from 2014 can be used to send children to school and save for the future.  							

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya.  The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers.  Judith and her group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund.  One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment.  With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.			

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Merlita works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from general store.  Merlita is borrowing PHP 11000 through NWTF to buy spare parts, and other materials needed in her business for her motorcycle transport business.

Merlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts, and other materials needed in her business

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
This young man is a well known joiner in Sumgait city. Rasim has been working in the joiner\'s shop since 2005. He married, has 2 children. This 30-year-old Rasim is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli. He is hard worker. 
He would like to borrow a loan amount of $1200 from Normicro because he wants to buy 1 planer and additional board materials.

loans.use: To buy  1 planer and board materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: I will use the money to diversify and expand my business

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is a very hard-working woman. She lives in Sabinas Hidalgo in the State of Nuevo León. She is a single mother and has a lovely 3 year-old daughter. She has never received support form her partner and has therefore had to work very hard to raise her child. A year ago, due to staff cuts, she lost her job as a seemstress. She therefore started her own business,with help from her parents, and it has done very well.

She now needs a loan of $275 with which she will buy goods to keep her business well-stocked and to serve her clients better. She will repay this loan over a period of 5-10 months. Margarita wants her business to grow, and with your help this can happen. So don't doubt, just support her.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer.

Margarita es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en la localidad de Sabinas Hidalgo del estado de Nuevo León, es madre soltera de una preciosa niña de 3 años de edad. Nunca contó con el apoyo de su pareja por lo que Margarita ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a su hija. Hace un año, por recorte de personal, perdió el empleo que tenia como costurera, por lo que emprendió su propio negocio con la ayudad de sus padres, en el que le ha ido muy bien.

Ahora necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía para tener bien surtido su negocio y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. Margarita desea que su negocio pueda crecer, con tu ayuda lo logrará, no lo dudes más y apóyala.

loans.use: To buy goods/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Rafig

texts.en:
Rafig A. operates a photo-developing studio. He is married with two children. His shop is located in Beylagan, a small town in southern-west Azerbaijan near the Iranian border. He has operated this business since 1995. Rafig develops photos using a large photo-processing machine. He also works as a photographer at weddings.

Rafig has more experience in this business than his competitors. This is his first loan and he plans to remodel his shop and purchase a digital camera. This new camera will allow him to take better photos and increase his business.

loans.use: To repair his shop and purchase a digital camera

loans.name: Ni Wayan Winawar

texts.id:
Ni Wayan Winawar – Bu Win – is a housewife. Since she is aware that her husband's income is on the borderline as a seasonal tenant farmer, she with her husband staerted this business. Two years ago, with a capital of Rp500,000.00 (about US$55) she bought 2 pigs that she raised the traditional way - leashed under a tree. She feed them talas roots and kankong leaves obtained from nearby areas. From that she obtained Rp800,000.00 (about $88) in 3 months. With that result, Bu Win added her raised pigs by buying 2 more mother pigs, with a capital from DINARI. With 4 mother pigs, Bu Win expects her sales to reach Rp2000,000.00 (about $220) per 3 months. Bu Win expects that this way she could fulfill daily family needs that reached Rp400,000.00 (about $44)/month. Even to buy woven bamboo (gedhek) to replace her hut's wall that started to fall apart.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Wayan Winawar – Bu Win – adalah ibu rumah tangga. Karena sadar akan penghasilan suaminya yang pas-pasan sebagai petani musiman. Bersama suaminya dia merintis usaha ini. Dua tahun yang lalu dengan modal Rp 500.000,00 dia membeli 2 ekor babi yang dipelihara secara tradisional - mengikatnya di bawah pohon. Makanan yang di berikan berupa ubi umbi talas / daun kangkung yang ada di sekitarnya. Hasil yang diperoleh Rp 800.000,00 /3 bulan. Melihat hasil yg diperoleh tersebut, Bu Win menambah jumlah peliharaannya dengan membeli 2 ekor bibit lagi dengan meminjam modal dari DINARI. Dengan 4 ekor induk babi yang Ibu Win miliki saat ini, maka hasil penjualannya mencapai Rp 2.000.000,00 / 3 bulan. Bu Win berharap dengan usaha ini dia dapat membantu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga sehari - hari yang mencapai Rp 400.000,00 /bulan, bahkan bisa membeli bambu anyaman (gedhek) untuk mengganti dinding rumahnya yang sudah lapuk

loans.use:
To buy feedstock and build a stall

Membeli bibit dan membuat kandang

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Romerlia belongs to the Comunal Bank Sol Naciente (Rising Sun), at Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. She is 60 year olds, a widow and mother of 3. Because of her condition she has to deal with all the home expenses, so with the first loan she received from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open a small place to sell typical food.

Currently she prepares and sells typical food (juanes, tacos, tamales) and her local is on the siD. walk of her house, where she has many difficulties when it rains, but she doesn’t give up, and her daughters help her and go out to sell from 4pm to 11pm.

With the loan received of S/.2,500 ($833 approx.) which will be paid in 6 months, she will increase her space and will place a little ceiling to avoid the rain, also she will buy 6 kilos of rice, 2 liters of oil, and 2 bunches of plantains.

Even though Romelia is a widow she is very happy to be working with her daughters who help her in this business but without missing school duties.

Translated from Spanish by N.D., Kiva Volunteer.


La señora Romelia pertenece al Banco Comunal Sol Naciente, del Jr. F. Jhon Kenedy 999 del A. H. Nuevo Paraíso del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 60 años y es madre D. 3 hijos y es viuda. Debido a su condición tiene que afrontar los gastos del hogar, es así que Romelia, con el primer préstamo D. Manuela Ramos deciD. poner un pequeño puesto para la venta D. comida regional. En la actualidad elabora y venD. comida regional (juanes, tacacho, tamales) y su puesto D. venta está en la vereda D. su casa, donD. tiene dificultades cuando llueve, a pesar D. ello no se da por vencida, recibe el apoyo D. sus hijas y salen a vender a partir D. las 4.00pm hasta las 11.00 pm. Con el reciente préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos D. S/. 2,500 (US$ 833.00 aprox.), el cual será pagado en 6 meses, ampliará su espacio y a su vez pondrá un pequeño techo D. calamina para evitar las lluvias, además comprará 6 kilos D. arroz, 2 litros D. aceite, 2 racimos D. plátano. Romelia a pesar D. estar viuda está muy contenta D. trabajar conjuntamente con sus hijas quienes le ayudan en este negocio pero sin descuidar la escuela.

loans.use: To extend the local and install ceilings. To buy supplies. Ampliación del local e instalación de calaminas (techo).  Compra de insumos.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en: My name is Razia L. and I am from Lahore, a big metropolis in Pakistan. I am married and a mother of four sons and three daughters. My husband and one of my sons sell henna and hair oils to make a living. They have been in this business for more than ten years. These days it is a high season because of Eid (a Muslim religious festival) and weddings so the demand for henna has risen sharply. We need to expand our business so that we can earn better profits, which I plan to save to collect dowries for my daughters.

loans.use: Expand current business

loans.name: Nabweru South East 2036(Ii) Group

texts.en: Jalia is a 45-year-old widow with seven children. She sells raw foods in the market. She intends to pay school fees for the children and to cater for their other necessities. Aisha and Rehema both deal in secondhand clothes and they want to use the loan and add in more inventory. Prossy owns a beauty salon and she intends to use the loan to buy a hair dryer. Note: This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To purchase a used truck to transport the raw foods from villages.

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two children. She and her family live in Melitopol. Yelena sells household items and hats in the central city market. She is very serious and determined. Her great entrepreneurial skills and commitment to her business have helped her keep her sales high and costs low. The ability to give her customers what they want – such as high quality merchandise at reasonable prices – has helped Yelena keep loyal customers who come back over and over again. She has been in this business now for twelve years and currently has about $3,000 in inventory. Her working capital is about $2000 and her monthly profit is around $450. 
  
Yelena is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase more inventory. She is hoping to invest the money she receives into further business growth. We believe her passion for business, enthusiasm in customer service and marketing skills, together with financial assistance, will help Yelena expand her trade and develop a strong, competitive business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Roxanna

texts.en:
Roxanna is 26 years old and is a single mother of her 6-year-old son. Roxanna owns and operates a nail care center in the Zapotal community of Nizao. At the nail care center, she offers services in acrylic polish changes, American and French manicures and pedicures, etc. However, she also offers private services to customers who are too busy to go to her salon.

Roxanna plans to use this loan to buy materials such as nail varnish, artificial nails, files, and a special table for the business. She hopes that before long she’ll have enough money to design a comfortable beauty parlor. This way, the entrepreneur will be able to attend to her customers in a pleasant space, and she will in turn improve her family’s living conditions because her business will generate additional income.

loans.use: To acquire materials and products for a nail care center.

loans.name: Nuru

texts.en:
Nuru is 30 years old and is married with one child, age 8 years old. Nuru is a fish seller. She started in 2006. Every day, she works from 8:30am to 12:30pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Zurafo

texts.en:
Zurafo K. is 38 years old, and she is married with 2 children. In order to help her husband support their family, Zurafo operates her own business selling clothing for kids. To do so, she rents a store located in her home town. Each Friday, with her husband's assistance, she works from 5 am until late in the evening to sell her goods at the large market in the neighboring city. 
Currently Zurafo is planning to expand her business by purchasing additional goods for the summer season. With this purpose in mind, she is requesting a loan in the amount of $600 to be paid back over a 6-month term. Having already proven herself to be an honest and reliable client, Zurafo now promises to repay this loan in a prompt manner. Zurafo expresses her gratitude to everyone who has supported her and has thus allowed her to develop her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing new kids' clothing for the summer season

loans.name: Vali

texts.en:
A. Vali is 42 years old. He is married with four children. Vali sells foodstuffs like tea, soft drinks, bread, chocolates and different kinds of sweets. He rents a place for selling which is located in one of the local markets. Vali has been running his own small business for 6 years. His wife is a housekeeper and she takes care of their children. His son, who is pictured on the photo with him, helps Vali with serving the clients.

The business is the main source of income at the same time requires considerable funding. Vali works very hard to give his dear children a good education and to make them happy. In order to cover the higher education expenses of his elder son as he’s going to enter the university, Vali is planning to increase his working capital and thus increase the range of his goods. With this purpose he requests 2800 Somoni ($825) for the term of 9 months.

Vali thanks everyone for their support and promises to pay the loan on time. Vali is counting on your help. You can be an important part of the growth of Vali’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increase his selection of goods.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad, a 47-year-old married man, lives in the Southern Suburbs of Beirut. He is a taxi driver. Because of the high cost of living in Beirut, the low income provided by his taxi business is not sufficient to cover the living expenses of his wife and six children. Therefore, he has requested a loan of US$1,000 as a boost for him to open a small clothing shop to be managed by his wife to generate a second income for the family.

This is the second time Fouad has requested a loan from Al Majmoua. He successfully repaid his previous loan on time.

loans.use: Open a small clothes shop

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana, 64 years old, stills struggles day to day to improve her business. After experimenting with different activities she decided to remain with her spice stores, since it seems more peaceful to her and she earns 70 soles a week.

The experience she lived with her husband, from whom she later separated, was enough for her to remain single and dedicate herself to raising her four children that are now adults. With the loan of 1,700 soles, that Movimiento Manuela Ramos will proviD. to her and will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy sacs of ají panca (red chili pepper), yellow chili pepper, dried chili pepper, black pepper and cumin at wholesale prices.

Juana belongs to the “Señor del Cautivo II” community bank, and feels proud of having been able to raise her four children with her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana D. 64 años, aún lucha para mejorar día a día su negocios, después D. experimentar diferentes actividades decidió quedarse con las especerías, ya que le parece mas tranquilo y donD. gana 70 soles semanales.

La experiencia vivida con su esposo, D. quien luego se separó, le fue suficiente para que se quedará soltera y dedicarse a criar a sus cuatro hijos que ahora son mayores D. edad. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1,700 soles, que le otorgará el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, el cual pagará en 6 cuotas, comprará sacos D. ají panca, amarillo, seco, pimienta y comino al por mayor, los cuales molerá con sus máquinas.

Ella que pertenece al Banco Comunal “Señor del Cautivo II”,se siente orgullosa D. haber podido criar a sus cuatro hijos con su propio negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients at wholesale prices

loans.name: Ivonne

texts.es:
La señora Ivonne pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Lomas de Yarina, ubicado en  el Jr. Adolfo Lobo # 139, distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Ivonne tiene 36 años de edad, 2 hijos y su esposo es maderero. Con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la compra de madera.

En la actualidad, Ivonne, continúa trabajando junto a su esposo en la extracción de madera para luego venderlos. Ivonne y su esposo trabajan con cierta cantidad de personal en la cual viajan a diferentes lugares de los ríos para extraer madera.

Con el préstamo de S/ 3,000, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de combustible y víveres para que así puedan viajar a traer madera.

Ivonne está agradecida de Manuela Ramos por la oportunidad brindada ya que de esa manera puede apoyar a su esposo en los gastos de su familia.
texts.en:
Ms. Ivonne V. is a member of the Las Lomas de Yarina microfinance institute, located on Jr. Adolfo Lobo # 139, Calleria district, Ucayali department. Ivonne is 36 years old, has two children, and her husband is a timber merchant. She decided to invest her first loan of 300 PEN from Manuela Ramos in the purchase of lumber. Ivonne currently continues to work alongside her husband in logging and selling timber. Ivonne and her husband work with a certain amount of personnel when they travel to different river areas in order to extract timber. They will invest this loan of 3,000 PEN, which will be repaid in 4 months, in the purchase of fuel and supplies so that they can travel to different places and obtain timber. Ivonne is appreciative of Manuela Ramos for the opportunity she has been given because this way, she can help her husband with the family expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fuel and supplies

loans.name: Yagub

texts.en:
Yagub M. is 32 years old and lives in a small village in the Saatli region. He has a retail shop and supports his family with this business. Yagub sells spare parts for foreign cars, like Mercedes-Benz and Opel, and also sells food, such as pasta and some fruits. He has been involved in this business from 2000. 

Yagub has a great demand for his spare parts, so he wants to buy more spare parts to sell to clients. He also would like to purchase more goods to sell, such as cookies and candies. 

He is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to buy more spare parts and goods and t enlarge his shop to meet the requirements of his clients and increase the income for his family. Yagub would like to thank everyone for their trust and support.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and goods

loans.name: Sokhorn

texts.en:
Mr. Sokhorn Y., who lives in Moen Tra Village in Kandal Province, is a motorbike taxi driver. Because his motorbike is old, he is requesting a loan to get a new one. He hopes to thereby increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

Sokhorn is 41 years old and the father of two children who are attending the local school. His wife, Mrs. Sen Narith, presented on the right in the photo, is employed in a garment factory making only a small salary.

loans.use: To replace his old motorbike.

loans.name: Agip Cell A-Saidat Group

texts.en:
Saidat N. is a 48 year old widowed mother of 8 children aged between 30 and 2.5 years. Having been a hardworking cash crop farmer, she managed to raise some capital 3 years ago to start up a food joint/stall. This earns her a profit of 10,000UGX daily. For the success of her business, Saidat will use the loan to purchase the required utensils like saucepans, and foods like matooke, maize flour, and rice.

She works tirelessly towards attaining her ambition of owning a modern restaurant with classic custom made furniture, offering various continental and foreign dishes. With such an achievement, she will be in a position to provide her children with the best education.

loans.use: To purchase saucepans and matooke, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Tren Chan Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tren C. is the leader of a group of five people who live in Trapaing Mteas village in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells firewood. Her husband, Mr. Lum Thol, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Even though they work hard, they still earn less income than they need to provide a better life for their family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Tren C. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build a new house. She is 35 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom attend the local school and the third is still too young to go school. One member of the group, Vy S., was not available for the photo, so her husband is in the photo.

One member of this group has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The end-of-term loan client is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. EoT loans allow clients to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all AMK clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
La señora Pabla R. T. es viuda, ella vive con su hijo, ellos tienen viviendo 24 años en su hogar. La señora Pabla tiene un negocio de venta de artículos escolares llamado “Papelería Paola” el cual lleva en funcionamiento 5 años y es su principal fuente de ingresos.
La señora Pabla R. está solicitando un préstamo para comprar mercancías para que de esta manera su negocio esté más surtido porque ella tiene muchos clientes. Esto le ayudará a que sus ventas se incrementen y pueda obtener más ingresos los cuales serán necesarios para poder mantener a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pabla R. T. is a widow, she lives with her son, and they have 24 years living at their home. Mrs. Pabla has a business selling school supplies called "Papeleria Paola" which has been working for the past 5 years and is her main source of income. Mrs. Pabla R. is requesting a loan in order to buy merchandise to increase her inventory because she has high demand from her clients. This loan will help her increase her sales and obtain more profit to support her son.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Jorry

texts.en:
Jorry M., 37, is a resident of Sto. Niño Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro City. He is still single and is the breadwinner of the family who takes care of his 80-yr. old mother. In his effort to support himself and his mother, he had to find ways to earn a living and ventured into retailing business. 

For now Jorry needs additional capital for his Sari-sari store (a community variety store) and carenderia (food stall). He needs an amount of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional inventory for his store and kitchenware for his carenderia. He aspires to expand his food stall business and be able to accept catering services in the future.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for sale in his store and kitchenware for his food stall

location.town: Lapasan, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Kil's Group

texts.en:
The group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader N., 54, is the mother of five children: the first two are married and live separately, one works as a tour guide with an income of $30 per month, and the last two are attending school. She is married to Toek, 58, who is a labor worker in a private company. N. earns a living by selling porridge as a breakfast food. She is good at making a tasty porridge and she has a lot of clients coming to her store. N. wants to increase her selling in order to support the family better. So N. is taking a loan to buy more chairs and tables for her business. 

The other group members are: 
S., 24, a local labor worker who is applying for a loan to buy wooden poles for her house. 
N., 30, a machine repairer in a private company who is asking for a loan to buy the wooden slices of wall for her house. 
R., 55, also a machine repairer in a private company who is applying for a loan to buy fish for his wife to sell in the market. 

All of the group members live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy chairs and tables for her business

loans.name: Rufo

texts.en: Rufo, 38, is married with five children.  She has three years of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public two days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 300 Tala (~125 USD).  SPBD loans are Rufo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase items needed to maintain her business.

loans.name: Salvador

texts.es:
Salvador P. M. es un señor de 38 años de edad, quien vive con su esposa Virginia  y sus dos hijos Kevin y Kener,  en una pequeña comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Las Delicias de Upala, localizada en la Provincia de Alajuela. Ahí se desarrollan actividades como el comercio, ganadería de doble propósito (carne y leche), siembra de granos básicos: arroz, frijoles, maíz entre otros.

Debido a las pocas fuentes de empleo que ofrece la  comunidad, don Salvador se ha propuesto incursionar como microempresario en el área de la ganadería de doble propósito; con la que producirá carne, leche y sus derivados para vender  tanto en su comunidad como en lugares vecinos, que según su criterio, hay un excelente mercado ya sea por medio de venta a intermediarios o al público directamente. 

Asegura que su padre se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante mucho tiempo, por lo que lo ha podido experimentar todos los cuidados que demanda, además de la instrucción recibida por parte de su padre a lo largo del tiempo. 

Lo que en estos momentos solicita don Salvador es un micro crédito de ¢570,000 (quinientos setenta mil colones) a un plazo de 24 meses, para comprar tres vacas  más y así poder incrementar la producción. El es conciente de que contar con mayor número de vacas implica una mayor atención y cuidado. Sin embargo, el deseo de ser un microempresario exitoso y sacar adelante a su familia mejorando las condiciones de vida lo motiva a esforzarse con gran esmero.

Don Salvador es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo  préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Salvador P. M. is 38 years old and lives with his wife Virginia and his two sons, Kevin and Kener. They live in a small, rural community in Costa Rica called Las Delicias de Upala, in the Alajuela province. People in his community own shops, plant basic grains (including rice, beans, and corn), and raise cattle (for both meat and milk). Because of the limited sources of employment in the community, Salvador decided to become a small businessman. He raises cattle and sells its meat, milk, and milk products in his community as well as in the surrounding area. In his estimation, this is an excellent area of opportunity, as he can sell to intermediaries or directly to the public. Salvador's father has been in this field for a long time, and this has helped Salvador experience all the different aspects of the job. Over the years, his father has taught him a lot about this business. Salvador is requesting a microloan for 570,000 Costa Rican colones, to be repaid in 24 months. With the loan, he will purchase three more cows in order to increase production. He knows that having more cows will require more care and attention. However, his desire to be a successful small businessman, to get ahead and to improve his family's living conditions, motivates him to work hard and with great care. Salvador is a member of the “Empresa de Crédito Comunal Datraban” (Datraban Community Credit Company), one of the 100 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his second loan, and he hopes to continue growing both personally and economically. He attests that thanks to this type of credit organization he can spend more of his time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase three cows

loans.name: Felicitas Fortunata

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Amaquella que significa No Seas Flojo en quechua.
Felicitas es divorciada, tiene 65 años y 6 hijos, Felicitas tiene una bodega en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, golosinas, bebidas, regalos. Además Felicitas viaja a Andahuaylas en donde vende ropa de bebe.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa de bebe, azúcar, golosinas.
Felicitas sueña con ahorrar para la vejez.
texts.en:
Felicitas is a member of the Microfinance Institute called Amaquella, which means “don’t be lazy” in Quechua.

Felicitas is a 65-year-old divorced mother of 6. She owns a general store, which she runs in her home, in which she sells groceries, candy, beverages, and gifts. She also travels to Anahuaylas to sell baby clothing.

Felicitas needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing baby apparel, sugar, and candy.

Felicitas dreams of saving enough money for retirement.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby clothing, sugar, and candy

loans.name: María Fátima

texts.es:
En el Mercado Mayoreo de la ciudad de Managua, la señora María Fátima Q. se dedica a su actividad de venta de frutas en su propio tramo que ha logrado establecer a raíz de sus múltiples esfuerzos.

Es de importancia destacar que ella es una persona muy trabajadora que ha logrado salir adelante en sus ventas teniendo un gran deseo de superar aún más y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las frutas y de esta manera continuar ofertándolas para así bendecir a su familia que debe de mantener.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Fatima Q. sells fruits in her own section of the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua, which she has managed to establish through multiple efforts. It is important to note that she is a very hard-working person that has been able to advance in her business by having a strong desire to continually succeed, which is why she has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of fruits. With this loan, she plans to continue selling fruits in order to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia Cortina, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fruit

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
Claudia trabaja en un salón de belleza de empleada por las mañanas y por las tardes está instalando un salón propio, pero aún le falta equiparlo; es madre soltera de dos hijos de 2 y 6 años de edad y vive en la casa de su madre ubicada en la Zona Villa Esperanza de la Ciudad de El Alto.


El crédito lo destinará para comprar el equipo de su salón de belleza (dos sillas, blow dryers, peines, tintes) de esa forma podrá incrementar sus ingresos económicos.
 
Es el segundo crédito con Impro, el buen comportamiento de pago permite la aprobación el  préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Claudia works as an employee in a beauty salon in the mornings, and then in the afternoons she works in her own salon which still lacks some equipment. She is a single mother with two children aged 2 and 6. She lives in her mother’s house in the Villa Esperanza neighbourhood of the city of El Alto. The loan will be used to buy equipment for her beauty salon (two chairs, blow dryers, combs, dyes) so that she will be able to increase her income. This is Claudia's second loan with Kiva partner, Impro. Because she repaid her first loan responsibly, she has been approved for a second one.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy two chairs, blow dryers, combs for her beauty salon

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: La Señora María de los Ángeles M. tiene 39 años de edad. Su negocio es una pulpería. Y esta ubicada en su vivienda, María obtiene sus productos en camiones repartidores ya que tiene la facilidad de que los productos lleguen hasta su vivienda, ella vive con sus padres que ya son mayores de edad. María lucho para seguir adelante con su negocio a pesar de las dificultades de la vida. Tiene 1 hijo a su cargo, con condiciones especiales lo cual le demanda a mayor parte del tiempo y gastos económicos. Pero es una mujer luchadora y es por eso que ha podido sostener su negocio por más de 3 años con el apoyo incondicional de sus padres. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de golosinas, gaseosas, pan, jugos y refrescos naturales. El sueño de María es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de los Ángeles M. is 39 years old and runs a general store, which is located in her home. Maria has the products she sells delivered to her home. She lives with her parents, who are senior citizens. Maria struggled to move ahead with her business, despite life's difficulties. She has 1 child with special conditions, which demands a lot of Maria's time and financial expenditures. However, she is a fighter, which is why Maria has been able to sustain her business for over 3 years with the unconditional support of her parents. Maria is requesting a loan to purchase sweets, soda, bread, and juice. Her dream is to improve her family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn F. is from the village of Katipunan, Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. She is 35 years old. Jocelyn is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jocelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Jocelyn has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In August 2008, Jocelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jocelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Jocelyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Nhoem

texts.en:
T. currently owns a vehicle which he uses to provide a transportation service, while his wife stays at home making rattan furniture to earn a living. In addition, they always plant a variety of crops during the farming season. T. is looking for a loan in order to buy a cow which he will use to plow a piece of farmland. He hopes to raise this cow for calving in the future.

T. is a humble man, age 42, married and the father of five single children: two of whom are employed in different jobs, while the others are students and dependent on his income. T.'s wife appears in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for plowing farmland

loans.name: Tserendugjir

texts.en: Tserendugjir S. is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Kharkhorin, the capital city of the ancient Mongolian empire. Her husband works as a driver for the local electricity department, her son attends a local secondary school, and her daughter is a university student. Tserendugjir operates a small felt producing shop in the town along with 4 other people. Together they  produce a variety of felt products including slippers, bags, hats,  jackets and other handicrafts. The group uses only locally available materials  such as sheep and camel wool to make their products. Tserendugjir started her business in 2006 and has since found much success. She has taught all of her children how to make slippers and they help her during their school vacations. Tserendugjir is a very open-minded and responsible businesswoman and her dream is to one day have her own souvenir shop where she and other local handicraft makers can sell their products. She is requesting a 2 million tugrug (approx. $1,380 USD) loan to purchase wool processing equipment that will enable her to increase the productivity of her business and the quality of her products.

loans.use: to purchase wool processing equipment

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana L. is venturing into managing a hog-raising business. She believes that hog-raising is a good kind of business that would really contribute to her family. She is only 19 years old, very young, but despite her young age, she has the strong determination to cope with the difficulties of life.

She lives in Barangay Rizal West, San Isidro, Isabela. Ana works hard in order to earn more income for her family's needs. She is requesting additional business capital from Kiva lenders in order to have enough funds to buy the needed supply of feed for her hogs. Ana is requesting a loan amounting to PHP5,000 for this purpose. She would be very thankful if this amount would be granted by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional business capital

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La señora Verónica es casada y madre de dos pequeñitos, su esposo el señor Félix Horacio labora en una empresa en el área de técnico en mantenimiento desde hace 6 años. Ella es propietaria de un pequeño negocio de venta de quesos y chorizo desde hace 7 años.
Motivo por el cual esta solicitando este crédito lo cual es para la compra de mas mercancía.

loans.use: Inversion al negocio (compra de mercancia)

loans.name: Darling Aracely

texts.en: Darling Aracely R. M. is a single mother. Her son is six years old and has not yet started school. Darling is well prepared to run a business. In addition to completing her studies with a degree in business administration, Darling learned from her mom at an early age, about how to run a small business. Darling dreams of having her own store with a large inventory, and ultimately of being a successful business woman with a successful business. This loan will go towards the purchase of cosmetics and clothes for her store. Darling says that the only obstacles in her business are those that one faces daily, and she is extremely grateful to the people who help to support her business through these loans.

loans.use: Capital to buy inventory

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es: Elsa es una socia emprendedora y trabajadora, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 31 años, es madre de tres hijos menores de edad, ella se dedica al alquiler de motocarro, actividad que realiza junto con su esposo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Victoriosas” desde hace un año, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles que lo utilizo en la compra de frutas y golosinas para vender en su casa, en la actualidad Elsa necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que utilizará para comprar un motocarro de segunda mano. La meta de Elsa es tener una tienda de repuestos y accesorios para motos y motocarro.
texts.en:
Elsa is an enterprising and hardworking member. She lives in the city of Pucallpa in the Ucayali region. She is 31 years older and is the mother of three younger children. She is involved in “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) rental, a business that she does together with her husband. She has been a part of the “Las Victoriosas” communal bank for the past year. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she used for the purchase of fruits and candy to sell at her house.

Now, Elsa needs a loan of 1000 PEN, which she will use to purchase a second-hand “motocarro”. Elsa’s goal is to have a repair and accessory shop for “motos” and “motocarros”.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a second-hand "motorcarro"

loans.name: Mouskéba

texts.fr: Mouskéba S. est une femme de 61 ans, elle mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO depuis 7 ans et demi et y a bénéficié de 15 prêts. Avec son crédit elle achète du mil, le transforme en farine afin de préparer de la bouillie destiné à la vente. Ses bénéfices lui servent à participer au bien-être de sa famille
texts.en:
Mouskéba S. is a 61-year-old woman who is married and the mother of five children.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de KANDE BANETO for 7½ years and has benefited from 15 loans from it.  With her new loan, she's buying millet and processing it into flour in order to make porridge destined for sale.  Her profits allow her to contribute to her family's well-being.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering her small-scale business

loans.name: Concorde Plus Group

texts.fr:
« Concorde Plus » est une banque communautaire composée de 32 micro entrepreneurs dont Lutonadio N. est dirigeante. Ils se sont constitués sur base de la caution solidaire pour obtenir des microcrédits de la part de Kiva et de l’IMF HOPE RDC dans le but de développer leurs affaires.
Lutonadio N. a comme activité principale la vente de farine de maïs et de manioc dans la partie Est de Kinshasa. Elle a commencé cette cette micro entreprise en 1987. Elle a déjà bénéficié 4 fois les crédits de l’IMF HOPE RDC et a correctement remboursé. Elle compte avec le prochain prêt diversifier son affaire en y ajoutant des poissons salés dans le but d’accroitre son revenu. Lutonadio est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont leurs âges varient entre 6 et 19 ans. Cinq d’entre eux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
"Concorde Plus" is a community bank composed of 32 micro-entrepreneurs, including Lutonadio N., who is the leader. They established themselves guaranteeing one another jointly in order to obtain micro-loans via Kiva and the micro-finance institution HOPE RDC with the goal of developing their businesses. Lutonadio N. has a main business selling cassava flour and cornmeal in the eastern part of Kinshasa. She started this micro-enterprise in 1987. She has already benefited four times from HOPE RDC loans, which she has repaid properly. With the next loan, she intends to diversify her business by including salted fish with the goal of growing her revenues. Lutonadio is married and the mother of five children, ranging from 6 to 19 years of age. Five of them are in school.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify her business by buying baskets of salted fish to sell for boosting her capital

loans.name: Elsa Maria

texts.es: Doña Elsa Maria durante trece años prepara ricos plato de comida pues ha sido su fuente de ingreso para poder ayudar a su familia con los gastos de colegio como pagos de agua, luz. Su esposo trabaja como oficia del ejército de Nicaragua, procreo dos hijos los cuales cursan sus estudios. Por gracias de Dios junto con su esposo lograron terminar de hacer su casa pero falta mucho por hacer pero van poco a poco ya que todo esta caro y solo con los financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado ha logrado terminar sus proyecto ante. Con este préstamo comprara materiales de construcción como cerámica, piedra,  cemento para hacer el pantry en la esquina de la pared de la cocina que ya esta terminada muy feliz por este nueva mejora la cual dará mejor proyección como mejor vista para seguir haciendo su comida para la venta. Tiene planes de instalar una maquina de cocina industrial para elaborar tortilla y comercializarla con los súper, espera poder lograr este pequeño negocio para poder abrir fuente de empleo como mejor inversión para su familia. Espera seguir trabajando con los financiamientos que son la puerta al futuro de poder hacer cambio en cada familia de poco recurso mediante los préstamos.
texts.en:
For thirteen years Mrs. Elsa Maria has prepared delicious plates of food as a source of income in order to help her family with the cost of education including paying for water and electricity. Her husband works as a Nicaraguan army officer. They have two children that are in school. With the help of God, and together with her husband, she hopes to finish building their house. They have a long way to go but are progressing little by little. Everything is expensive and only with the financing from Afodenic will they be able to finish this project. With this loan they will buy cement to build a pantry in a corner of the wall in the kitchen that is now finished. She is very happy with the new kitchen because it gives her better accomodations in order to continue making food for sale. She has plans to install an industrial stove in order to make tortillas and sell them commercially to the supermarket. She hopes to be successful in this smaill business so that she has a small source of employment to use to invest in her family. She hopes to continue working with financing because it is the door to the future. These loans help to make changes for families with limited resources.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction materials such as stone, sand, cement and tile in order to build a pantry.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a forty-eight year-old married mother of three children, all of whom are in school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a fishing community in the central region of Ghana. Sarah works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family. She bakes bread and supplies it to retailers. Sarah buys bags of flour from nearby towns. She has been in business for ten years and wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other ingredients in bulk so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en: Mavis T. sells cooked rice with tomato sauce at Bantuma near Elmina.  Mavis has received a junior high education.  She is married and has four children. Her husband is a banker. Mavis has been selling cooked rice with tomato sauce since 2003. She supports her husband in the payment of utility bills, school fees and other family expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business to enable her to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase bags of rice and other ingredients.

loans.name: Irenea

texts.en: Irenea C. runs a sari-sari (variety retail store) selling food and daily use products in her community. She is 54 years old, married and has two grown up children. She is from the village of Digkilaan, Iligan City. Irenea has been in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Irenea joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Irenea is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her first loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa es socia del Banco Comunal Florecer.
Rosa es separada, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos, Rosa tiene un puesto en un terminal terrestre de la ciudad en donde vende cigarros y hoja de coca (que es utilizado por los campesinos como medicina).
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cigarro.
Los sueños de Rosa son que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of the Florecer Communal Bank. Rosa is 33, separated, and has two children. Rosa has a stand at the city bus station where she sells cigarrettes and coca leaf (which is used as medicine by the country folk). Rosa needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy cigarrettes. Rosa’s dreams are that her children become professionals and that her business grows.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cigarrettes

loans.name: Massa Victorine

texts.fr: cette femme, réside dans le quartier d'attiégou qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé, elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. elle exerce ce commerce depuis 2005 et contribue financièrement aux charges de sa famille, elle s'approvisionne au grand marché de lomé. son stock est en baisse ,elle veut se réapprovisionner raison pour laquelle elle sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour l'achat de céréales, 10 cartons de savons  , des produits de beauté, des laits , des bonbons,des biscuits et divers.
texts.en:
This is a woman who lives in Attiégou, an outlying neighborhood in the city of Lomé. She's married and the mother of four children. She's been running this business since 2005, and she contributes in supporting the family expenses. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. Her stock has decreased, and she wants to resupply. She's therefore seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy cereals, 10 boxes of soaps, cosmetics, milk, candies, biscuits, and various other items.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cereals, 10 boxes of soaps, cosmetics, milk, candies, biscuits, and various other items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 39 years old, married to a trader, and they are yet to have children. She is a hardworking woman and she is so determined to lift her business and family above poverty.

Florence owns a medicine stall where she sells medicines at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Rubina Kosar's Group

texts.en:
Rubina Kosar is from Borewala, a city famous for its shrines in Pakistan. She is married and the mother of four children.  For years she has sold medicines.  Her clients are clinics and medical shops in the area. 

Her husband is in the wood selling business, but despite his good intentions, he isn't able to meet the demand for wood because of a lack of money.  Rubina is requesting a loan to buy enough woods to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: Purchase woods in bulk.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna C. is from the town of Upper Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Myrna is married and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Myrna owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling peanut butter, snacks and some processed food like longganiza, hot dogs and more in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand the business

location.town: Nazareth, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
Reynaldo de 64 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Josefa Arguello quien se encarga del cuido de la casa, con ella procreo 2 hijos, los que aun viven con ellos: Jorge de 29 años de edad y Elda de 27 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de comida, y tiene una niña de nombre Elda de 9 añitos estudiando la primaria. Don Reynaldo trabaja para la Alcaldia de Juigalpa desde hace 9 años como policia municipal.  

Esta solicitando su 2do credito con el objetivo de hacer algunas reparaciones en su casa, pues es de madera y parte de ella se encuentra en mal estado y desea cambiarla, pues con esto daria un poco de seguridad a su casita.  

El mayor sueño de Reynaldo es poder tener una vivienda digna para su familia, con las condiciones basicas para que su nietecita crezca en un ambiente alegre.
texts.en:
Reynaldo is 64 years old and married to Sra. Josefa Arguello, who is in charge of taking care of their home. They have two children who still live them, Jorge (age 29) and Elda (age 27). Elda sells food and has a nine year old daughter, also named Elda, who attends elementary school. Don Reynaldo has been working as a municipal police officer for the City of Juigalpa for the past nine years.

He is requesting his second loan in order to make a few repairs to his home. His house is made of wood, but some of it is in bad condition and needs to be replaced in order to make his home more secure.

Reynaldo’s greatest wish is to have a decent home for his family that provides basic conditions so that his young granddaughter can grow up in a happy environment.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make repairs to his home by replacing the wood that is in bad condition

loans.name: Joan

texts.en: Joan D. is from the town of Sta. Josefa. She is 31 years old, is married, and has two children, her eldest child being only aged seven. Joan owns and operates a business planting and harvesting rice for sale. She has been engaged in her business for over seven years already. Joan joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Joan is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This loan will be her eighth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. About CEVI: Community Economic Ventures, Inc (CEVI) has increased its portfolio significantly over the recent years. Based in Bohol, they have numerous branches throughout the Philippines. In 2009, CEVI was awarded a CGAP silver award for transparency in social performance monitoring. CEVI not only provides credit for its clients but additionally savings, insurance, and training are provided through regular cluster group meetings. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Bahasa while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Para ayudar la comunidad

loans.name: Lukas Otieno

texts.en:
Lukas has been in the auto repair business in Naivasha town for eight years now.  He is 38 years old, married to Lucy Awino and they have one child.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend and this will be his second loan.  He used the first loan to buy a painting spray. He repaid the loan well and on time. With the proceeds from this loan, he plans to add more paint and paint mixers to sell in his paint kiosk.

In future, Lukas plans to grow the paint kiosk which is his secondary business. He hopes to become a major supplier of paints to the auto repair garages in town.

loans.use: To buy paints and paints mixers to sell in his paint shop

loans.name: Evelia

texts.en: Evelia A. is from the village of Camuayan, Balingasag, Misamis Oriental. She is 58 years old and is married with three adult children. Evelia owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month. In 2006, Evelia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Evelia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Florence Atieno

texts.en:
Florence Atieno Ochieng' is a business lady who runs a hotel (simple restaurant) in Nyamasaria. She started this business in 2006 in order to generate income and enhance the food available for her children. Due to the family needs she realized that being a housewife would not help the situation and she needed to assist her husband in meeting the family needs. She normally restocks on a weekly basis buying items at Kibuye market in Kisumu.

She would like a loan of Kshs. 20,000 to help her diversify her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to use the profit earned to buy a plot of land to construct rental houses to get income which will enable her to increase her socio-economic status. Florence is 32 years-old and the married mother of four children.  She lives in Kisumu.

loans.use: To increase her stock.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 36 años de edad, convive con su pareja, y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Ella vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa (ceja de selva), donde tiene su casa propia. Recuerda que en aquellos años anteriores su pareja no tenia trabajo alguno, solo tenían una pequeña parcela de cultivo de cacao, pero que en ciertas ocasiones solo lo servían para que cubra su canasta familiar, pero gracias al apoyo incondicional de sus padres, supieron sobresalir de esa etapa difícil. Hoy cultivan y comercializan en grandes cantidades a sus compradores más potenciales, de lo cual se sienten satisfechos con el producto que los brinda, desde luego que recibe buenas ganancias económicas por las ventas que realiza. Por lo general tiene ayuda de su pareja permanentemente y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus peones para que así lo faciliten en la extracción de producto final. Normalmente los vende en los centros de acopio de su propia localidad a un precio competitivo y sus planes a futuro es adquirir nuevas tierras, con el propósito de que pueda mejorar su calida de vida y la de su familia. Este es su decimocuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además esta contento con su banco comunal, ya que le otorga buenos resultados económicos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abonos con la finalidad de darle un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao.
texts.en:
Nilda, 36 years old, lives with her spouse and has got two children. She lives in the locality of Santa Rosa (on the edge of the jungle), where she has her own home. She recalls that a few years back, her spouse didn't have a job and they only had a small crop of cacao plants that in certain occasions could barely provide for her family. Thanks to the unconditional support of her parents, they were able to overcome that difficult time. Nowadays they cultivate and sell in large quantities to their buyers, who feel satisfied with the product that they are purchasing. As a result, the sales produce good earnings. In general, she receives constant help from her spouse and together they make a good team. Sometimes she receives help from laborers to help facilitate the final production. Normally she sells her product to the distribution centers in her area at a competitive price. Her future plans are to acquire new land with the proposal of improving her quality of life and that of her family's. This is her fourteenth credit with MFP. As such, she promises to continue fulfilling her payment plan. In addition, she is happy with her communal bank for providing good economic results. With the credit that she is seeking, she plans to invest in the purchase of supplies and fertilizers in order to properly maintain her cacao plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Tracy Quan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer to be used on her cacao plantations.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora S. is currently in the business of selling sugar, charcoal, cooking oil, fish and rice at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and jerrycans of cooking oil to sell.  Flora is 36 years old and is married with a husband that is a government worker. She has six children who all go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a permanent house for rent.

loans.use: stocking rice and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 43 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Faustino de 50 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La tienda de María es la primera en abrirse en su pueblo, desde las 6 de la mañana sus puertas ya están listas para recibir a sus madrugadores compradores, quienes sabiendo de la variedad de la mercadería que tiene en su tienda no dudan en comprarle, ya que tienen la seguridad de que van a encontrar las cosas que necesitan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus clientes y enterarse de las cosas que suceden en su pueblo, lleva 23 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es permanecer todo el día dentro de su tienda sin poder salir, pero sabe que todo sacrificio tiene su recompensa. Con el tiempo anhela hacer crecer su negocio y brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio.
