Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y espera poder pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy respetada debido al orden que le pone al grupo. Con los quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más productos para implementar mejor su tienda.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and is a very cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Faustino, who is 50 years old, and their 3 dear children to whom they wish to offer a better quality of life. María's store is the first to open its doors every morning. Starting at 6 am she is ready to receive her early morning shoppers who appreciate the variety of merchandise that she offers in her store. They don't have any doubts about shopping at her store since they are sure that they are going to find what they need. What she likes most about her job is talking with her customers and finding out what is going on in the village. She has been running her store for 23 years, however, the most difficult part of her job is having to stay in the store all day without being able to leave. She knows, however, that sacrifice has its rewards. In time, she would like to see her business grow and to offer her customers better service. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She expects to make her payments on time since she doesn't want to cause problems for the other members in her communal bank where she is very respected because of the discipline she brings to the group. With the five hundred nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting, she will buy more products to better manage her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more merchandise for her store

loans.name: Lutfiya

texts.en: A married mother of two, Lutfiya has worked tirelessly for the past seven years to develop her lump sugar production business in Kurgantyube central market. A resident of one of the impoverished areas of Tajikistan, Lutfiya is determined to provide the best standard of living possible for her family of four. With the spirit of a true entrepreneur, Lutfiya started this business at a young age in her parents’ house. As such, she has been successful in maintaining a stable growth in this novel business. Lutfiya is a woman of character and strength. Her determination and integrity have helped her to develop a strong reputation among her clients and her fellow entrepreneurs. Currently, Lutfiya is seeking a loan for 3,000 USD to purchase stable shelf ingredients for the production of lump sugar. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchasing ingredients for the production of lump sugar

loans.name: Soledad Sandra

texts.es: La Sra. Soledad vive en el Barrio Victoria en  casa propia en la cual tiene una venta D. abarrotes, ella tiene 4 hijos los cuales asisten al colegio los cuatro, su esposo trabaja D. eventual una Fabrica  y recientemente ha abierto un taller D. Tornería donD. recién le están conociendo los clientes, el préstamo que están solicitando es para abrir otra venta D. abarrote en la avenida porque hay una feria que se realizan los jueves y domingos, la Sra. Soledad es una persona trabajadora al igual que su esposo, son responsables y con muchas ganas D. superación. Estam muy agradecidos con la institucion por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Soledad lives in the Victoria neighborhood in her own house where she has a grocery store installed.  She has four children all of whom are in school.  Her husband works sometimes in a factory and recently opened a metal shop where he is just starting to be known by customers.

The loan they are asking for is to open another grocery store on the avenue because there is a small market that occurs there on Thursdays and Sundays.

Soledad is a hard working person just like her husband.  They are responsible and very much want to get ahead.  They are very grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Concerned Mothers Group - Kampala

texts.en:
Lillian K. belongs to the Concerned Mothers Group - Kampala. She is 39 years old and has four kids. It is now exactly one year ago that she embarked on her hardware-selling business in Zzana. With 960,000 shillings as monthly profits in this short period of time, the prospects of her achieving even better success are on the horizon, she happily divulges. With this kind of upbeat optimism, no one can go wrong in any aspect of life.  

From the perspective of business, Lillian has, in the course of time, been brought to terms with the fact that this pays dividends. The need for money to support herself and her family was the motivation for starting this business. Earlier, she was plying a clothes-selling business that she says laid the foundation for her in starting up this business. With this loan, she says she is going to increase her hardware stock for resale.

loans.use: The purchase of more hardware stock for resale

loans.name: Ann Myra

texts.en:
Ann Myra C. is from the city of Carmen Annex Ozamiz City. She is 32 years old. Ann Myra is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Ann Myra owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buy and sell personal products in the local community. Ann Myra has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Ann Myra joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ann Myra has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Ann Myra is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ann Myra from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Delfina

texts.es: Delfina tiene 41 años, vive al lado de su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa que es propia. Desde hace 17 años se dedica a la crianza de animales, ya que se encarga en la venta de estos animales, siendo previamente comprados a un menor precio y en etapa de desarrollo, para luego ser alimentados, hasta engordarlos y luego venderlos a un mayor precio. En tanto las vacas que tiene, extrae la leche para ser vendidos a sus vecinos, de esa manera obtienen ganancias extras. En ocasiones sus hijos la apoyan en la crianza de sus animales, de esa manera le facilita para que pueda cuidar de sus sembríos de papa, maíz y pastos, éste último que sirve de forraje para sus animales. A lo largo de estos años ha visto como se ha desarrollado su trabajo, y por tal, espera ampliar su establo, además de adquirir vacas y toros de buena raza. Es el crédito número 11 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece todas las personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita ya que le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de  sacos de abono para sembrar pastos y también una vaca de buena raza para lo cual el crédito será una parte de lo que necesita ya que la otra proviene de sus propios recursos.
texts.en:
Delfina is 41 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children.  She has been raising animals for 17 years.  She buys her animals at a low price and early stage of development to then fatten them and sell them at a higher price.  She also milks her cows to sell to her neighbors which earns her some extra income.  Sometimes her children help her in raising her animals which leaves her free to look after her potato, corn and grass crops.  The grass crops serve as fodder for her animals.  Throughout the years, Delfina has seen how her work has developed and she therefore would like to expand her stable and acquire cows and bulls of good breed.

This is Delfina's 11th loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and likes being part of her community bank because all the members are people who she knows.  They are responsible and very supportive of each other.  She thanks those who will help fund her loan since it will be very useful in making progress in her business.  She will use her loan to invest in buying sacks of fertilizer to grow fodder and also to buy a cow of good breed.  The loan will be part of the money she needs and the rest will come from her own resources.

loans.use: To buy a cow and sacks of fertilizer for her pasture

loans.name: Catherine Kisaru

texts.en:
Catherine Kisaru S. is  42 years old. She is married to Daniel S. and is a mother of four children aged between nineteen and four years old. 

Catherine is a business lady who is involved in selling foodstuffs; she has been doing this for the last ten years. She learnt about KADET from a colleague who is already a registered KADET  client. This will be her  first loan which she is planning to use to expand her business by purchasing more stock for her kiosk, which is situated at a strategic point in Narok town. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest into her business.

Catherine is a young, energetic and active woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially. She hopes to become a great business lady in the future.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more stock

loans.name: María Esther

texts.es:
María Esther tiene 39 años de edad, es separada y tiene dos hijos menores de edad con los cuales reside en el sector Mochumanos del distrito de Pítipo, una zona agrícola conformada por varias localidades pequeñas consideradas como zonas rurales, el lugar se encuentra en la provincia de Ferreñafe y se ubica a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace más de cinco años, ella cuenta con una parcela de cultivo de 1.5 has. En donde suele sembrar maíz, María cuenta con bastante conocimiento del manejo de estos cultivos y depende los ingresos que le brinde esta actividad para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Adicionalmente cuenta con algunas vacas de las cuales extrae la leche que producen para vendérselas a sus vecinos y a un acopiador.

María desea brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de maíz aplicándoles fertilizantes, pesticidas y riegos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permitan adquirir los productos que necesita, entre ellos gasolina, la cual utiliza para alimentar un motor que extrae agua de un pozo cercano.
texts.en: María Esther is 39 years old, separated from her husband, and has two young children who live in the sector of Mochumanos, district of Pitipo, which is a rural agricultural area consisting of various small localities in the province of Ferreñafe, an hour from the city of Chiclayo. She has made a living in agriculture for the past five years. She has a parcel of land of 1.5 hectares, where she usually plants corn. María has a good knowledge of managing these crops and depends on the income from this activity to make headway for her children. Additionally, she has a few cows whose milk she sells to her neighbors. María wants to tend to her crops by applying fertilizers, pesticides and irrigation. To do so, she is requesting a loan of 2000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to allow her to acquire the products she needs, which include gasoline to power a motor to extract water from a nearby well.

loans.use: Maintain corn crops

loans.name: Benkan Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkan, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans la ville de Konobougou, préfecture de Barouéli; Région de Ségou (quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font le commerce des fruits, des légumes, des condiments et des habillements.                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Benkan sont à leur deuxième prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des fruits, des légumes, des condiments et des habillements.                                                                          
SADIO D. s’approvisionne en condiments au marché de Konobougou avec les grossistes. Elle effectue ses  ventes sur place et à domicile, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 15 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce de condiments.
texts.en:
The women of Benkan Group are all married. On average, they are 40 years old and have six children. They live in traditional extended families in the city of Konobougou, prefecture of Barouéli, region of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know each other through ties of kinship.

They sell fruits, vegetables, food condiments and clothes. This is the second solidarity loan for the women of Benkan Group. They will use it to buy fruits, vegetables, food condiments and clothes.

Sadio D. gets her supplies of food condiments from the wholesalers at the market in Konobougou. She retails the condiments at the same market and from her home, for cash and credit, to a clientele made up of women and men.

She expects to make an average profit of 15,000 CFA francs a month, which she will use to pay the installments of the loan and contribute to social ceremonies. Any remaining amount will be reinvested in her condiment business.

loans.use: To buy food condiments

loans.name: Nazia's Group

texts.en:
Nazia has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner Asasah to improve her decorative embroidery business. She started this business part-time 10 years ago to share the financial burden with her husband, but now it has become a full-time job because she receives good number of orders every month which enable her to manage finances smoothly. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, colored thread, clothes and sketches in bulk for her business.  

She lives with her husband and 2 daughters in Multan which is a historic city of Pakistan. She owns a two room house there in the area of Samejabad. Her husband is a rickshaw driver and provides transport services to his clients and to school children. Her daughters are both enrolled in school and are getting their education. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she established good credit behavior and never missed any meetings. 

Note: “In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Nazia”.

loans.use: To buy embroidery material for decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Om

texts.en:
Om S., 31, is married to Rim, 33, and they are in the photo with their lovely kid. She has two small kids who live under her care. 

Her husband has been earning a living for many years by climbing the palm trees behind his house. Palm-tree-climbing jobs are very common for poor people who live in the commune. 

Om S. has a plot of farming land. She and her husband currently generate an income of approximately $5 per day. 

Om S. is looking for a loan to buy a few ladders to help her husband to climb the palm trees, and to buy a few small pigs to feed for selling.

loans.use: To buy a few ladders to help her husband climb the palm trees, and to buy a few small pigs to feed for selling.

loans.name: Maristela

texts.es: La Sra. Maristela, vive en la localidad de Sacaba, es muy conocida por su tienda de Barrio ya que es muy conocida por la variedda d productos que ofrece y por la buena atencion de la Sra. ya que es una persona amable, el negocio lo atiende desde sus 20 años de edad  se encuentra en un lugar muy céntrico ,es soltera  vive en la casa de sus padres tiene 30 años, el préstamo lo destinara para aumentar capital para surtir una variedad de productos, como Arroz, fideo, azúcar aceite y variedad de dulces, es una persona joven muy trabajadora su deseo es el poder comprarse una casita e independizarse, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Maristela lives in the town of Sacaba. She's very well known for her neighborhood store, which provides a variety of products and good customer service. Maristela is a nice person. She has run the store since she was 20-years-old, and it's very centrally located. She's single, 30-years-old, and she lives in her parents house. She will use the loan to expand her capital and stock up her store with various products, such as rice, noodles, sugar, oil, and sweets. She's young and hardworking; her goal is to be able to buy a small house and live independently. She would like to thank the institution for the support it has provided her.

loans.use: Purchase of rice, noodles, sugar, oil, and a variety of sweets

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Moeun M. is a 41-year-old who has been in the farming business for many years. Besides doing farming, she is good at making baskets at home to sell for extra income. She is a married mother of two children who are students in the local public school. She has a partner in her husband who helps her to plant crops as well as being a firewood seller, in and around Kompong Chhnang province. 

Moeun M. and all their family members still live in an old house that is frequently broken and their living conditions have been affected. To solve this problem, Moeun M. will take her loan to purchase wooden poles to build a new house. Moeun M. and her young child appear in the picture.

loans.use: To purchase wooden poles to build a new house.

loans.name: Satya Laksana Group

texts.en: Ni Ketut S. and all members of the group, Satya Laksana, got a third loan from MUK. The group still wants to join MUK until they can support their own capital for their pig businesses. Ni Ketut S. is a tenacious housewife. Even though she is now 63 years old, she still keeps the spirit to be a hardworking woman. Ni Ketut S. maintains two sows. A new one was purchased after getting the loan, at a price of Rp. 1,300,000, Ni Ketut S. and her husband hope to get more benefits after taking care of the sow. Every day she spends Rp. 10,000 for the kitchen and Rp. 200,000 for electricity and water.

loans.use: To buy a sow

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa owns & operates a business venture selling dairy products in the local community.  She has two years of experience in this business.  Epenesa needs a loan of WST 1400 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 300 talas or US $125 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Epenesa joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Epenesa's 2nd loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Jane Wangui

texts.en:
Jane has been practising farming in Njabini town for the last three years.  She is 33 years old, married to Bernard K., and they have one child.

Jane was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers.  This will be her second loan. She had repaid her previous loan of Kshs 20,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use this new loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Jane hopes to become a leading farmer in the Njabini area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is a married woman with no children. She lives in her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her young siblings. For the past four years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from a shop and also from her home to her neighbours. 

Juliet faces a major challenge in competition from other boutique operators in her area. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future. With the Kshs 20,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase cloth and thread. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and thread.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
This is 29 year-old Salamatu .  She is unmarried and has no children.   She has four other dependents, some of them help her with her business and the others go to school.  In 2009, Salamatu established her local food restaurant business. She began her business because she dropped out of school and found business as a means of livelihood. Working seven days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Salamatu requires a loan in order to buy more food. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Salamatu plans to build a house.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more local foods for her business.

loans.name: Piri

texts.en: Piri is 20 years old and is a single man. His family is an Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from the Nagorno-Kharabkh. They now live in the small settlement in Bilasuvar, which was built for IDP families. Piri got his start as a farmer in his parents' fields when he was 16. He is hardworking man and now he has four cows in his farm. He plans to expand his cattle-breeding business buying two more cows and balanced feed. He requested a loan of 1200 AZN for the first time from AqroInvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy two cows and feed.

loans.name: Xuan Tuan

texts.en:
Tuan, a 42-year-old single man, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. He has a cleaning business that cleans vehicles. 

Tuan requires a loan to purchase better equipment that will enable him to provide better services for his customers. He hopes that better equipment will permit him to work more efficiently and to attract more customers.

loans.use: to purchase better equipment to clean vehicles

loans.name: Mely

texts.en:
Mely is 49 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Mely has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. Mely is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Mely hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 52 years old and married with 4 children. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her store.

Elena has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, soap, biscuits, etc. 

In the future, Elena would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Linlingnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupement LINLINGNON est composé de trente membres qui vivent tous dans la même localité et qui mènent certaines activités ensemble. La présidente de ce groupement du nom de Étiennette, est celle qui a une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Étiennette est une veuve ayant quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont un n'est plus à sa charge. Étiennette vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs différentes charges. Étiennette n’a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Étiennette mène comme activité depuis une quinzaine d'année, la production d'huile de palme et de farine de manioc, qu'elle vend dans sa région. Étiennette s'approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter sa production et de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle de plus en plus nombreuse, Étiennette sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement LINLINGNON, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira ainsi à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en:
The group LINLINGNON is made up of thirty members who all live in the same locality and do certain activities together. The president of this group, called Étiennette, is the woman raising her hand in the photo. In order to raise the level of their businesses so that they can better respond to the demand of their clientele. this group is requesting their first-ever loan from ALIDé. 

Étiennette is a widow with four children, all enrolled in school. One of them is no longer her responsibility. She lives alone with her children and covers their living expenses. 

Étiennette only went to primary school. To support herself and her children, she has been producing palm oil and manioc flour for about 15 years now. She sells her products in her region. She buys her supplies in Bénin. 

In order to increase her production and better respond to the needs of her ever-growing client base, Étiennette is requesting, together with the other members of the group LINLINGNON, her first loan from ALIDé. This loan will help them to make more profit.

loans.use: to buy palm fruit and manioc.

loans.name: Jade Group

texts.es: Este grupo solidario se llama Jade esta conformado por las señoras Maria Guadalupe y Lourdes van a comprar con su prestamo harina,azucar, pintura, bolsas, aceite, lija, cinta canela para elaboracion de obleas, el señor Virgilio va a comprar harina, azucar, manteca y leña para la ellaboracion de pan, las señoras Carina y Ofelia van a comprar obleas por paquete para recortarlas, empaquetarlas y venderlas. La señora Maria Guadalupe tiene 38 años de edad, ella es casada tiene 4 hijos tres mujeres y un hombre, todos sus hijos estan estudiando, su hija mayor en bachilleres, dos en la secundaria y su niña mas pequeña en la primaria, ella elabora y vende obleas, ella solicito su credito para comprar harina, pintura, aceite, azucar, bolsas para tener todo lo necesario para su negocio, ella inicio su negocio hace 6 años, sus hijos estaban pequeños y habia carencias economicas, entonces su prima le enseño a preparar la mezcla para elaborar las obleas, su esposo le compra las maquinas de obleas y la materia prima con un dinero que tenia ahorrado, asi comenzo el negocio de obleas, a ella le gusta trabajar y ayudarle a sus esposo y tener dinero para vivir mejor, su negocio es importante porque tiene su porpio trabajo, tiene ingresos y le puede dar trabajo a otras personas en la elaboracion de obleas, ella se siente orgullosa de su negocio le ayuda a comprar algunos articulos para el hogar como su lavadora, la grabadora, sus sueños y esperanzas son que Dios le de vida y pueda construir una bodega especial para trabajar, comprar un carro para ir a vender las obleas, hacer creser su negocio, que sus hijos sigan estudiando y tengan su carrera y tengan un buen trabajo de gobierno. Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundacion Realidad "muchas gracias por pensar en las personas que tienen negocio y tenemos la necesidad de estos prestamos para seguir trabajando en nuestros negocios".
texts.en:
This group is called “Jade” and is composed of María Guadalupe and Lourdes.  They are going to use their loan to buy flour, sugar, food coloring, bags, oil, ribbons, tape and cinnamon to make wafers.  Virgilio is going to buy flour, sugar, shortening and firewood to bake bread.  Carina and Ofelia are going to buy wafers by the package to repackage in smaller amounts and sell.  

María Guadalupe is 38 years old, married and has four children: three girls and one boy.  All her children are in school.  Her oldest daughter is in high school, the next two are in middle school and her youngest daughter is in elementary school.

She makes ‘obleas’ (sweet made from two thin wafers stuffed with caramel) and requested the loan to buy flour, food coloring, oil, sugar and bags to have everything necessary for her business.  She started the business six years ago.  Her children were small and she had economic needs so her cousin taught her how to prepare the dough for the wafers.  Her husband bought her the machines to make them and she used savings she had to buy the raw materials.  This is how the obleas business started.  

She likes to work to help her husband and to have money to live better.  Her business is important because she has her own job, earn income and can employ others manufacturing obleas.  She is proud of her business.  It helps her buy some items for the home like her washing machine and the tape recorder.  Her dreams and hopes are that God grants her life so that she can manage to build a warehouse to work in, to buy a car to sell the obleas, to help her business to grow and that her children stay in school and attain careers and good jobs with the government.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad:  “many thanks for thinking about people who have businesses and need these loans to continue working in our businesses.”

loans.use: To buy flour, food coloring, oil, sugar and bags to make wafers.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 35 years old and is married with two children. She sells clothes to earn a living. Mary has managed to expand her business with financial support from Faulu Kenya.  She has also been trained on how to manage her business through seminars conducted by Faulu Kenya.

Mary is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. In the future, she dreams of owning a boutique.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Norma Petronila

texts.es:
Doña petronila tiene la edad de 50 años, de profesion docente de primaria, casada, su esposo labora como fotografo profesional, madre de tres hijos, el mayor trabaja.
Como objetivo ha sido la mejora  a su casa, que junto a su esposo han construido, y que se han esforzado mucho para hacer posible un techo para sus hijos, hoy en dia doña Petronila fue asendida  a directora del centro escolar, por su buena conducta, por su buen su trabajo, el cual esta sastifecha.
Lo que quiere hacer es un muro perimetral, y quedar dividido con el vecino sus tierras, ya que solo una parte tiene cerrada y la otra parte no, es por eso necesita comenzar el muro, el cual dara seguridad a su propiedad, el cual busca financiamiento en Afodenic, en donde comprara materiales de construccion en arena, bloques, cemento, hierro, piedrin, para comenzar su obra.
texts.en:
Doña Petronila is 50 years old.  She is a primary school teacher by profession, and her husband works as a professional photographer.  She is the mother of three children, the oldest of whom works.

Her objective has been to improve her house, which she built with her husband.  They have worked hard to put a roof over their children's heads.  

Currently Doña Petronila has been promoted to be Director of an educational center, as a result of her good conduct and good work, which she is satisfied about.

What she wants to do is build a perimeter wall to keep her land separate from her neighbor, as only a part is closed off and the other part is not.  This is why she needs to start the wall, which will provide her property with security.  She is looking for financing for Afodenic for this, so she can buy construction materials of sand, cinderblocks, iron and gravel so she can start her work.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to start building a perimeter wall to secure her property.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is one of our individual loan borrowers. She operates an underwear sales business. She buys underwear wholesale and sells it to different sellers. Alicia’s family consists of her four children and husband, but her children are already grown, so they are not living together with their parents. She said that her most difficult challenge is to keep improving her business, the economy is really not stable. She loves to work and especially to sell goods.

Alicia started her business after she had the option to start a business or stay alone all day at home. She started selling underwear directly to clients, now she sells to sellers. She took her first loan with Esperanza and started her business. After seven years and 13 loans, Alicia is now running an underwear wholesale business.

With her profits, she is planning to reinvest in her business, buy anything she needs at home and to support her children if they need anything (by saving money for the moment any of her child requests help). She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: to buy underwear

loans.name: Alaa'

texts.en:
Alaa' is a 30 year old young woman. She is married and has two sons, her husband is a branch manager in a Palestinian association with a decent salary. 

Alaa' wants to start a new project of her own to increase the family income and assist her husband in paying for their life expenses. She wants to open a beauty salon and wants to purchase a new beauty salon kit such as: chairs, mirrors, hair creams, different types of hair brushes, etc. Alaa' has an amount of money which is not enough to pay for these supplies. She needs to take a loan of amount $3,000 from FATEN. When Alaa' gets the loan which is to be repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase all of the supplies needed to start her beauty salon. This will enable Alaa' to start her project and increase her income to have better life conditions. Alaa' is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing a beauty salon kit.

loans.name: Munhbayar

texts.en: Munhbayar is 29 years old and lives with his wife and two kids in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia.  His one daughter is a student in elementary school and the other one stays at home with her mother.  He started his taxi service in 2004 with his car.  Now he wants to buy a truck for 6,000,000 MNT.  In order to buy a truck he'll sell his car.  He'll also sell 2000 seabuckthorn trees which he planted himself, for 2,000 MNT each.  He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "Now that the mining business is booming in Mongolia there's high demand for trucks.  With the income I want to build my own house."  He is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new truck for his taxi service.

loans.use: To purchase a new truck.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 
Erlinda has a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan for PHP 6,000 to stock more canned goods, snacks and beverages .
Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Mwanalima

texts.en:
Mwanalima is a single mother with one school going child.  She owns a house with neither electricity nor piped water.  Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

Mwanalima has operated a retail shop for the past 7 years; her clients are local villagers. She faces a major challenge of transportation.  She dreams of expanding her business.

With the Kshs 20,000 loan Mwanalima wants to purchase rice, maize flour and soap for her shop.  She decided to join Yehu Microfinance to access funds to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase rice, maize flour and soap for her shop.

loans.name: Neh Isabella

texts.en:
Neh Isabella is single and has four children, all over the age of 15. She lives in a five-bedroom apartment with her children at Ntamulung, Mezam in the  Northwest region of Cameroon. The death of her brother and mother are the major challenges she has faced in her life. Poverty and the unemployment problem facing her children also continue to make her unhappy.

Neh Isabella joined GHAPE in 2006 and has taken and repaid Empowerment Credit loans several times. She used the profit from her past loans to feed, clothe, provide medication for, and educate her children. Given a loan, she intends to invest it in poultry farming. She believes that this business will be a success because she has many years of experience farming poultry and also because there is high demand for poultry products. Neh Isabella thinks that this activity will help her community in that it will provide manure to farmers in her locality, it will provide employment, and also because it will increase the supply of chicken in the market, which will improve people’s eating habits.

With the proceeds from her loan, she will provide for her children and also increase her capital. She prefers a GHAPE loan because of the easy method of repayment, low interest rates, and also because of the regular education and training GHAPE provides to its members.

loans.use: to purchase fowl, buy feed, and pay laborers.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 34-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents, two siblings who are still attending school and four others working. With his siblings’ backing, he finds it much easier responding to his family needs and demands. He decided to start his own business as a constructor in 2006, after being involved in this domain for the previous ten years. 

Ahmad is working really hard to serve his customers as quickly as he can. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added materials for his business. This loan will facilitate his business operations. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects, outside and inside the country.

loans.use: to purchase added materials for his business.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is a 54-year-old married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She earns a living making and selling "bahalina" (coconut wine). She earns about 4,000 PHP from her business. Catalina works hard to support her family and send her children to school.
Catalina has requested this loan to purchase containers and other materials. She hopes that her children can finish college and that her family will have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase containers and other materials.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is 48 years old and lives in Buchanan. She is married and has seven children between the ages of 11 and 32. All of her children are presently in high school and college. For the past ten years, she has been selling used clothes in the market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used clothes for her business. Educating her children and building a house for them are in her plans for the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy another printer and bond paper.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
This is Delia, 51, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. Her husband is Armando, a contractor and father to her children. Delia, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Delia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages to residents of the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy a packet of shampoo, a few pesos' worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting her inventory at wholesale prices and then retailing them by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and members of the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue her business operations, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products she sells in her business. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. 

Delia hopes her business will grow into a mini-grocery. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell.

loans.name: Cristine Joy

texts.en: Cristine Joy is from the village of Zone II. She is 28 years old. Cristine Joy is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Cristine Joy owns & operates a general store selling a variety of different products in the local community. Cristine Joy has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately P 15,000 a month for these activities. Cristine Joy engage in grocery to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cristine Joy requesting a loan of P 50,000 to purchase additional products to sell.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional products like drinks, snack foods and coffee for her store

loans.name: Belive In God Group

texts.en:
John is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. John was born in Makeni city, 50 years ago. He is married to a trader and the couple has four  children who are attending primary and secondary schools. 

For many years now, John has been selling used clothes. With the help of this loan, John is going to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock of clothes.

loans.use: to buy bales of used clothes to add to his current stock of clothes

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 50 years old, married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Anita has a general store business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Anita has been in this business for three years. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
Mister Miguel has had his business in fruit sales for 15 years, he is married and has one child that is currently studying his university career. He decided to work on this business because the salary he earned while he worked for a company was not enough to cover his son\'s studies. On the other hand he had always liked sales, and he usually visited the local markets to sell. He requies a loan in the amount of $925 which will be used for the purchase of merchandise and to be able to expand his small business.

He has struggled a great deal to be able to provide his son a better education with the hopes of giving him a better future and patrimony. You can help Miguel in the realization of his goals. Make your decision and support him.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Miguel tiene con su negocio de venta de frutas una antigüedad de 15 años, es casado y tiene un hijo que se encuentra estudiando una carrera universitaria. El decidió dedicarse a esta actividad porque son el sueldo que ganaba como empleado de la empresa para la que trabajaba no le alcanza para poder costear los estudios de su hijo. Por otra parte a el siempre le han gustado las ventas, actualmente realiza su actividad en mercados rodantes. El requiere de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 925 DLLS , mismo que utilizará para la compra de mercancía y poder hace crecer como microempresario. El ha luchado mucho para poder brindarle a su hijo la mejor educación con el objetivo que el tenga un mejor futuro y patrimonio que el que hoy por hoy puede brindarle. Tú puedes ayudar a Miguel para el logro de sus objetivos, decídete y apóyalo.

loans.use: purchase merchandise

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is a responsible man. He is single and lives in Yenikand village of the Salyan region. 
He has a plot of land on which he grows vines and strawberries. 
He needs a loan of $500 to buy fertilizer and expand his plot of land.
He has 3 years of experience in this business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and expand his plot of land

loans.name: Kouassi

texts.en: Kouassi N. is a dynamic and brave 49-year-old woman who lives in Port Bouet in the south of Abidjan. Kouassi N. is a very good seamstress and has been doing her activities for more than 30 years. Kouassi N.,  whose kids' garments are appreciated, wants to make a stock of school uniforms for the September school opening season. Kouassi N.  is a widowed woman and has been able to cover her home expenses from her sewing activities for years. She got her first loan from AE&I in April, 2004 and has been a good performer.

loans.use: Kouassi Nguessan will use the loan to purchase a stock of clothes to make children's wear

loans.name: Thun

texts.en: Mrs. Thun M. is 59 years old and lives with her husband and their child in Phnom Penh. She works both selling brooms and renting rooms of the family's home. Her husband helps with renting rooms, and their family income is around $8/day. This loan will be used for Mrs. Thun M. to repair her home so they can continue renting out rooms. She hopes to continue with this business in the future because affordable room rentals are in high demand in Cambodia.

loans.use: Thun would like to repair her home for renting out rooms.

loans.name: Kausar

texts.en: I am Kausar B. from Okara, an agricultural area located in the heart of Punjab, the most populated province of Pakistan. I moved to my husband’s hometown two years ago when we got married. I have a daughter who is nine months old. I completed 5th grade and hope that my daughter will be able to complete her education. My husband works as a tailor at a store, but his salary is not enough to meet our needs. As our needs are increasing with time, he has decided to start his own business. He is planning to rent a store and purchase some sewing machines. We will pool in our savings and are looking for a loan of $175 to start this new business.

loans.use: To open a store

loans.name: Roz Mery

texts.es:
Roz Mery is 29 years old. She hails from a humble but hard-working line of craftsmen. Since she was a small girl she has made ceramic figurines. Now that she is married she and her husband Jose work from 5:00 in the morning to 7:00 in the evening making their varied and popular figurines. They hope to continue expanding the business and to export their wares, so they are asking for a loan to buy clay. With the proceeds from their craft they hope to finish their humble home and give their 4-year-old son Luisito a better quality of life. Please help this hard-working and talented young couple.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Roz Mery de 29 años de edad, proviene de un hogar humilde pero muy laborioso, desde niña se dedicó a la artesanía en cerámica, trabajo que heredó de sus queridos padres y que ahora satisfactoriamente desempeña junto a su esposo José.Ambos empiezan a trabajar desde las 5:00 de la mañana y culminan sus labores a las 7:00 de la noche, debido a que su mercadería tiene gran demanda por la calidad y variedad de sus productos. El deseo de esta joven pareja es seguir creciendo con esta admirable ocupación hasta lograr exportar sus trabajos.Requiere un préstamo de dinero, para adquirir materia prima (arcilla) para la producción de sus trabajos ; así mismo con los beneficios económicos que obtengan terminar de refaccionar su casita y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su querido hijo Luisito de 4 años.“Ayudemos a esta joven pareja a salir adelante con el talento innato con el que realizan sus bellos trabajos”

loans.use: To buy clay for making figurines.

loans.name: Mukhtaran

texts.en: My name is Mukhtaran B.. I am married and a mother of nine: five sons and four daughters. All of my sons and their father sell blankets and rugs on contract. Now they want to buy a stock of these items for themselves so that they can increase their income. We need to increase our income so that we can collect a dowry for our daughters and construct an additional room in our house.

loans.use: Buy blankets in bulk for the winter season

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana A. is an LAPO member. She sells bags of rice and beans. She is married with 6 children and she is 35 years old.

Christiana has been in business since 1994. She needs a loan of $600 to buy more bags of rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Nimia

texts.es:
Mrs. Nimia belongs to the "Women towards Progress" communal bank, located in Callería, Ucalayi in Peru. She is 41 years old, and has three children, two of whom are dependent on her, and she is separated. With her first loan from Manual Ramos for 300 Soles, she decided to invest in selling food.

Currently, she continues to sell food. She gets up very early to go to market and buy the products for selling food.

With this loan for $350, which she will repay in five months, she will purchase plates, cutlery, jars, vases, and serving dishes, and she will invest the rest in ingredients for making her meals.

Nimia told us that at first, things didn'g to well, but now her business is improving, and she feels happy, thanks to Manuela Ramos and all the support that they have given her.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Nimia pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres al Progreso, ubicado en Prolongación Cahuide Nº 107, Distrito de CallerÍa, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 41 años, es madre de 3 hijos, dos aùn dependen de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300 soles decide invertir en la venta de comida.

En la actualidad continúa vendiendo comida. Se levanta muy temprano para ir al mercado y comprar los productos para la venta de comida .

Con el préstamo de S/ 1,000 soles, el cual pagará en 5 meses, comprará platos, cubiertos, jarras, vasos, fuentes y el resto de capital lo invertirá en los ingredientes para la preparación de sus comidas.

Nimia nos contó que al principio le iba un poco mal, pero ahora su negocio está mejorando y se siente muy felíz gracias a Manuela Ramos por todo el apoyo que le brinda.

loans.use: Purchase of food prep items - plates, cutlery, jars, platters, etc.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer is the person sitting on the far right, and the others are members of his staff. Ebenezer is 35 years old, married, and the father of 4 children, 3 of whom are enrolled in school. He has been working in the sewing business for over 5 years. He specializes in the creation of pants and shirts. Ebenezer’s shop is located in a small village called Avetonou, about 120 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Therefore, he travels to the capital to acquire the fabrics with which he creates his clothing. Ebenezer desires to use his loan to acquire 2 more sewing machines to increase his business activity so that he can continue to meet the needs of his family and participate in the development of his community.

Ebenezer est la personne située à l’extrème droit et les autres personnes sont ses collaboreurs. Ebenezer est agé de 35 ans, marié et père de 4 enfants dont 3 sont sur les bancs de l’école. Il opère dans la couture depuis plus de 5 ans. Il est specialisé dans la création de pantalons et de chemises. L’atelier d’Ebenezer est situé à Avetonou, un petit village situé à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Donc, il va souvent à Lomé pour acquerir les tissus à partir desquels il confectionne ses vêtements. Ebenezer désire avec les fonds dont il bénéficiera acquérir 2 machines à coudre pour améliorer son activité afin de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et participer ainsi au développement de sa communauté.

loans.use: To buy 2 sewing machines

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Mr. Sokha S. and his wife have been married since 1994. They have three children: one son and two daughters. Two of their children are in school, while the youngest one stays at home. The family lives about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mr. Sokha has been in the business of grocery sales for over a year. He buys grocery items from a market in Phnom Penh for resale at his shop. Thanks to the business, he earns between 10,000 and 20,000 riel per day. His wife works as a garment factory worker.

Mr. Sokha is now requesting a loan of US$1,000 to purchase a motorbike for family use and to buy grocery items for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of a motorbike for family use and of grocery items for resale

loans.name: Supik

texts.id:
With her sailor husband being home only once every 3 months, forced Supik to work. Every day she sells yellow cooked rice around the city using a motor cycle. Besides finding buyers, she also has permanent customers who buys her cooked rice sales. Obtained profit is only enough to pay for daily expenses, not able to be saved. That is why she is expecting the loan for business capital, so that when her business could expand, she could save to pay for her child Nurhadi schooling expenses. With her child, Supik now lives in Mertasari street, Denpasar by renting a room.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Pekerjaan suaminya sebagai pelaut dan hanya pulang sekali dalam 3 bulan membuat Supik juga ikut bekerja. Sehari-harinya dia berjualan nasi kuning keliling menggunakan sepeda motor. Selain harus mencari pembeli, dia juga sudah memiliki pelanggan tetap yang membeli nasi jualannya. Keuntungan yang didapat hanya cukup memenuhi kebutuhan hidup sehari-hari, belum bisa untuk ditabung. Oleh karena itu dia berharap mendapat pinjaman modal usaha, sehingga nanti usahanya bisa lebih berkembang dan bisa menabung untuk membiayai sekolah anaknya Nurhadi. Bersama anaknya, saat ini Supik tinggal di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar dengan menyewa sebuah kamar kost.

loans.use: To increase business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Bahriddin

texts.ru:
Bahriddin T. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 20 years old and has a high school education. Bahriddin lives with his pensioner parents. He has been raising livestock for more than 3 years. This business is the sole source of income for his family. Bahriddin purchases small calves at the market, fattens them for 45 days and sells them at the market at a favorable price. He plans to purchase two calves to fatten and needs a loan to do this. After discussing it with his family, Bahriddin decided to take out a loan for a 9 month period.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Тухтаев Бахриддин житель района Вахш. Возраст 20 лет, образование среднее. Бахриддин живет с родителями-пенсионерами. Он более 3 лет занимается животноводством. Эта деятельность является единственным источником дохода его семьи.Клиент покупает на рынке молодых бычков , откармливает их в течении 45 дней и продает на рынке по выгодной ему цене. В данный момент он планирует купить 2-х бычков для откормки.Для чего ему нужны деньги,посоветовавшись с семьей клиент решил взять кредит сроком на 9 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr:
Kodzo B. is 35 years old and a married father of 3 children, all of whom attend school. He lives in Assahoun, a village located approximately 50 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. He has been working as a motorcycle taxi driver for more than 3 years and successfully provides for his family with the income that he earns. Kodzo would like to improve his business by buying a new motorcycle with the loan he will receive from FECECAV. The fruits of his labor will allow him to improve the lifestyle of his family.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer.

Kodzo B. est âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants tous à l’école. Il habite à Assahoun, un village situé à environ 50 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il est conducteur de taxi moto depuis plus de 3 ans et arrive à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille par les revenus de son activité. Kodzo souhaite améliorer son activité en achetant une nouvelle moto par le crédit qu’il bénéficiera de FECECAV. Les fruits de son travail lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: The purchase of a new motorcycle

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en: Ibrahim has been in this business for 5 years. He transports agricultural produce with his car. He is married and has 2 children. Ibrahim is is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Agdam region in the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He has settled in Khirdalan town. Now he needs a loan of $1200 to buy spare parts for improving his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
La señora Norma pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Talentosas, ubicado en el Jr. Atahualpa Nº 1038, distrito de Callería, departamento de Ucayali. Norma tiene 43 años de edad, es madre de 2 hermosos hijos y está felizmente casada, su esposo se dedica al trabajo administrativo de una empresa. Tiene 5 años trabajando con el banco comunal de Manuela Ramos y con el primer préstamo que recibió de Manuela Ramos de S/. 300, decidió invertir en la venta de comida.

Norma alquila un mini departamento y se dedica a la venta de ropa y también trabaja en una imprenta haciendo recordatorios.

Con el préstamo de S/.2,300, el cual será pagado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa como 2 docenas de pantalones, 2 docena de polos, 3 docenas de blusas y zapatos para damas, también mejorará la infraestructura de su mini departamento.

Norma se siente muy agradecida porque se le dio la oportunidad de acceder a un crédito, el cual puede utilizar para invertir y con ello mejorar su estabilidad económica. Ahora puede contar con su propio capital.
texts.en:
Norma belongs to the communal bank “Talented Women”, located in the Callería district of Ucayali. Norma is 43 years old, the mother of two beautiful children, and is happily married. Her husband works as an administrator at a company. She has been working with Manuela Ramos for five years, and with the first loan of 300.00 soles that she received from Manuela Ramos she decided to invest in the sale of food.

Norma now rents a small store and dedicates herself to clothing sales. She also works at a printing shop making cards.

With the loan of 2,300.00 soles, to be repaid in four months, she will invest in purchasing clothes such as 2 dozen pairs of pants, 2 dozen tops, 3 dozen blouses and women’s shoes. She will also make improvements to her store.

Norma feels very thankful because she was given the opportunity to access credit, which she can invest in such a manner as to improve her financial stability. Now she can rely on her own capital.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in the purchase of clothing, as well as making improvements to her small store.

loans.name: Chann's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Chann L., 26, is a single man and sells wooden cutting boards. The boards are used widely to chop meat during meal preparation. Chann lives with his 51-year-old mother who has been a farmer since 1990, earning approximately US$1.00 per day.

Chann has a gasoline-powered machine that he uses to make the cutting boards. Because of growing customer demand, he needs to increase his inventory of boards. A loan of US$50 will allow him to purchase more gasoline to use in his machine to increase his productivity. Chann hopes that the loan will increase his income to sustain his family's daily living expenses.

Mr. Chann is the group leader that includes two members who will jointly repay the Kiva loan. Mrs. Dy P., 46, is a farmer. Dy is requesting a loan of US$50 to buy an oxen cart for transportation to the market. Mr. Nhon N., 23, sells chopped wood. He has an old oxen cart and now needs a loan of US$50 to purchase a new cart to transport wood to the market. Included in the photo is Mrs. Dy P.'s husband.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline to increase productivity of a machine used for making cutting boards

loans.name: Azra Mai Abdul Razaq Group

texts.en:
Azra Mai baji is the wife of A. R. and resides in a city named Shah Rukn, Pakistan. Shah Rukn city is famous for its holy places and tombs. People often go there to visit these places. She is the mother of one son whose name is Akbar Suleman. His age is 16 and he does not have a job or go to school.

Azra baji’s husband and she are involved in a business of knitting clothes. They started this business in the past 15 years. First they started taking orders within their community and then they started taking orders from outside the community. Azra baji is applying for a loan to buy knitting tools and thread to fill the orders of their customers.

She is joined in her loan group by another member. Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy material (clothes, colored thread, and sketches) to make embroidered dresses.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed between the two group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other member is responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for knitting clothes

loans.name: Leo

texts.es: Leo tiene 22 años es soltero, vive de forma independiente en la casa de sus padres. Se dedica desde hace un año a la venta de cigarros, los cuales vende de forma ambulatoria en la ciudad de Puno. Leo siempre ha tratado de sobresalir y forjarse un futuro, pese a su juventud, su pensamiento es muy maduro y tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por eso que le pone tanto empeño a su trabajo, el cual le viene arrojado buenas ganancias. Leo se encuentra en el primer préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado incrementará su mercadería, así quiere obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Leo is 22 years old, single, supports himself and lives in his parent’s home. For a year he has sold cigarettes, which he sells as a street vendor in the city of Puno. Leo has always aimed to be successful and forge a future for himself. In spite of his youth, his thinking is very mature and he has great desire to be successful and therefore he puts a lot of effort into his work which in turn provides him good income. This is Leo’s first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he will increase his merchandise and in this way obtain greater earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the merchandise he sells

loans.name: En

texts.en: Mr. En I. lives in the village of Krodas Khor in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns 1 hectare of land on which he cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Vun Phol, raises pigs. Her business is doing well, and she wants to expand it. Mr. En I. decided to ask for a loan to buy eight more piglets for his wife's business. He hopes to increase income and improve family living conditions with this loan. He is 40 years old. The couple has three children who attend the local school. His wife appears in the photo with hI..

loans.use: To  buy eight piglets for breeding

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
Clementina se encarga de atender un puesto en el mercado donde, además de vender frutas, también vende jugos y bebidas. El negocio hoy en días ya tiene diez años. Empezó solamente vendiendo frutas pero como se dio cuenta de que no había nadie que vendiera jugos, ella se animo a hacerlo dos años después.

La idea de tener un trabajo propio nació a raíz de que tuvo problemas en sus estudios universitarios. Cursando la carrera de Nutrición se dio cuenta que no podía continuar estudiando, ya que tenia problemas económicos. 

Con un puesto alquilado y trabajando de seis de la mañana a ocho de la noche es como Clementina se gana la vida, con el fin de mantener a sus dos menores hijos. Dentro de poco piensa mudar su local a otro lugar con mayor tránsito.
texts.en:
Clementina is in charge of managing a market stall where, in addition to selling fruits, she carries juices and beverages. The business has now existed for ten years. She only started out selling fruit but realized that there was no one selling juices and was encouraged to do so two years later. The idea of having her own job was thought up of when she was having problems with her university studies. She was pursuing a career in Nutrition when she realized that she could not continue studying because she had financial problems. With a rented stall and working from six in the morning to eight at night, Clementina makes a living in order to maintain her two younger children. Soon she is thinking of moving her location to another area with greater traffic.

Translated from Spanish by Carrie Ting, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase kitchen utensils for her juice stand

loans.name: Phem

texts.en: Phem S., 53, is married and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She works on her rice field and earns approximately $2 per day. Her husband is the local doctor in the village and earns $4 each day Mrs. Phem S. requests a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike for commuting to work. The rest of the loan will be used to purchase medicine.

loans.use: Purchase a motorbike for commuting and medicine

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.en:
Marhabo is a very hardworking woman. She tries to make more money for the family by working hard each day. About 16 years ago, she decided to start raising and selling animals. This is the way she pays for the education of her three children who have high hopes for their future. She raises calves and sheep and later sells them at the markets, according to her clients' demands. She prepares them so they are ready to eat for the eating pleasure of the people in her country. Since Marhabo aspires for a great future, she decided to expand her business with the sole purpose of improving her family living conditions and to help pay for her children's education so that they can one day become good citizens in society. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase small cattle to expand her business

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en: Anecia, 49 years old, is married and lives in Tubod, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She has one child who is married. Her husband is a farmer. She inherited from her parents the coconut land her husband is tilling. She also raises chickens, ducks and pigs. She's been a Paglaum member for five years. She has had several loans already. Now, she is applying for PHP 14,900 to buy feed and piglets. She hopes to expand her business into a piggery someday.

loans.use: To buy feed and piglets

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Doña Nidia C. M. es una señora de 54 años de edad. Vive con su esposo, sus tres hijos: Ivania, Esteban y Miguel y con un adulto mayor, en una comunidad rural de Costa Rica llamada Mollejones de Platanares, Pérez Zeledón. Mollejones es una comunidad ubicada a 150 kilómetros al sur de la Provincia de San José, la capital de Costa Rica. Se encuentra a 850 metros  sobre el nivel del mar. Ahí se cultivan hortalizas, café y además se desarrollan otras actividades como la crianza de ganado de engorde y de cerdos. Existen también algunos proyectos de agricultura orgánica y hortalizas en hidroponía. Además de la agricultura en la comunidad hay talleres mecánicos, un supermercado, pequeños restaurantes (sodas) y una mueblería.

Desde hace 15 años que doña Nidia inició un negocio de confección de ropa. Ella elabora diferentes tipos de prendas de vestir que luego vende en negocios de la comunidad y sus alrededores o incluso la llegan a buscarla a su casa. Su microempresa ha ayudado a que la condición de vida de su familia haya mejorado considerablemente. 

Actualmente doña Nidia requiere un préstamo de ¢500.000 (quinientos mil colones) para comprar una máquina  especial para coser y materiales como telas, hilos, etc. Con esta inversión espera poder incrementar su producción y mejorar la calidad de los  productos. Afirma que gracias a este préstamo podrá ofrecer más y mejores opciones para sus clientes actuales y potenciales.

Doña Nidia forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Como socia ha recibido un total de 4 micropréstamos que le han permitido crecer como empresaria y atender las necesidades de su hogar, siendo todos éstos repagados exitosamente.
texts.en:
Nidia C. M., 54, lives with her husband and three children; Ivania, Esteban, Miguel, and another adult. She lives in the Mollejones de Platanares Pérez Zeledón rural community in Costa Rica. The Mollejones community is located 150km south of San José, the capital of Costa Rica, at 850m above sea level. Some local farmers grow vegetables and coffee while others raise pigs, among other activities. There are also some organic farming and hydroponic vegetable projects. Apart from agriculture, the community has auto shops, a supermarket, small restaurants and a furniture store. Fifteen years ago Nidia started her business of making clothes. She makes different types of clothing that she later sells in and around the community. Some customers come to her house. Her micro business has helped considerably to improve her family’s living conditions. Nidia needs a loan of $900 (500,000 CRC) to buy a special sewing machine and materials like fabric, thread, etc. With this investment she hopes to be able to increase her production and improve the quality of her products. Thanks to this loan she will be able to offer her current and future customers greater options. Nidia is parte of the Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Bancruce, one of the 100 organizations associated with EDESA in Costa Rica. As a member she has received 4 micro loans that have allowed her to grow as a business woman and to be able to take care of her household necessities. She successfully repaid all of her loans.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sewing machine and material

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana es socia del Banco Comunal Cielo.
Ana es casada, tiene 26 años y 2 hijos, Ana tiene cabinas de internet en un local alquilado, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hermana, además vende golosinas y artículos de librería.
Ana necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de memorias.
Los sueños de Ana son mejorar su negocio, tener otra sucursal y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Ana is a partner of "Banco Comunal Cielo".

She is married, 26 years old, and has 2 children. Ana, with the support of her sister, has an internet café in a rented facility and she also sells candy and stationary.

Ana needs a loan of 1000 soles to be invested in upgrading computer memories. It is Ana's dreams to improve her business, set up a branch and have her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Upgrade computer memories.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio tiene 46 años, es un padre que siempre se esforzó por darle lo mejor a sus hijos, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Se dedica a la fabricación de artesanías, desde muy joven aprendió esta labor y ahora teje de todo; desde chompas, chalinas, ponchos, chullos (prenda que se usa en la cabeza), etc. Luego de elaborar estas prendas las distribuye en los distintos puestos de venta de las ferias de la ciudad de Juliaca. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y espera para más adelante tener su propio puesto de artesanías, donde él mismo pueda vender los tejidos que realiza. Lo que no le agrada es transportar sus tejidos hasta las ferias, ya que le resulta muy cansado y costoso, aun así sabe que es parte de su trabajo y que tiene que afrontarlo y salir adelante cueste lo que cueste. Este es el tercer préstamo de Antonio con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si quiere acceder a otro préstamo, en su banco comunal es un socio muy cumplido y activo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para fabricar una mayor cantidad de tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 46-year-old father, and home owner, who has always tried very hard to give his children the best. His greatest desire is to improve his family's quality of life. He makes handicrafts for a living, a skill he learned as a young boy. Nowadays he can weave anything from sweaters to scarves to ponchos to hats, etc. After making these articles of clothing he distributes them to various stalls to sell at the fairs in Juliaca. What he likes most about his job is weaving. He’s been doing this for 16 years and hopes to have his own stall to sell his handiwork in the future, where he himself can sell what he makes. What he doesn’t like is transporting his work to the fairs since it’s very tiring and costly, even though he knows that it’s part of his job and he has to do it to get ahead no matter what it takes. This is Antonio’s third loan with MFP. He knows that he has to pay his installments back on time if he wants to receive another loan from his communal bank. He is a very reliable and active member of the bank. He will buy more wool to make a better quality product with the thousand soles he is asking for.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de lana

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es: El señor Juan Ramón C. , tiene la edad de 45 años, habita en el barrio San Caralampio en la comunidad de Ticuantepe , él es soltero , a su cargo tiene tres hijos , de 18 ,17 y 13 años , todos varones ; ellos estudian su secundaria y en tiempos libres ayudan a su papá , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida , don Juan desde hace quince años se dedica a la agricultura , la mayor dificultad que se le presenta es la falta de financiamiento a la vez la sequilla en ocasiones . Con el préstamo obtenido va a comprar fertilizantes e insumos para obtener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Señor Juan Ramón C. is 45 and lives in the neighborhood of San Caralampio in Ticuantepe. He is single and has three sons, who are 18, 17, and 13. They are in secondary school and help their father in their spare time. His plans for his family are to improve their living conditions. The biggest difficulty he faces is the lack of financing and at times drought. With this loan, he will buy fertilizers and supplies to produce a good crop so he can sell it for a better price at market.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase supplies and fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Remi

texts.en: Remi sells foodstuffs and she also grinds pepper, tomatoes and beans in her shop. She is 45 years old and married with five children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza P. is from the town of Benoni in Mahinog Camiguin. She is 40 years old. Analiza is married and has 2 adult children.
