To make a living, Analiza owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop where she sells many different products in his local community. Analiza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In April 2009, Analiza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Analiza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from HSPFI. Analiza is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Analiza's second loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Shamim Akhtar Khalid Hussain Group

texts.en:
Shamim akhtar baji has been a citizen of Vehari, Pakistan, for the past 25 years. Her husband deals in timber and sells in the local community and other areas. He has eight years of experience in this business. Shamim baji is the leader of this group. The group members are very happy with her because of her good behavior. Shamim baji is applying for a loan to buy timber to expand her husband’s business.

Sajida baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle).

Zubaida khanum baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (eggs and breads) for reselling.

Naseem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy timber to sell.

Manzooran baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. Note: In this photo Shamim baji is seated in the middle of the bajis and is showing one of the member's groceries.

loans.use: To buy timber to sell

loans.name: Mrs. Vith Daet Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The Mrs. Vith D. Village Bank Loan group consists of nine people and is located in Prey Mul village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Vith D. has been selected by the members as the village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land on which she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Soth Soeun, is a fisherman. He wants to expand his fishing business to earn more income for his family. In order to help him increase his business, Mrs. Vith D. has decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets. The couple have four children, two of whom are enrolled in the local school, and two others who are too young to work or study.

Three members in this loan group have end-of-term loans and are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more fishnets

loans.name: Pathan

texts.fr: pathan M. est une ancienne societaire tres active de la caisse de baye laye.elle capitalise une grande experience dans la commercialisation d'huile de palme de poissons seches.elle sollicite un credit de cinq cent mille car elle voyage regulierement sur la casamance pour se procurer ses produits.elle apporte un grand soutient a sa famille.

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Jobel

texts.en:
Jobel G., 41 years old owns a number of lights, fertilizers, and amplifiers. He has three children, 8 years the eldest who are all studying in school. People are renting his lights, amplifiers and other disco utilities which eventually gives him income to rpovide food, clothng and  other basic needs in their family.

He would like to request a loan of Php 25,000 from Community Economic Ventures. He will use the loan to buy  additional speakers, ligts and amplifiers to improve his services.

loans.use: Buy additional speakers, ligts and amplifiers

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es: El señor  Luís D. de 54 años de edad, vive en la 14 de Septiembre frente a la Iglesia Católica, su señora esposa es modista, con dos hijos de 17 y 24 años de edad, el mayor trabaja, y el otro estudia. Don Luís en su trayectoria de vida a trabajado como sastres en su casa de habitación junto con su esposa de la misma profesión el cual ha sido de mucha ayuda para poder lograr sacar los pedidos en su tiempo acordado de los clientes, cuando inicio lo hizo con fondos propios y con poca clientela pero luego Iván logrando tener mejores clientes. Gracias a la ganancias ha logrado mejorar su vivienda y sobresalir a delante con su familia, opto por prestamos en Afodenic el cual es su cuarto ciclo en el cual comprara telas variadas, Ciper, hilos, y otros para mejorar su trabajo y vender mas ya que también hace cortinas, juegos de sabanas para entregar. Agradece a la institución por hacer posible agrandar su trabajo ya que gracias al financiamiento podrá expandirse mas en la costura
texts.en:
Sr. Luís D. is 54 years old and lives in the September 14 neighborhood in front of the Catholic Church. His wife is a dressmaker and they have two children (ages 24 and 17). The older child is working while the other is a student. In his career as a tailor, Don Luís has worked with his wife from home in the same profession. They help each other with completing customer orders on time. They started their business using their own money and over time Don Luís was able to acquire good customers. Thanks to their earnings, he and his wife have been able to make improvements to their home and help their family get ahead.

Don Luís is currently on his fourth loan cycle with AFODENIC and will use the proceeds to buy various fabrics, threads, and other materials needed to improve his work and sell more items, such as custom made curtains and bed linens. He thanks the Institution for providing the financing that made it possible to expand his business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric, thread, and other materials

loans.name: Celedonio

texts.es:
Celedonio tiene 30 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y alegre, vive en su propia casa y lo que más desea es sobre salir en la vida. Para Celedonio los días de trabajo comienzan muy temprano por la mañana, cuando junto a su motocarro sale en busca de pasajeros para transportar, él es muy atento con sus pasajeros y siempre está pendiente de ellos, ya que desea darles muy buen servicio, para cuando lo vean de nuevo tomen otra vez su motocarro.
Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es manejar por la calles de Juliaca, ya que se distrae mucho haciéndolo, lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar hasta altas horas de la noche. Con el tiempo, espera poder juntar el dinero necesario para comprar un nuevo motocarro.

Este es el 5to préstamo de Celedonio con MFP y se siente en la responsabilidad de pagarlo a tiempo, ya que no desea causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por el resto de socias. Con los mil soles solicitados comprará nuevas llantas para su motocarro, ya que las que tiene actualmente están gastadas por el arduo trabajo.
texts.en:
Celedonio, 30, is a very hard-working and happy man. He lives in his own house, and what he wants most of all is to be successful in life. Celedonio’s work days begin very early in the morning when he leaves with his “motocarro” (three wheeled motorized vehicle) to look for passengers to transport. He is very attentive with his customers, and he always takes care of them. He wants to give them very good service so that when they see him again they will take his “motocarro”. What he likes best about his work is driving the streets of Juliaca. He finds it very entertaining. He has been doing this for five years. The most difficult part is having to work the late hours at night. In time, he hopes to be able to get together enough money to buy a new “motocarro”. This is Celedenio’s fifth loan with MFP. He feels responsible about paying it back on time. He does not want to cause problems for the members of his communal bank where he is very dear to the other members. He will use the 1,000 PEN that he is asking for to buy tires for his “motocarro”. The ones he has now are worn out from the hard work.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy new tires

loans.name: Kyyal's Group

texts.ru:
Мусабаева Кыял – лидер этой группы. У Кыял двое детей. Муж занимается частным извозом. Старшему сыну одиннадцать лет, а младшей дочке всего четыре годика. Сама же Кыял занимается домашним хозяйством. Она держит двух коров и продаёт молоко. В свободное время, она также занимается шитьём национальных изделий. Таким образом, даже находясь дома у Кыял, получается не только воспитывать детей, и выполнять обязанности домохозяйки, но даже зарабатывать существенные средства и тем самым пополнять семейный бюджет. Много лет тому назад у Кыял появился интерес к животноводству. Она решила проявить настойчивость и попробовать заняться этим. Она не побоялась вложить на покупку коров восемнадцать тысяч сомов (USD 420). За это время она с мужем смогла накопить достаточную сумму для покупки дома. Сейчас от продажи молока и шитья национальных изделий Кыял зарабатывает три с половиной тысяч сом (USD 82) в месяц. Это примерно равняется средней ежемесячной зарплате. Теперь Кыял хочет получить кредит и закупить 2-х телят для дальнейшего разведения и продажи на рынке. Кыял также хочет построить большой дом на полученную прибыль от продажи молока и национальных изделий, так как стройка требует вложения сразу большой суммы. 

Вот партнёры Кыял по группе: Миралан, Эльмира и Гульзат. 

Миралану двадцать два. Он уже женат и имеет дочку. Миралан занимается перепродажей скота на скотном рынке. Жена находится дома, дочке всего полтора годика. Миралан умело занимается своим делом и достойно кормит семью. Он надеется получить кредит и вложить в оборотный капитал. У Миралана есть заветная мечта накопить много денег и купить отдельную квартиру. 

Эльмире тридцать один. Она мать двоих детей. Младшей дочери всего три года. Эльмира работает продавцом в торговом центре «Народный». Её муж работает слесарем в г. Токмок. Благодаря совместным усилиям Эльмире и её мужу удалось сделать хороший ремонт в доме. Эльмира, решила обратиться за кредитом, для приобретения крупнорогатого скота. Перепродав скот, Эльмира планирует купить автомобиль.

Гульзат тридцать три года. Она замужем и имеет двоих детей. Гульзат работает продавцом – консультантом. Её муж – учредитель фирмы «Азия строй». Гульзат надеется получить кредит и вложить в торговлю потребительскими товарами. После получения прибыли Гульзат хочет купить себе машину.  
 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
M. Kyyal is the leader of this group. Kyyal has two children. Her husband is a cab driver. Her son, who is the oldest, is eleven years old and her daughter is just four. Kyyal herself takes care of the house. She keeps two cows and sells milk. In her free time, she also sews traditional national folk art and goods. In this way, even while staying at home, Kyyal is able to not only care for the children and fulfill her duties as housewife, but also to support the family budget. Many years ago, Kyyal became interested in breeding livestock. She has decided to take action and to try it. She wasn’t afraid to invest 18,000 soms (420 USD) of her own money toward the purchase of cows. Meanwhile, she and her husband were able to save up enough money for the purchase of a home. From the sale of milk and her folk creations, Kyyal currently earns 3,500 soms (82 USD) per month. That equals to her average monthly income. Now Kyaal would like to receive a loan to buy two calves for further breeding and for sale on the market. Kyaal would also like to build a large house on the income from her milk and folk goods sales, since construction requires the investment of a large sum of money all at once.

Here are Kyaal’s partners in the group: Miralan, Elmira, and Gulzat.

Miralan is twenty-two. He is already married and has a daughter. Miralan resells cattle on the livestock market. His wife stays at home, as their daughter is just one and a half years old. Miralan is a very capable businessman and provides sufficiently for his family. He hopes to receive a loan and to invest it towards his working capital. Miralan’s lifelong dream is to save up enough money to buy a private apartment.

Elmira is thirty-one years old. She is the mother of two children. Her youngest daughter is just three years old. Elmira works as a saleslady in the “National” shopping center. Her husband is a metalworker in the town of Tokmok. Thanks to a joint effort, Elmira and her husband were able to do a good job renovating their home. Elmira decided to apply for a loan in order to obtain a large cow. After reselling the cow, Elmira plans to buy a car.

Gulzat is thirty-three yars old. She is married and has two children. Gulzat works as a salesperson and consultant. Her husband is the founder of the firm “Asia Build.” Gulzat hopes to receive a loan and put it towards the trade of consumer goods. With the profits, Gulzat wants to buy herself a car.

Translated from Russian by Anastasia Uglova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock in order to finance various goals, such as building a home

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
Dolores tiene 30 años, vive muy contenta en su casa propia al lado de su hija, Sheyna, de 12 años de edad.
Su negocio es la venta y de gas, ella adquiere los balones de una distribuidora de gas y posteriormente los vende individualmente a sus vecinos y demás clientes que se acercan a su negocio en busca de este combustible. Las ventas son buenas, pues además de su esfuerzo, ha contratado a un ayudante quien reparte los balones en moto, haciendo de su negocio más eficiente y competitivo, ya que llegan hasta la puerta de las casas de sus clientes.
Dolores está muy contenta, pues ve mejorar su negocio y espera que en el futuro pueda comprar un carro repartidor, con el cual pueda abastecer a muchos más clientes y más rápido.

Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y ella se caracteriza por ser muy responsable con los pagos al igual que sus compañeros de grupo. Con el dinero que solicita comprará mayor cantidad de balones de gas para obtener más ingresos para su familia; además seguirá ahorrando para hacer realidad su sueño de adquirir su propio carro para distribuir los balones.
texts.en:
Dolores is 30 years old. She is happy to be living at home with her daughter Sheyna, who is 12 years old.

Dolores operates a business selling gas. She acquires containers filled with gas from a distributor and then sells them individually to her neighbors and other customers who come by her shop in need of fuel. Sales have been good thanks to her efforts. Dolores has also hired an assistant who delivers gas containers by motorbike to the doorsteps of her customers, thereby making her more efficient and competitive. She is very happy that her business is improving. In the future, she hopes to buy a delivery truck so that she can supply more customers and provide faster service.

This is her second loan with MFP. Dolores is known for being very responsible with her payments, just like the rest of the Communal Bank members. She will use the money to buy more gas containers so that she can earn more income for her family. This will also enable her to save up enough money to fulfill her dream of purchasing a delivery vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase containers of gas

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santo Cristo de Bagazan”, Distrito de Rioja, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es Conviviente, tiene 31 años y es madre de 02 hijos, que aun dependen de ella.

Lleva 02 años, dedicándose a este tipo de actividad, brindando servicios de movilidad urbana en su motokar. Para trabajarlo, su esposo se encarga de trasladarse por diferentes lugares de la Ciudad. Se inicio con el primer prestamo de Manuela Ramos y poco a poco fue ahorrando y con ese dinero fue comprando repuestos, para mejorar el servicio a los moradores de la comunidad.

 Con este préstamo de S/. 2,100.00, comprará repuestos y aceites como: lubricantes, bocamasas, bujías; para así brindar un mejor servicio y atender mucho mejor al cliente. Hoy en día es una mujer independiente, y es ella y su esposo quienes toman las decisiones y administran su negocio.

Julia, como le dicen de cariño, nos cuenta: Que el pertenecer a un grupo de mujeres le ha ayudado a conocer mejor sus derechos y juntas  hacer que estas sean respetadas. Y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciarse en el campo empresarial.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia is a member of the “Santo Cristo de Bagazan” Community Bank in the District of Rioja, Rioja Province, in the state of San Martín. She has a common-law marriage, is 31 years old and is the mother of 2 children who are dependent on her. For 2 years she has dedicated herself to this type of service, providing transportation services in the city with her "motokar". In order to provide the service, her husband is in charge of moving around different parts of the city. The business began with the first loan from Manuela Ramos and little by little she has saved money and used it to by replacement parts in order to improve service for the residents of the community. With this loan of S/. 2,100.00, she will buy replacement parts and oils such as lubricants, "bocamasas", and spark plugs in order to provide better service and tend to her clients better. Today she is an independent woman and she and her husband are the ones who administer and make the decisions regarding the business. Julia, as she is lovingly referred to, tells us that being a part of a women's group has helped her to better understand her rights and together ensure that these are respected. She thanks the Manuela Ramos Group for helping her get her start in the business world.

Translated from Spanish by Soraya Alamdari, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy replacement parts for motorcycles.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of Beans

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing is a farmer. She plants vegetables on her farmland and sells them at wholesale and retail prices to farmers. She has been in this business for a long time. She is requesting a loan in the amount of NGN 50,000 to clear her farm and plant more vegetables to sell. Blessing is 38 years old, married and has 4 children. She is an LAPO client. (Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.)  Blessing says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Fawzia Saliha Group

texts.en:
This is the Fawzia Saliha Group. It has four members. They would like to improve and develop their businesses.

Hakimullah is the group leader. He wants a loan for his brother who has a retail shop. With this loan, he wants to buy materials that he needs for his shop. 

Fawzia wants a loan for her husband who sells fresh fruit from a cart. He wants to buy more fresh fruit for his cart and expand his business. 

Saliha has tailoring business in her house. She has arranged a small room where she sews different kinds of clothes and has a good number of clients.
With the loan, she wants to buy an electric sewing machine because she has lots of problems using the old one. 

The last member, Farhad, wants a loan for his sister who is tailor. With this loan, she wants to buy more cloth for her business. 

They have requested a group loan of 40000 Afghani. They would like to note the effectiveness of Kiva process and its effect on the progress of their businesses.

loans.use: To buy material for his brother's retail shop.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy es socia del Banco Comunal Guadalupe.
Lucy es casada, tiene 30 años y 1 hijo, Lucy junto a su esposo se dedican a la compra de ganado en las diferentes ferias y pueblos, animales que transportan a la ciudad de Lima en donde tienen un establecimiento de engorde de animales.
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en el pago de flete.
Los sueños de Lucy son que sus hijos sean profesionales y comprar otro terreno.
texts.en:
Lucy is member of the Communal Bank "Guadalupe." She is married, is 30 years old, and has one son. Lucy and her husband buy cattle that they then transport to the city of Lima where they run an operation to fatten the animals. Lucy needs a loan of PEN 1,000 to pay for the transportation of the animals. Lucy's dreams include her children becoming professionals, and buying more land.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paying for transportation

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José tiene 65 años de edad, es casado y tiene cuatro hijos ya independientes. Vive junto a su esposa en el distrito de Paiján, provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad, ubicada a tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace treinta años tiene instalada en su vivienda una bodega en donde ofrece a sus clientes todo tipo de bebidas. El nos comenta que pudo instalar este negocio con los ahorros que tenía de las ganancias de su trabajo como costurero, que ejerce desde muy joven. Con estas dos actividades el ha podido salir adelante y solventar sus gastos familiares.

El negocio goza de buena acogida, especialmente en época de verano que es cuando más demanda tiene, es por ello que se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a comprar más bebidas con los cuales pueda ampliar su negocio.

José es un hombre honrado y muy trabajador. El ya ha trabajado anteriomente con Nuestra Institución en muchas oportunidades, demostrando en todas puntualidad y responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Jose is 65 years old, married with four children who are all independent adults. He lives with his wife in Paijan, Ascope in the Libertad province, about three hours from the city of Chiclayo. For the past 30 years, he has run a small store out of his home offering a variety of beverages. He was able to start the store with his savings that he earned from his job sewing and making clothing, a job he started when he was young. Through these 2 businesses, he has been able to progress and cover his household expenses. His business has a steady flow of customers, especially during the summer when demand is high; this is why he is requesting a $700 loan from Edpyme Alternativa which will help him buy more drinks to grow his business. Jose is a very honest, hard-working man. He has worked with our institution many times prior, showing great responsibilitiy and punctuality in fulfilling his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drinks to grow his business during the summer

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita M. is a 37-year-old mother of six children and wife of a small time hired laborer. Her family's poor economic situation, that of being dependent on the income generated by her husband, pushed Carmelita to develop her own business and source of income. She joined ASHI in 2007 in order to gain financial capital to realize her ambition, and has been receiving loans since then. She has supported two businesses with the loans she has requested: her husband’s fishing business and a variety store which sells grocery items. Her store is located in her house so that while she spends time managing her business she can also attend to the needs of her family, especially to those of her disabled child.

The profit from both businesses enables Carmelita and her husband to support the needs of their six children, whose ages range from 1 to 18. All but their eldest child and their disabled child go to school. Carmelita is requesting a larger loan from Kiva / ASHI to expand her variety store into a big grocery store to meet her regular customers' demands and to attract new customers. She also wants to increase her profit to support the financial needs for her children's education until they graduate from college.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This entrepreneur is a fresh unmarried boy of 20 who completed the primary level of education. He has a barber shop and he is taking this loan is to create new decorations for the shop and to purchase barbering items, such as machine clips, hair dryers, and all the other necessities of the shop. Although he is very young, he has a good reputation in the markets and his youth attracts a lot of clients, because he is sensitive to their needs and tastes. He knows all the modern styles of hair cutting. With this loan, he was able to raise his standard of living and is more ambitious. Looking forward to a brighter future, he intends to hire more employees to serve his increasing number of clients.

loans.use: Shop decorations, tools, and supplies

loans.name: Imee

texts.en:
Imee B. is from the village of Taguanao, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 28 years old. Imee is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imee raises livestock. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. Imee has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2005, Imee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services. She hoped to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Imee has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC. Imee is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase feed for the pigs. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Imee from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed for her pigs

loans.name: Santosa

texts.es:
Santosa tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia con sus 4 hijos y su esposo Antonio de 40 años; esta familia trabaja diario para salir adelante.

Su motivación diaria son sus hijos, por eso junto su esposo llevan 10 años cultivando frutas cítricas, plátano, maíz y café en sus terrenos propios. De la agricultura lo que más le gusta es ver cómo sus frutos se desarrollan y luego los comercializa a precios considerables en el mercado de su ciudad. 
Santosa menciona: “llevar los productos es difícil, pero resulta rentable, pues a mis hijos no les falta nada, nosotros como padres estamos satisfechos, porque no sufren las necesidades que nosotros sufrimos”.
Para el futuro quiere incrementar su producción de plátanos e iniciarse en la crianza de gallinas.

Este es el tercer préstamo que tiene con MFP y está contenta de trabajar en su banco comunal, porque se siente capaz de lograr su progreso, por eso cuida mucho su historial crediticio. Con el dinero que solicita comprará doscientas plantas de plátano y tres sacos de fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Santosa is 35 years old. She lives with his four children and Antonio, her husband of 40 years. Her family works hard every day to improve their lives. Her daily motivation are her children, and for their sake she and her husband have been working for 10 years growing citrus fruits, corn, and coffee on their land. What she likes most about his job is seeing the plants grow and then sell them at a the market in his city. Santosa says, "Transporting our products is difficult, but it is profitable. Our children don't lack anything, so as parents we are satisfied because they lack the necessities like we did." In the future she wants to produce more plantains and start to raise chickens. This is her third loan with MFP, and he is happy to be working with the community bank because she feels capable of achieving progress with these loans. She has been careful protecting his credit history. She will use the loan money to buy 200 plantain plants and three bags of fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of plantain plants and fertilizer

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe Benkelema (4femmes mariées et une célibataire)  avec une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, ont en moyenne  3 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles polygamiques à Sanoubougou II un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur première collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de produits alimentaires tels que les condiments alimentaires avec Afou Berthé, les céréales, l’atieké et de la restauration.
Afou Berthé  compte acheter avec son  prêt,  5 colis de condiments alimentaires au grand marché et les villages avoisinants. Les condiments sont vendus au  marché  Sikasso et en famille, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant et souvent à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 19.500 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkelema group (four married women and a single one) are on average 40 years old and have an average of three children. Most of them live in polygamous families in Sanoubougou II, one of the neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali) This is their first collaboration with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet the needs of their customers. This group of women sells foodstuffs such as condiments. Afou Berthé sells cereals, atieké [a cassava based food] and does catering. Afou Berthé is planning on using her loan to buy 5 packages of condiments from the large market and from the villages in the vicinity. The condiments are sold by the family at the Sikasso market to a customer base of women and men, for cash and often on credit. She is planning to make a monthly profit of 19 500 Francs CFA. One part will be used for the family’s expenses and the other will be reinvested in the business.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase condiments

loans.name: Sayda Melania

texts.es:
La Señora Sayda Melania es casada, tiene una pequeña pulpería en su vivienda, la venta en la misma es gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.
Con la ayuda de su esposo están saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación. Debido al trabajo y el buen manejo de su negocio hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso.
 Por lo que ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos sería conveniente brindarle todo el apoyo necesario. Es por eso que solicita este financiamiento para la compra de granos básicos, golosinas, detergentes, pan y galletas. Su deseo es aumentar cada los números de clientes.
texts.en:
Sra. Sayda Melania is married and has a small store in her home. Her sales provide her gratification since she has a considerable number of customers and satisfactory income. With the help of her husband, she has been able to move forward with determination, hard work, and dedication. By operating and managing her business well, Sayda has turned into a successful businesswoman who is constantly making progress.

Since Sayda has demonstrated that she is a responsible and honest person in all of her commitments, it is appropriate to provide her with all the necessary support. Therefore, her loan requested will be granted so that she can buy basic grains, candy, detergents, bread, and cookies. Her wish is to increase the number of customers that she serves.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to buy merchandise

loans.name: Mansurjon

texts.en:
M. Mansurjon has dedicated himself to the agriculture business. He grows potatoes, tomatoes, and onions on his land. His family is made up of his brother and his parents. It is important to point out that this gentleman has succeeded in this business and has been able to improve the condition of his business thanks to his sacrifices and great efforts. Today Mansurjon needs a loan to provide technological assistance to his crops which is why he confidently waits the approval of this loan knowing that it will be of great use in this business and that his family will greatly benefit. Mansurjon and his family sincerely thank you!  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Mr. Houy Um Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people who live in Khsom village in Kandal province make up this village bank loan. Mr. Houy U., who was born in 1954, is the village bank president, selected by the other members. Each member will use their loan for a different purpose.

Mr. Houy U. is a fisherman who is able to earn some money to support his family. His wife, Mrs. Lou Ork, is a housewife who makes some delicious food for her family.

Now Mr. Houy U. has a problem because his fishing supplies are too little to use. So, to improve his fishing, he is applying for a loan to buy more fishing supplies to use. He will use the rest of his loan to buy soil and zinc to build a place to conduct motorbike repairs to start a new business.

Mr. Houy U. is the father of six children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory while the others are attending the local public school.

loans.use: To buy more fishing supplies plus equipment to start a new business

loans.name: Nancy Akoth

texts.en:
Nancy Akoth O. is a business lady who operates a shoe-vending and clothes-selling business in Nyamasaria market in Kisumu. She started this business in 2009 after quitting her previous business of ice cream vending since she could not earn a reasonable income to cater for the needs of her family.

Today, Nancy admits that the return has left a remarkable glee in her face and this is what has actually inspired her to expand this venture. Her main aim of joining K-MET was to access a loan of Kshs 20,000 which will enable her expand her business.

Nancy lives in Kisumu. She is 31 years old, married, and the proud mother of three children. She plans to save the profits from her expanded business to buy a passenger service vehicle which she believes will enable her to attain her life dream of ensuring economic stability for her children and enable her to educate them.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, de 34 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su esposa Maday de 25 años y su único hijo Jhon de 3 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Desde muy pequeño Wilfredo aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Él siembra Café y plátano, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender al mercado de la ciudad de La Merced. Han transcurrido 10 años y aún le gusta cosechar, además procura siempre cuidar sus campos de la plaga de insectos que afecta su producción. Su mayor deseo es comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda trasladar sus productos hasta el mercado. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesto a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota de humor en el grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Wilfredo is 34 years old and a modest hardworking gentleman. He lives at his parents’ house with his wife Maday, age 25, and their only child Jhon who is 3 years old. Wilfredo wants to provide them with a better quality of life. From a young age he learned how to work on a farm. His parents taught him everything he needed to know about achieving a good crop. Now he has his own land that he cultivates and cares for with much love and patience. Wilfredo grows coffee and bananas, products that are eventually sold at the market in the city of La Merced. He has been farming for 10 years and says he enjoys the harvesting season, but he must constantly take care of his fields to protect them from plagues of insects that can impact his production. His greatest wish is to buy a vehicle so that he can transport his goods to market.

This is his third loan with MFP. Wilfredo knows that he must always submit his payments on time and he is happy to comply. He is one of the more cheerful members of his Communal Bank and always adds a sense of humor to his group. The loan of 2500 PEN that he requested will used to buy more compost so that he can improve the quality of his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace S. is currently in the business of selling tomatoes, simsim (sesame seed) and onions at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of simsim to sell.

Grace is 50 years old and is married to a watchman. She has seven children and three of them go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To stock more bags of simsim to sell

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam, de 34 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Omar de 36 años, y sus 2 queridos hijos Daisy de 16 y Luis de 7 años, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que Miriam se dedica, es el cultivo de espinacas, lechugas y arvejas. Todos los días, muy temprano por la mañana, trabaja en su cultivo, ya que sabe que el dinero que obtenga de la venta de su cosecha, dependerá mucho de la calidad de sus productos. Ella vende sus cultivos en el mercado de Tarma, puesto que es donde mejor le pagan. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de trabajo han tenido sus frutos, lleva 16 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus plantaciones de las plagas de insectos que afectan y perjudican la cosecha. En adelante, sembrará en casi toda la extensión de sus campos para aumentar su producción y por ende obtener mejores ingresos. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, manifiesta que el crédito le ayudará mucho en el progreso de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya que es muy solidaria con ellas. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Miriam, 34, is a cheerful, unassuming woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Omar, 36, and their two beloved children, Daisy, 16 and Luis, 7, to whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Miriam grows spinach, lettuce and peas. She goes out every day very early to work her fields because she knows that the money she gets when she sell her crops depends to a great deal on the quality of her products. She sells her products in Tarma’s market because that’s where she’s paid the best. What she enjoys the most about her work is harvesting because that’s when she sees the fruits of long months of labor. She has been farming for 16 years and considers the most difficult part of it to protect her crops from insect infestations that damage the crops. In the future she will plant on nearly her total available area in order to increase production and earn higher income. This is her first loan with MFP. She states that the loan will be very beneficial for her work’s progress. She is very well liked in the communal bank because she is very supportive of the other members. She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy manure for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina H. is from the town of Banga. She is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Gina owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Gina says she works hard because she wants to provide for her family. She wants to provide better living conditions.

Gina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Alahou Group

texts.fr:
Les sept membres du groupe ALAHOU (6 femmes mariées  et  1 célibataire) ont en moyenne 35 ans, 2 enfants et vivent la plupart dans des  familles monogames à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur deuxième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et le  premier prêt  s’est  bien dénoué. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce  des articles divers tels, les oignons, la vente  des chaussures et tissus  avec  Aminata C., la présidente du groupe.
AMINATA C. compte acheter avec son  prêt,  12 colis de chaussures  et 20 pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché et les vend en ville et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée  pour l’appui de son mari dans les dépenses  et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Elle ambitionne d’augmenter son chiffre d’affaire pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
texts.en: The seven  members of the ALAHOU group (6 married women and 1 single woman) are on average 35 years old with 2 children.   Most live in monogamous families at Sanoubougou I, a district of the city of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali).  This is their second loan from the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to satisfy their customers’ needs.  The first loan has been fully repaid.  This group of women sell various items such as onions and sell shoes and fabrics with Aminata C., the group's president. Aminata C. plans to buy 12 boxes of shoes and 20 pagnes (a colorful West African cloth) with her loan. She gets her supplies at the large market and sells them on a cash basis in town and from her home to a clientele composed of men and women.  She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 40,000 CFA of which a part will be used to help her husband provide for the family's needs and the remainder will be invested in the business.  Her goal is to increase her sales to better satisfy her customers.

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Maribel Rocío

texts.es:
La Señora. Maribel R. es socia del banco comunal Fe y Alegría, vive por el sector del Cebollar en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de sus calles, su centro histórico, su gente que es amable, cordial y aun mantienen sus tradiciones, cuenta con una gran variedad en su gastronomía.

Nuestra socia tiene 33 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 12, 10, 8  y 3 años, sus dos últimos hijos son gemelos, su primera hija estudia en el colegio, su segunda y tercera hijas estudian  en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo es laboratorista de suelos y con el trabajo y esfuerzo conyugal han logrado comprar su casa propia.

Doña Maribel es comerciante de ropa la misma que vende desde su casa todos los días sin un horario fijo, esta actividad  la viene realizando hace 10 años.
 
Este es el segundo crédito que realiza en la fundación y el dinero del crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir más su local.
 
Su meta es pagar la deuda de la compra de su casa.
texts.en:
Señora Maribel R. is a member of the "Fe y Alegría" ("Faith and Happiness") communal bank. She lives in the Cebollar neighbourhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is well known for the beauty of its streets and historic centre, as well as its friendly, polite and traditional people. It also boasts a great variety in its cuisine.

Our member is 33 years old. She is married and has 5 children, aged 12, 10, 8 and 3, with he youngest being twins. Her eldest daughter is studying in high school, her second and third daughters study at a city primary school. Her husband is a laboratory technician analysing soils, and with his job and their combined determination, they have succeeded in buying their own house.

Doña Maribel is a businesswoman, who sells clothing from home. She works every day, without fixed hours. She has been doing this for 10 years. 

This is the second loan she has had from the foundation, and she is going to invest the money in buying more clothing to sell. Her goal is to pay off the mortgage.

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is a 36-year-old married man who is blessed with three children. To support his family, Paul repairs kitchen appliances, such as bakery equipment, for a fee. Most of his customers are bakery owners. Paul has been running this business for five years. He has been able to improve his business through the financial support of Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of 30,000 KES to buy materials for carrying out repairs to wires and consumer units.

loans.use: To buy materials for repairing wires and consumer units

loans.name: Sara Concepcion

texts.es:
la sra. Sara Concepcion C. O. tiene 32 años de edad y se dedica a la compra y venta de lacteos como ser: quesillo, queso y mantequilla.
sus ventas son todos los dias, pero tiene mas ventas los fines de semana.
Los lacteos que se producen en la ciudad de San Lorenzo son de muy buena calidad y sabor, se venden muy rapido.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de lacteos al por mayor y asi tener mejores ventas y mayores ganancias, las cuales las necesita para cubrir con los gastos del hogar.
Sara es una mujer con muchos deseos de superacion.
texts.en:
Mrs Sara Concepcion C. O. is 32 years old.  She buys and sells dairy products such as 'quesillo' (a type of soft cheese found throughout Central America), cheese and butter.

She sells her products every day but sells most on a weekend.

The dairy products which are produced in the town of San Lorenzo are very good quality and taste good.  They sell very quickly.

She will use her loan to buy dairy products wholesale to obtain better sales and better profits which she needs to cover her household expenses.

Sara is a woman who has a great desire to better herself.

loans.use: To buy cheese, 'quesillo' (soft cheese) and butter

loans.name: Ulanbayar

texts.en:
Ulanbayar T. is a 24-year-old single lady who lives with her parents and two siblings in their own house and fence in the Uvurhangai province of Mongolia. Her parents operate a grocery and consumer goods mobile trading business. Ulanbayar operates a hair salon out of a rented space at the local trade center. She graduated from a hairdressing school in 2005 and since 2006, she has been working as a hairdresser. 

After years of stable operation, she was able to purchase a car for herself. For the future, she plans to purchase necessary tools and equipment for her beauty shop and decorate her working place after obtaining loan from the Bank. She is a very clever, intelligent and hard-working woman, and says, "For the upcoming New Year holiday, I plan to buy more hairdressing tools for my beauty shop and decorate my workplace so I can provide good service to my customers in a comfortable environment."  She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to replace the styling tools and equipment used in her hair salon and remodel her salon.

loans.use: To replace her styling tools and equipment

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive junto a sus padres y hermanos en el sector Chuin del distrito de Paiján, una zona comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Ascope en la región La Libertad. Se encuentra situada a más de dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a vender alfalfa en su moto carguera. El cultiva este forraje en un terreno de cultivo situado cerca a la zona en donde reside. Diariamente siega la alfalfa para ofrecerla en venta en el distrito de Paiján y en sus alrededores. Para realizar esta acción se vale de su moto carguera, el negocio es una fuente bastante importante de ingresos con la que solventa sus gastos personales y ayuda a su familia. Adicionalmente utiliza su moto carguera para brindar servicio de transporte de carga en sus ratos libres.

José desea adquirir algunas medicinas que ayude a su alfalfa con la prevención de futuras plagas, asimismo desea brindar mantenimiento a su moto carguera, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is a 21-year-old single man who lives with his parents and siblings in the Chuin sector of the Paijan district, a commercial zone in the Ascope province of the La Libertad region. It is located over two-and-a-half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

He sells alfalfa using his cargo tricycle. He grows this fodder in a crop field near his zone of residence. He harvests alfalfa everyday so that he can sell it in the Paijan district and in surrounding communities. In order to do so, he uses his cargo tricycle. This business is a vital source of income with which he covers personal expenses and helps out his family. He also uses this motorcycle to offer cargo transportation services in his spare time.

Jose would like to obtain pesticides that will help prevent future pest infestations. He would also like to give maintenance to his cargo tricycle, which is why he thinks it is advisable to request 2,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: Pesticides and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Tunzala

texts.ru:
Tunzala S. 40 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 2 detey. Tunzala  jivet v qorode Baku vmeste so svoim mujom i detmi, kotoriye uchatsya v kolledje.

Tunzala uje 7 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom prodaji produktov. Ranshe Tunzala  prodovala korm dlya jivotnix ,tak je moyushiye sredstva i t.d a seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chto bi kupit uje pishiviye produkti dlya prodaji i razvitiya svoyeqo biznessa.
texts.en:
Tunzala S. is forty years old.  She is married and has two children.  Tunzala lives in the city of Baku with her children, who study in college, and with her husband.

Tunzala has been selling foodstuffs for seven years.  Before that, Tunzala sold pet food, cleaning supplies, and other things.  Now, she needs 2000 AZN to buy foodstuffs for sale and to expand her business.

loans.use: Buying goods for resale

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma C. is from the village of Lubid, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Gemma is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling delicacies in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Gemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the sixth loan taken out by Gemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Khayrullo

texts.ru: Бобохонов Хайрулло проживает в районе Вахдат. Ему 48 лет. Женат. Имеет 5 детей. Жена домохозяйка. Сам Хайрулло занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 15 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Khayrullo B. lives in the Vahdat Region. He is 48 years old. Married, with five children. His wife is a homemaker. Khayrullo is a farmer. He leases a land plot where he grows wheat and vegetables. He has been in this line of work for 15 years. He is taking out a loan to purchase seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: Purchasing seeds and mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Joshep Christian

texts.es:
Joshep, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltero y viven en la ciudad del Cusco, Perú. Actualmente, Joshep está trabajando en el instituto Nacional de Cultura como restaurador de cuadro. Ya son dos que se dedica a este negocio y le va  muy bien, él en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para ahorrar pues en el futuro quiere comprar un carro para poder brindar servicio de transporte urbano. El sueño de Joshep es abrir una empresa de transportes.     

Joshep pertenece al banco comunal “Kantus” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Joshep is 26 years old, single, and lives in the city of Cusco, Peru.  Joshep is currently working at the National Institute of Culture as a paintings restorer.  He has been in this business for two years and it is going very well.  On this occasion, he needs a loan so that he can save as, in the future, he would like to buy a car with which he can provide urban transport services  Joshep's dream is to open a transport company.

Joshep is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Kantus" community bank.  He is grateful for the opportunity he is being offered with this loan and he pledges to make his repayments according to schedule.

loans.use: To save up so that he can buy a car in the future

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Seang R., 28, is married to Put Saroun, 29, who is a local farmer. Seang R. is good at making bamboo baskets at home to sell at the market as well as helping her husband to grow rice on their farmland. The couple has given birth to three children; two of them are studying at the local school. Presently, she wants to raise a few piglets behind her house for additional income, but she lacks money to do that. That is why Seang R. would like to ask for a loan from lenders of HKL's partner, Kiva.

loans.use: To buy some piglets for breeding purposes

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: The woman shown in the picture is Yim S., 23, a fisherman who lives in the province of Siem Reap. She and her husband usually spend eight hours a day fishing, in and around Tunle Sap River. They catch around 5 kilos of fish per day and sell them, in bulk, to his customers who are retail sellers in the market. The young couple is blessed with two young children who are not yet enrolled in school. Yim S. will use her loan to purchase nets, traps, and other fishing implements for the fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase nets, traps, and other fishing implements for fishing.

loans.name: Prescilla's Group

texts.en:
Prescilla E. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 50 years old. Prescilla is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Prescila E.'s Group".

Prescilla is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Prescilla owns & operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Prescilla has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Prescilla joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Prescilla has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Prescilla is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Prescilla from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering.

loans.name: Benson Mureithi

texts.en:
Benson has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the past 10 years. He is 48 years old, married to Grace Wanjiku and they have three children.  

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend and this will be his third loan. He repaid all his previous loans well and in good time. He plans to use the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In the future, Benson hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia, a married woman without children, lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and food. For the past four years, she has operated a business selling clothes from her shop to neighbours and passersby. She also sells natural fruit juice.

Sophia faces the major challenge of seasonality, as during the hot dry season less fruits are available for making juice. With this Kshs 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of fruits for making both natural juice and bundles of clothes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and dreams of expanding it and establishing another one in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruits to make natural juice and bundles of clothes.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy groceries for a grocery store business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a married woman with three children. She plans to fund their education through the income that her loan provides.

Delia is a farmer working in San Francisco, Agusan Del Sur. Delia has been growing rice for five years.  Delia earns PhP 2, 600 per month doing this farming. 

This loan will be used to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs. In the future, Delia hopes to buy a bigger farm to support her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He is married and has two daughters and three sons. Husam took out a loan from FATEN to purchase home furniture.

Husam, who appears in the picture here, lives in Jabalia Refugee camp in Gaza.

loans.use: to purchase home furniture

loans.name: Wilbert

texts.en:
Wilbert is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has 2 children. 

Wilbert has a shop that sells green & yellow bananas. He has had this business for 3 years. He has requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy additional bananas & coconuts.

Wilbert is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Wilbert hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy additional bananas & coconuts.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita is 55 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Rosalita has a food shop that sells rice and cheese cakes. She has had this business for 10 years. 

She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients needed for rice and cheese cakes.

Rosalita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Rosalita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for rice and cheese cakes.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a 26-year-old married man with four children who are between one and eight years old. He lives in his own permanent house in Karuguuza, Uganda. For five years, Patrick has been in the motorcycle transport business. In addition, he operates a saloon. From these businesses, he has been able to buy a motorcycle. He faces the challenge of the high fluctuation of fuel prices but hopes to buy another motorcycle. Patrick wants a loan to top up and buy a second motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Johny

texts.en:
Johny is 44 years old, married with three grown-up children. He keeps livestock and cultivates land. Johny would like to start growing rice, as it is in great demand. Rice farming requires much work, so Johny plans to hire workers to help.

With the requested loan of P 15,000 he plans to purchase rice seeds, fertilizer and pay the salaries of the workers for his farm business. Johny will increase his income and improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds to plant, and pay for plowing costs on his farm.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is is 41 years old. She is married and blessed with six children between 4 and 17 years. For the last 7 years, she has been raising pigs so as to meet the needs of her family.  She supplements income from this venture with the earnings she makes from running a grocery shop. She wants, in the next 5 years, to have more than 100 pigs. Her dream is to be a major supplier of poultry products and pigs.

She is requesting for a loan of 60,000 Kenya shillings to start a business of raising laying chickens. Thanks to Faulu Kenya she is now able to produce and earn more from her business.

loans.use: to buy laying chickens

loans.name: Felix Amada

texts.es:
Doña Felix Amada, tiene su negocio de venta de carne de cerdo, venta de nacatamales. Pues lleva dieciocho años, logrando mantener sus ventas, es madre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales la apoyan con el trabajo.
Comenzo con capital propio, luego introdujo, capital atraves del financiamiento en Afodenic, siendo de gran oportunidad para aumentar las ventas, captar mas clientela al ofertar mas producto en la venta de carne, nacatamaes, fritos, manteca.
Es un trabajo agitado, pero da, para sobresalir con los gastos del hogar, tambien por que desde joven comenzo las venta y se ha acostumbrado al trabajo de preparacion de la carne del cerdo.
Hoy con este nuevo prestamo sera para la compra de un cerdo y compra de verduras para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Felix Amanda sells pork, and she sells nacatamales (a traditional Central-American dish wrapped in leaves and steamed).  She has been doing this for 18 years, and she has managed to keep up her sales.  She has four children, and they support her in her work.

She started with her own capital, and later she put in funds from the loan from Afodenic.  This is a great opportunity to increase sales and gain more customers by offering more products to sell along with the sale of pork, nacatamales, fried food, and lard.

It is hectic work, but it gives what is needed for the household expenses.  Also, she started the business as a young woman, and she has become accustomed to the work of preparing pork.

Now, with this new loan, she will buy a pig.  She will also buy vegetables to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy a pig to butcher and vegetables to increase her sales.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en: Massa is 30 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has four children ages 1 to 11, all of whom are currently in school and live at home. For fourteen years she has been selling lapa (traditional West African cloth). She makes lots of profit. Currently she has fewer goods, so she is requesting a loan to purchase more lapa for her business. She hopes to build her house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more lapa for her business.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina is 58 years old and is married. They are blessed with 10 children. The youngest two are in school and are about to finish college this year. Faustina’s husband is a farmer, planting rice and corn in the Philippines.

Faustina is engaged in a hog raising business, primarily hogs for breeding. She has six heads of sow and 40 piglets to raise. Sometimes, Faustina has difficulties in feeding her plenty of pigs, that’s why she decided to request a loan of P50,000 to buy feed for the maintenance of her pigs. She plans also to buy galvanized iron to repair the roof top of her piggery house.

She hopes to maintain her business for the future of her family. She will manage her business well, and gain higher income to save some of it for their future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Mahmadulo

texts.ru: Махмадуло проживает в районе Кумсангир. Ему 64 года. Он женат. Махмадуло является отцом пятерых детей. Он имеет среднее образование. В центре района у него имеется магазин, где он продает продукты питания и бытовую технику. В этой области он два года. Кредит берет для приобретения электрообогревателей, радиаторов, подставки и продуктов питания.
texts.en: Mahmadulo lives in the Qumsangir district.  He is 64 years old and married.  Mahmadulo is a father of five children.  He has a secondary education.  He has a store in the district center, where he sells food products and household electronics.  He has been in this field for two years.  Mahmadulo is requesting this loan for the purchase of electric heaters, radiators, stands and food products.

loans.use: to purchase electric heaters, radiators, stands and food products

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 34 years old. He is married to Catherine and they are blessed with one child. Joshua runs an electronic shop as well as a barber shop in the area of Kibera at Biashara Center where most of his clients are men. He has been in business for the last three years and earns an income of KES 20,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES20,000 from KADET LTD. He plans on using the full amount of this loan to purchase a stock of extensions, mobile chargers and mobile phone accessories. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his child.

Joshua hopes to open a retail electronic shop. He is very hardworking and a promising businessperson.

loans.use: To buy electronics, mobile chargers and mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Maria Irma

texts.es:
María D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en su casa propia junto a su  familia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada  en la zona rural D. Olmos que pertenece al departamento D. Lambayeque. Es una zona agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Ella cuenta con un terreno agrícola en donD. suele sembrar mango y limón, el ya tiene varios años D. experiencia en esta actividad y durante este tiempo ha llegado a conocer mucho sobre el manejo D. cultivos. Los ingresos que percibe D. estas actividades los utiliza para solventar la economía diaria D. su familia.

María desea comprar fertilizantes para así brindar mantenimiento a su terreno D. cultivo para instalar una nueva plantación D. frutales. D. esta manera obtendrá una buena cosecha. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María, 57, lives in her own house with her family; it does not have basic utilities and is located in the rural part of Olmos which belongs to Lambayeque Department.  It is an area noted for farming, animal husbandry and crafts.

She has a piece of farm land where she tends to grow mangoes and lemons; she has many years’ experience in this line of work and has leaned much about crop management.  Income from these activities is used to cover her daily family expenses.

María wants to buy fertilizer to proviD. maintenance to her farmland in order to start a new planting of fruits so that she can obtain a good harvest.  To reach this objective, she has needed to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: El señor Ricardo trabaja como  cerrajero. El crédito lo requiere para el techado y obra fina de una habitación en su casa para dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz; Ricardo es viudo y tiene tres hijos. El  cliente se encuentra muy contento con los créditos que se le otorgaron ya que pudo mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia, pues esta es la quinta vez que Impro le concede un crédito y la segunda vez que se canaliza por Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Ricardo works as a locksmith. The loan he is requesting will be used to install a roof and finish a room in his house so that his children will be more comfortable. He lives in his own home in the District of Llojeta in the city of La Paz. Ricardo is a widower and has three children.

He is very pleased with the loans that have been provided so that he can improve his family’s living conditions. This is the fifth time that IMPRO has granted him a loan and the second time that it will be funded through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase materials in order to install a roof and finish a room in his house.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 61-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. This couple strives to work really hard to spend the rest of their life properly. Joseph has owned a mini market since 2005 and he is waiting for the perfect time to enlarge his shop. As for his wife, she has been working as a teacher in a local school. 

Today, Joseph is looking to borrow $1000 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase added supplies to enlarge the business. In the future, he notes that he will collect money, take a rest and retire to hire someone to work on his behalf.

loans.use: to purchase added supplies.

loans.name: Gf Djidjoho Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GF DJIDJOHO est composé de huit personnes qui sont des amies et vivent dans le même village. C'est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Sidonie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Sidonie est âgée de 36 ans et est mariée à un cultivateur du nom de Marcellin. Sidonie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple a six enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Sidonie mène comme activité depuis dix ans environs la culture du piment et du maïs dans sa région. De façon secondaire, Sidonie vend du riz. Cette activité lui permet de contribuer sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Sidonie s’approvisionne dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Sidonie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GF DJIDJOHO, un cinquième crédit. Les quatre premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The GF DJIDJOHO group is made up of ten women who are all friends and who live in the same village. This is the 5th time they have asked ALIDé for financial help, so that they can increase their activity. The group's representative, Sidonie, has her hand raised in the photo. She is 36 years old and is married to a farmer called Marcellin. Sidonie lives with her husband and their 6 children. Some of the children go to school, and the couple is responsible for all of them. Together, Sidonie and her husband meet the household's various expenses. To do that, Sidonie has been growing peppers and corn locally for about ten years. She also sells rice. This allows her to easily contribute to the family's expenses. 

Sidonie obtains her supplies at markets in Benin. In order to meet customer demand and to increase turnover and profit, Sidonie, along with the other members of the GF DJIDJOHO group, is asking for a 5th loan. The first 4 have all been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice and products to grow (pepper, corn).

loans.name: Alma Leticia

texts.es:
Alma Leticia, tiene 31 años de edad, casada, su esposo es mecanico automotriz, tiene un hijo de 5 años de edad, vive en una aldea de Cofradia, Cortes.
Alma , hace 2 años que estableció una pulpería, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, arroz, azúcar, sal, pan, verduras, condimentos , huevos, carnes, lácteos, papel  higiénico etc. Inicio este negocio con fondos propios. Atiende sus clientes desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 9:00 p.m. todos los días. A solicitado este prestamo para surtir de productos como carnes, lácteos, refrescos, granos básicos y abarrotes.
Su plan es seguir creciendo y obtener ma singresos de su negocio.
texts.en:
Alma Leticia, 31, is married.  Her husband is an auto mechanic.  She has a 5-year-old son and lives in a village in Cofradía, Cortes.

Alma opened a grocery store two years ago where she sells basic staple items like rice, sugar, salt, bread, vegetables, condiments, eggs, meat, dairy products, toilet paper, etc.  She started the business with her own funds.  She tends to customers from 6am until 9pm every day.

She has requested this loan to stock up on products like meats, dairy products, soft-drinks, basic grains and groceries.  Her plan is to continue growing and earning more income in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Fanseyni

texts.fr:
fanseyni habite dans la région du sud au sénégal.Agée de 49 ans divorcée depuis 1995.Elle 4 anfants qui sont tous à l'école et sont aussi a ses charges .Avec ce crédit,elle achate de la marchandise pour augmenter le stock de sa boutique,elle sa journée de 07h à 23h.
Fanseyni a démarré son commerce depuis 1995 au moment de sa divorce.Elle a démarreé son commerce avec un petit fonds sur une table pour étre là ou elle est.Avec son commerce,elle assure la nouriture de la famille et les frais scolaire ses enfants.
