Fanseyni a comme objectif:étre une grande commerçante et avoir un grand magasin et sa propre maison dans l'avenir
texts.en: Fanseyni lives in the southern region of Senegal. She is 49 years old and has been divorced since 1995. She has 4 children who live with her and all attend school. With this loan she will buy merchandise to increase the stock in her shop. Her day runs from 7am until 11pm. Fanseyni started her business in 1995 at the time of her divorce. She started her business with a small stock - on a table in order to be close to home. With her business, she is able to feed the family and pay the childrens' school fees. Fanseyni's goal: To be a successful shopkeeper and to have a big shop and her own house in the future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Dimas De Jesus

texts.es: El señor Dimas se dedica desde hace dos años a la venta de productos alimenticios en paquetes pequeños tales como canela, coco, miel, pasas y condimentos de manera ambulante ofreciendo tienda a tienda sus productos todos los días de 7:00 a.m a 5:00 p.m. A sus 40 años, el señor Dimas desea incrementar sus ventas, para lo cual necesita de la compra de surtido que le permita cumplir con su objetivo. El sueño del señor Dimas es tener su propio local para la venta de sus productos con el cual no tenga que salir a caminar día a día a buscar sus clientes y estar a la intemperie.
texts.en: For two years Señor Dimas has been hawking food in small packages, such as cinnamon, coconut, honey, raisins and spices, offering his products every day from 7 am to 5 pm. At the age of 40, he wants to boost his sales and therefore he needs to buy additional inventory in order to reach his goal. His dream is to have his own premises to sell his products. He wouldn't need any longer to walk through the streets to meet his customers and be exposed to wind and weather.

loans.use: to buy additional inventory, such as cinnamon, raisins, condiments, coconut and honey.

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr:
Monsieur OUMAR est né vers 1972 à FARAKOBA. Père de 5 enfants il vit dans une famille traditionnelle à LOULOUNI (troisième région administrtive de la république du Mali).
 Il mène des activités de commercialisation de céréales depuis plus de 4ans. Son expérience dans ce domaine, lui a valu une bonne réputation et reçoit des commandes de céréales, notamment du maïs et du sorgho. Ainsi pour avoir les ressources nécessaires afin de satisfaire ses clients, il collabore avec l’Institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à son  3 prêts maintenant, les deux prêts passés ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce prêt lui permettra d’acheter, 5 tonnes de maïs et 1 tonne de sorgho.
Il s’approvisionne dans les villages avoisinants de LOULOUNI. Les céréales sont stockées dans son magasin pendant un certain temps. Il  les revend au comptant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes venant de SIKASSO et de BAMAKO et souvent il les transporte à SIKASSO au besoin. 
Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 150 000 FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
Il compte devenir un grossiste
texts.en:
Oumar was born around 1972 in Farakoba. He is the father of 5 children and lives in a traditional family at Loulouni (the third largest administrative region of the Republic of Mali). 

He has been in the grain business for more than four years. His experience in this area has given him a good reputation and he receives orders for grains, mainly corn and sorgum. He is working with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to obtain the resources he needs to satisfy his customers. 

This is Oumar's third loan, and he has repaid the first two loans successfully. This loan will enable him to buy 5 tonnes of corn and 1 tonne of sorgum. He buys supplies in the villages around Loulouni. The grains are stored in his shop for a while, then he resells them for cash to male and female customers from Sikasso and Bamako. Often he transports the grains to Sikasso if required. 

With this loan, he expects to earn 150,000 FCFA a month. This income will allow him to pay the interest on his loan and invest in his business. He wants to become a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy cereal grain.

loans.name: Aleko

texts.en:
Aleko has been operating a little restaurant where he serves traditional foods from his region and also has been in the agricultural field for long time. Note here that Aleko is being dressed up and not photographed at his business because he was taken this shot just before some sudden trip. The field in the background though is his and is prepared for planting.
“I love cooking our regions specialty and luckily we have plenty,” Aleko said. “I also cultivate potatoes that my region is known for the best potato produce in our country and then sell them to wholesalers from another region. I have been working hard on both of my businesses and have faced difficulties for sure,” he continued.
Aleko is requesting this loan for the first time to buy potato seeds.

loans.use: To buy potato seeds for planting

loans.name: Estrellitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLITAS” iniciará el décimo sexto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Norah es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de verduras, venta de comida, tienda de barrio, taller de muelleria, venta de ropa, pensión, venta de coca, venta de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Norah es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio venta de artefactos de celular; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió conjuntamente su esposo hace diez años.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de artefactos de celular) que adquirirá de las ferias de la frontera Bolivia - Chile y posteriormente lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el crédito que ofrece el personal de la institución.

En la imagen falta una persona ya que se tuvo que ir a su negocio con urgencia, mientras que las personas que se encuentran agachadas no pertenecen al grupo.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “ESTRELLITAS” (Little Stars) will begin its sixteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Senkata Community Center. The group consists of 9 members and is led by a Board of Directors where Norah is the President.  The members of this communal bank engage in different businesses such as selling vegetables, selling food, neighborhood store, furniture workshop, selling clothing, a rooming house, selling coca leaves and selling groceries.

The loan they are taking out will benefit small microenterprises where Norah is a member. She says that she joined Pro Mujer eight years ago after receiving an invitation from a member who visited her at her house. Currently she has a business selling cellular devices. She gained knowledge about this business with her husband 10 years ago.

The loan she is now receiving will be used to increase capital, purchasing cellular devices, which will be purchased from fairs at the Bolivia-Chile border and later she will sell it in her business. Working in this manner enables her to generate income to support her family as she is married and has two children. 
 
When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she said that she likes the loan that the institution provides.

In the image a person from the group is missing since they had to go to urgent business. The people who are squatting are not in the group.

loans.use: to purchase cellular devices.

loans.name: Espoir Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ESPOIR est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans la même ville. La représentante du groupe, nommée  Yvette (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 35 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Yvette est mariée a un entrepreneur du nom de Arbel. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Yvette vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Yvette vend des bassines et des plastiques depuis cinq ans de façon ambulante. Yvette s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Yvette ensemble avec les membres du groupe ESPOIR sollicite pour la deuxième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit antérieur a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des bassines et des plastiques.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a native from the town of Pilar. She is 53-year-old married woman and has two grown children.  , 
She raises and sold hogs.  In addition to that, she also runs a sari-sari (variety) store, selling various commodities like  noodles,cooking oil, sugar, eggs, tooth paste shampoo and soap.

She would like to raise quality hogs and filled the inventories that is out of stock. But as of this time, Loreta has very limited amount of funds to make it so.Therefore she join CEVI to avail loans and would like to invest in feed and groceries for the store like assorted canned goods, beverages and soft drinks.
Slowly, she will be able to pay her obligation and handle her finances wisely. She would like to set aside half of the profit for future use and use the other half for the expansion of her both sources of income.

loans.use: to invest in feed and groceries for the store like assorted canned goods, beverages and soft drinks

loans.name: Israfil

texts.en:
Israfil is Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Gubadli region.  With 2 children he settled in Sumgait city. He has been engaged in this business for 8 years. Having borrowed the loan amount of $400 from Normicro he built his own shop. The second time he borrowed $800 and bought foodstuffs: sugar, tea, rice and etc. For the third time he borrowed a loan of $1000 to built the food market. Now he has own food market.
Israfil needs loan amount of $1200 to buy the new refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy the new refrigerator

loans.name: Julio César

texts.en:
Julio César is married and has four children, 13, 9, and 4 years and the youngest just 9 months old. Two years ago, he fount himself without work, and because he had little academic education it was difficult to find any. The debts of the household and the children's school kept accumulating. In order to cover them, he started selling cosmetics to his relatives and neighbors, and today his customers have multiplied.

Julio has worked hard so that his children can continue with their studies, because he thinks it is very important for their future. At the moment, he needs a loan of $250.00, which he will use to buy merchandise. He hopes with the greater investment, he will be able to obtain greater income to buy the necessities for his family. There is no doubt that you can help this family. Please decide to support them.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Ratana

texts.en: Ratana has been married more than 3 years and she has one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her mother more than 14 years ago and she started silk production after that. Her husband, Mr. Yon Sarorn, used to weave silk as well, but now he is raising pigs instead. Her family has borrowed loans from MAXIMA twice. The current loan amount is $600. She will use this loan to purchase a motorbike and expand the shed for raising pigs. The family does not have any problem with repayment.

loans.use: Expanding the shed for pigs and buying a motorbike.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy Ogbonaye is married with four children. She is 35 years of age and  hails from Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been a member of LAPO for 5 years. Mercy sells provisions at the open-air market and needs a loan of $400 to expand the inventory of her micro-business.

loans.use: To expand the inventory of her market stall

loans.name: Amid

texts.en:
Mr. Amid is a low income vulnerable person. He is 23 and lives with his family in Saatli town, which is in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan, in the Caucasus region.

Amid rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town and sells food. The business is very successful and needs investment to increase the daily turnover. However, Amid has no collateral and so he cannot apply to the commercial banks for a loan. Therefore, he applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a $500 loan. This loan would help him to buy and sell a larger amount of goods and to provide better for his family.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods to sell

loans.name: Fermina

texts.es:
Ever since they started their family thirty-five years ago, Fermina and her husband, Carlos, have dedicated themselves to making ceramic objects, a job they fulfill with skill, and responsibility. Thanks to this work, they meet their family expenses and the higher education tuition of their seven dear children. Both begin their daily work at 7:00am and work until 5:00 in the afternoon, working on their creative, novel and high-quality goods that are later sold wholesale throughout Lima to be prized and valued in the markets. Now, in spite of their advancing ages, they still wish to expand their business to export their goods throughout the world. To solidify their dreams, they remain diligently absorbed in their work and also turn to your generous support to request a loan. They promise to repay in eight months. Let’s give this adorable couple the opportunity to make their anxious dreams concrete. Your support will be a wise investment in their hands.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Desde que formaron su familia hace más de 35 años Fermina y su esposo , Carlos se dedicaron a la fabricación de objetos cerámicos, trabajo que desempeñan con mucha destreza y responsabilidad solventando con satisfacción gracias a este oficio sus gastos familiares y los estudios superiores de sus siete queridos hijos.Ambos inician su labor diaria a las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 5:00 de la tarde, elaborando trabajos creativos, novedosos y de excelente calidad, que luego son vendidos al por mayor en la ciudad de Lima y que son muy cotizados y valorados en el mercado.Ahora, pese a la avanzada edad de cada uno, aún están deseosos de seguir expandiendo su mercadería hasta lograr exportar al mundo entero sus hermosos trabajos. Para concretar sus sueños ambos se desenvuelven diligentemente en esta noble labor y al mismo tiempo recurre a tu ayuda generosa y solicita un préstamo y promete rembolsarlo en un lapso de ocho meses.“Démosle la oportunidad de concretar sus ansiados sueños a esta adorable pareja, tu aporte será una inversión sabia en sus manos”

loans.use: Purchase of basic materials such as clay, firewood, and paint

loans.name: Ruhsora

texts.ru:
Ruhsora K., who is 25, was originally an elementary school teacher. She is married without children. Ruhsora specializes in sales of fabrics for traditional women's clothing. Her business is located in the central market in the city of Kurgan-Tube, where she rents a space. There are a lot of women who live in the city and the surrouning areas and exclusively wear traditional clothing. For this reason, using the new loan, she plans to purchase new fabrics to increase the variety of her inventory. By renewing the assortment of her goods, she will give local residents an opportunity to purchase stylish fabrics for women's clothing. Ruhsora plans to pay off the loan with 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Vasilisa Budnikova. Kiva Volunteer.

Хайдарова Рухсора, возраст – 25 лет, образование среднее, по специальности преподователь начальных классов, замужем, детей не имеет. Рухсора занимается продажей женских национальных тканей на центральном рынке в городе Курган-Тюбе, для этого она арендует торговую точку. На полученный кредит она планирует приобрести новый ассортимент товара для пошива женской одежды, так как в городе Курган-Тюбе и близлежащих районах живут женщины, которые носят только национальную одежду. Обновив свой ассортимент предлагаемых товаров, она даст возможность местным жителям приобретать модные женские ткани для пошива одежды. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of additional sets of new fabrics.

loans.name: Aly

texts.en:
Aly is a business woman, mother, and community leader.  She has a store in her house where she sells groceries to the populace of San Juan, district of La Banda de Shilcayo, province and department of San Martin.  In the store she provides her community with the goods they want so they don’t need to walk to the market on the other side of town.  She says since starting the business two years ago she has experienced much success.

Aly is 30 years old, has two children, and lives with her boyfriend.  Her children are young and she is happy she gets to work from home and spend time with them.  She started her business to help support her family’s financial needs.  Her boyfriend is very supportive and helps her with some of the more physically demanding work.  Aly never had the opportunity to study at a University so she is determined to send her children there.

Aly is the founding member and treasurer of her community bank Las Margaritas.  They now have 30 members.  She is always seeking new members but says it’s often difficult to find women that are responsible and punctual with their finances; Aly is very strict.  Aly is requesting a loan of S/. 1,800 that she will repay in six months and to invest into her store.  With the loan she will restock old products and add new popular goods.  Aly is confident this loan will help her business achieve a new level of success.

loans.use: She will restock old products and add new popular goods

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro works in public transportation driving a taxi. His wife sells supplies and provisions. With their two jobs Pedro and his wife support three children, all of which are in high school or at the state university. Their home is located in Zone 1 of El Alto city.

The requested loan will be used to maintain Pedro's taxi. With proper maintenance, he can continue working and generate income for his family. This is his second credit loan with Impro. This loan was provided to Pedro due to his good record repaying previous loans.

Translated from Spanish by Geoff Rubin, Kiva volunteer

Pedro es chofer de transporte publico, maneja un TAXI. Su esposa es vivandera, ambos cubren la manutención de sus tres hijos (los cuales estudian en el colegio y en la universidad estatal) con dichas actividades. El domicilio de la familia esta ubicado en la Zona 1ro de mayo de la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito será destinado al mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo (TAXI), de esa manera continuará trabajando y generando ingresos familiares. Este es su segundo crédito con Impro. El análisis de sus antecedentes lo facultan para otorgarle otro préstamo.

loans.use: Maintenance of taxi

loans.name: Mahmadisso

texts.ru:
Mahmadisso G. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi. He is 43 years old, married and has three children. Mahmadisso has a high school degree. For the last 9 years he has been raising cattle for meat sales. He purchases calves at the market, feeds the animals for 40-45 days to fatten them up then sells at the same market for a higher price.This business is the sole source of income for the family and expanding his business will allow Mahmadisso to increase his profits and improve the living conditions of his family. Mahmadisso's business also provides the local market with a source of fresh meat. Mahmadisso is planning to use the loan money to purchase several young bulls and he is hoping to pay back the money in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Гуломов Махмадиссо Чайдарович проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 43 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается животноводством. Разводит крупно-рогатый скот для перепродажи их на мясо . Покупает товар на рынке района, откармливает около 40-45 дней , а затем перепродает по более выгодной цене. Занимается этим видом бизнеса клиент уже 9 лет. Этот бизнес является основным источником дохода его семьи, поэтому развитие его бизнеса поможет ему увеличить доходы , тем самым улучшив условия жизни. Кроме того развитие данного сектора позволяет обеспечивать рынки свежим мясом. Клиент хочет получить кредит для того чтобы закупить молодых бычков. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12месяцев.

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Tuutuuka Group 2

texts.en:
Annet N. represents the group. She is 28 years old and married with a nine-year-old child. She also cares for a ten-year-old orphan. Annet's husband works as a chauffeur and together they have hopes that their daughter will one day be a nurse.

Annet's menswear shop is only one year old, but it is already thriving. She has recently begun to complement her retail business in Kayunga by selling some of her stock at several markets in the area. The market side of the business is proving to be more profitable and so she is seeking a loan to buy more stock. Buying in bulk from Kampala will reduce the cost of the clothes as well as of transportation. Annet will sell this new stock at various markets in the area..

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To use in the group's various businesses and to pay for daily expenses.

loans.name: Inobat

texts.en: T. Inobat is 47 years old. She is married with four children. Her husband is tractor operator at the local farm. For the past seven years, Inobat has made a living selling vegetables and fruits such as tomatoes, cucumbers, apricots, strawberries and cherries. Her elder son helps Inobat with the business, which begins early in the morning at 5:00 a.m. She buys vegetables and fruits from the local farmers and sells them in the market.  She does her selling in a market that is known for attractive prices. All this allows Inobat’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for her family. Today she is planning to purchase new, fresh fruits and vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of goods she offers. With this goal in mind, she has applied for a loan of $300 which she will pay back in three months. Inobat has a positive credit history with IMON, and promises to repay the current loan as promptly as she has done in the past. Inobat and her  family need some help and hope you will become a part of her business.

loans.use: To increase the range of vegetables and fruits she has to sell

loans.name: Resami

texts.en:
Mrs. Resami S. lives in Kuleshwor, located in Kathmandu district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in small businesses like grocery businesses, tailoring shops and so on. Mrs. S. lives in a joint family home with her husband, father-in-law and mother-in-law. Her husband's name is Mr. Rajesh S. and he works in a private office.

Resami is a tailor in Kuleshwor. She opened her tailoring shop two years ago to upgrade the living standard of her family. Before starting her own business she took 6 months of training for tailoring work. She makes different types of ladies' dresses in her shop. She especially prefers to makes popular ladies' dresses like Kurta-Sulwar. Now she is requesting for her second loan of Rs 15000.00 to buy raw materials for her tailoring work.

loans.use: Resami would like to buy raw materials for her work as a tailor.

loans.name: Afisa

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 31 year-old Asifa M.. She is not married, and has no children. She has one dependent, who lives with her because she is an orphan. In 2007, Asifa established her crops business. Working six days a week, and six to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $80 every month from this business. Asifa requires a loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately US $13. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Olimpya's Ngorongoro Group

texts.en:
Olimpya is married with two children aged ten and five; she also cares for a 15-year-old child. She became a food seller in 2004. Every day she works from 8am to 6pm and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Olimpya now hopes for a loan to buy more cosmetics inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her group member Elizabeth, who also has a business dealing in clothes sales.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics items for her business.

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es: Maria Rosario tiene 61 años, ha sido una madre soltera que tuvo 7 hijos, 5 varones y 2 mujeres los dos últimos menores, uno esta en la Universidad y el otro en la Escuela Secundaria. Doña Maria Rosario se preparo en cursos de Estilismo y cosmetología y logro poner una pequeña sala de Belleza con pequeños prestamos, en la actualidad cuenta con 41 años de experiencia en el ramo y solicita su crédito para poder ver hecho realidad sus metas de mejorar su nivel de vida y poder heredar a los hijos un  negocio auto sostenible y su empeño es seguir diversificando productos en la Sala de Belleza ofertando  además de cosméticos, accesorios para el cabello,  Ropa y zapatos.
texts.en:
Maria Rosario is 61 years old. She has been a single mother who had 7 children; 5 boys and 2 girls. The two youngest are minors. One attends the University and the other is in Secondary School. Doña Maria Rosario prepared herself with courses in fashion design and cosmetology and managed to start a small beauty salon with small loans. Currently she relies on 41 years of experience in the area and requests a loan to be able to realize her goals to improve her standard of living and to be able to leave the children a self-sustaining business. She plans to continue diversifying products in the beauty salon, offering hair accessories, clothes and shoes, in addition to cosmetics.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve her beauty salon by diversifying the products she offers.

loans.name: Gainazar

texts.en: Mr. K. Gainazar was born in 1962 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan. He is married and has 4 children. Mr. K. Gainazar has been an active client of MicroInvest since 2006. He trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure so he works well with us. Mr. K. Gainazar trades tubing, reinforcement rods and angle bars in the local bazaar. He works hard to ensure a good future for his children. Mr. K. Gainazar applies to KIVA for a business support loan of 3800 STJ (USD $1125) for 5 months.  With this loan, he can open a trade outlet in the central bazaar, which will permit him to trade independently and to increase his sales.

loans.use: To increase his sales

loans.name: Sharifan M.ashiq Group

texts.en:
Sharifan baji is the wife of M. and resides in the city of Pakpattan, Pakistan. Pakpattan city is famous for its shrine of great Punjabi Sufi poet, Babar Fareed Ganj Shakkar. She owns a two room brick house and has been living in it for the past 10 years. She has no children. Sharifan baji’s husband has had a mobile phone selling business for the past two years. He buys mobile phones from a big market named “Hall Road,” and then resells them. Sharifan baji herself is a housewife and prefers to do household work. She has successfully repaid two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a third loan to buy more mobile phones for her husband’s phone shop.

This is a group loan, and she is joined in her request by four other members. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in their own businesses. G. Fatima baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business. Naziran baji wants a loan to buy leather and nails for her shoe making business. Parveen Akhtar baji wants a loan to buy bicycles for her bicycle selling business, and Sharifan baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil, and spices for her food business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy more mobile phones for their phone business.

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen O. is 38 years old and married with four children. Queen is a retailer and sells foodstuffs like rice, beans, garri, etc.  She needs the loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more products to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Nhoek

texts.en:
Nhoek Y. is a 19-year-old who lives in Saladeng Village in the Banteay Meanchey Province. She grows mushrooms to sell, and has been growing them since 2005. Her business is going well. 

Her husband, age 28, is employed as a driver with a fixed salary, and he drives very well. The young couple have two small children. She also cares for an elderly woman who can help her a little in her work. 

Because she wants to improve her family's income, she wants her husband to have has own car to drive as a taxi. Hence, she would like to request a loan, which she will use with her savings to purchase a used car for $3200 for her husband to drive.

loans.use: To buy a used car for her husband to drive as a taxi

loans.name: Silvia Irena

texts.es:
La señora Silvia Irene C. se destaca en el Mercado la Estación de la ciudad de León como vendedora de verduras dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 20 años siendo este su único negocio con el cual mantiene a su familia compuesta por su pequeño hijo el cual tiene el deber de mantener por ser menor de edad.

La necesidad que hoy en día ella está atravesando es que necesita de inmediato la compra de las verduras y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito que le permita la compra y así seguir adelante en su negocio de venta de verduras comercializando estos perecederos.
texts.en:
Silvia Irene Carvahal holds forth at the Estacion market in the city of Leon as a vegetable vendor, something that she has done for the past 20 years. With this business she has cared for her family, which includes her young son whose care is her duty as he is a minor. Her current need is to immediately purchase vegetables, and for this purpose she has requested a loan through Ceprodel, which will allow her to make the purchase and continue with her vegetable sales business, selling this perishable item.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables

loans.name: Mrs. Sopheap Hat Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people, who all live in Tropang Buon village in the Kampong Chhang province, make up this village bank loan. Mrs. Sopheap H. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Noy Soklun, is a palm juice collector who gathers it to process into palm sugar. To make palm sugar, Mr. Noy Soklun needs firewood to burn palm juice into palm sugar. Mrs. Sopheap H. has decided to request a loan to purchase firewood for this purpose. She is 27 years old and the mother of three children two of whom are attending the local school while the youngest one is only three years old.

Thirteen members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to burn palm juice into palm sugar.

loans.name: Felicita,

texts.es:
Felicita ya lleva más de veinte años con los préstamos de EDAPROSPO. Gracias a ello y a su gran de esfuerzo, hoy se siente orgullosa no solo de tener un negocio más estable, sino de haber ayudado a sus cuatro a hijos a que culminen sus estudios. Ella asegura que la mayor inversión que ha podido hacer ha sido el estudio de sus hijos.

El negocio de Felicita empezó como una librería en su casa. Como al inicio vendía poco uno de sus hijos decidió apoyarla. Luego de un tiempo ella le encargo el negocio y ella se mudó al mercado para dedicarse al negocio que hasta hoy lleva para adelante, la venta de granos y menestras en el mercado de su barrio.

Su esposo trabaja como personal administrativo en una universidad estatal. Junto con el mantiene el hogar y paga los estudios de su menor hijo, quien esta cursando la carrera de Matemática pura. Por ahora, solo quiere mantenerse en las ventas de su negocio, en un futuro tal vez podría cambiar de rubro.
texts.en:
Felicita has been an EDAPROSPO loan recipient for over twenty years. Thanks to the loans and to her efforts, she is proud not only to have a more stable business but also of having helped her four children finish their studies. She believes that the greatest investment she could have made was in her children's educations. Felicita began with a home-based stationary store. At the beginning, she sold little so one of her children decided to help her. After some time she left him in charge of the enterprise and she moved to the marketplace in her neighborhood to dedicate herself to the business that is today her main occupation, the sale of grains and miscellany. Her husband works as an administrator at the local state university. With him, she supports her home and pays for her youngest son's schooling; he is majoring in mathematics. For now, her sales business is her main interest but doesn't discard the possibility of a future change in focus.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For merchandise and her daughter's graduation expenses.

loans.name: Durga

texts.en:
Durga T. lives in Sainbu-Bhaishipati, Lalitpur, in a joint family with her father in law, husband and two children. Her husband Brijeshpati T. works in a restaurant. She has one son and one daughter. Her daughter is studying in grade three and son is in first grade.

Durga wants to start a goat farm because she knows that she can earn more profit. She also has experience in this job.

She is requesting Rs15,000 to start a goat farming business. She will use this loan to buys goats and food grains for the goats.

loans.use: Buy goats and feed.

loans.name: Iliam

texts.es: Iliam tiene 19 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus hermanos. Hace 6 mese se dedica a su reciente negocio de venta de abarrotes en una pequeña tienda, atiende durante todo el día, excepto los fines de semana, y cuanta con el apoyo de sus padres cuando ella sale a estudiar. Su trabajo consiste en estar pendiente de  que sus productos estén siempre listos para la venta, para lo cual se abastece de mercadería constantemente. Para Iliam, este trabajo le permite generarse ingresos para poder auto sostenerse, y más adelante, desea implementar su tienda con mejores mostradores. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy entusiasmada de realizar un trabajo para mejorar, no solo su calidad de vida, sino también de los demás integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que solicita lo usará para abastecerse de más mercadería, comprará gaseosas, leche evaporado en tarro, y demás productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Iliam, 19, lives at home with her parents and siblings. Six months ago she started her business of selling groceries in a small store. She tends the store all day, except for the week ends. She counts on the support of her parents when she needs to leave for her studies. Her work consists of making sure that her products are always ready for sale, which means she is constantly stocking her merchandise. This work allows Iliam to generate income to support herself. In the future she would like to equip her store with better display counters. This is her first loan with MFP, and she is very enthusiastic about improving her work, not just to improve her life, but also for the other members of her community bank. She will use the loan to stock more merchandise, buy soft drinks, evaporated milk, and other essential products.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es socia del Banco Comunal Desarrollo.
Liliana es soltera, tiene 25 años y 1 hijo, Liliana vende pescado fresco y congelado, sus ventas los realiza en la puerta de su casa los días sábados y domingos. Además Liliana trabaja en una tienda como ayudante.
Liliana necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pescado.
Los sueños de Liliana son ampliar su negocio y tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Liliana is a member of the Desarrollo (Progress) Village Bank. She is 25, single, and has one child. On Saturdays and Sundays she sells fresh and frozen fish from outside her front door. She also works as an assistant in a store. She is seeking a loan of 800 soles to buy fish. She dreams of growing her business and having her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long L. is a 30-year-old villager in the Pursat Province of Cambodia. She is a local rice farmer and is a good housewife who cares for four teenage children, all four of whom are students. Her husband (pictured) helps meet the family's food needs by driving a motorbike taxi, as well as working as a requirement worker. 

Recently, Long L.’s husband is facing difficulty with his old motorbike that has broken down frequently. In order to solve this problem, Long L. would like a loan to add with her savings for her husband to buy a new motorbike to replace the existing one.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike to replace the existing one

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Tile cutter and other new tools

loans.name: María

texts.es: María es una madre trabajadora, tiene 45 años, vive con sus 2 hijas de 15 y 8 años; ya que su esposo viajó a España a trabajar para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Es por eso que María al quedarse sola optó por generar una fuente de ingresos adicional, decidiéndose por algo que pueda realizar desde su hogar sin dejar de velar por sus hijas. Entonces comenzó a vender productos de belleza, lo cual le permite obtener ganancias desde su propio domicilio, además le gusta su trabajo porque vende sus productos a personas conocidas, amigos, familiares y vecinos, por lo que trabaja dejando sus productos con garantía, sin caer en deudas que la perjudiquen. Las ganancias son buenas, ya que por cada producto que vende gana el 25%, además con su facilidad de palabra y carisma logra convencer de que adquieran sus productos. María en el futuro quiere implementar un pequeño bazar en su propia casa donde exhiba mejor sus productos y logre mejores ingresos. Este es su tercer ciclo de préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA, nunca tuvo problemas de retrasos en los pagos, ya que siempre fue muy responsable, al igual que el resto de su grupo con quienes dice tener mucha química. Con el dinero solicitado hará pedidos de sus productos en mayor cantidad para tener un stock más amplio y variado.
texts.en:
Maria is a working mother. She is 45 years old and she has two daughters who are 15 and 8 years old. Her husband went to Spain to work and give them a better quality of life. This is why, upon finding herself alone, Maria decided to generate some more income, dedicating herself to something she could do from home so as to not leave her kids. She started to sell beauty products, which allows her to earn from her own home. She really like his work because she sells to people she knows; friends, family and neighbours, and she leaves them her products on guaruntee, without falling into dangerous debt. She earns well as for each product she sells she earns 25%. She is a good saleswoman too and with her charisma she manages to convince people to buy her products. In the future Maria would like to have a small shop in her home from where she could better exhibit her products and earn more. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA, and she has never been late on payments as she was very responsible like the rest of the group with whom she has good chemistry. With this loan she will buy products in bulk to have a bigger and wider range of stock.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise/Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a motorcycle-taxi

loans.name: Nabila Naz Abdul Hafiz Group

texts.en:
Nabila Naz baji, the wife of A. H., has lived in Chichawatni, Pakistan for 18 years. She is a very hardworking lady. She operates a business sewing clothes. Her neighbors order from her because she is very committed and never disturbs the customer. She has been doing this work for five years. She saves her money in a committee fund and plans to renovate her house with her share of the committee fund. Her husband drives a donkey cart and uses this vehicle to deliver the items to the assigned place. She is applying for a loan to buy a new donkey cart because the old one has become rough and rotted. 

This loan group consists of two additional people: 

Rubina baji wants a loan to buy a donkey cart for loading. 
Suraiya baji wants a loan to buy tea and milk for her tea stall. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

Nabila baji is seated in the middle of the bajis in the photograph.

Note: "Baji," which means "older sister," is a term of respect for women in Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a new donkey cart

loans.name: Mrs. Channa Phen Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people living in Serei Duoch village in Takeo province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Channa P. is the 40-year-old village bank president. She owns a small business selling juice. Her husband, Mr. Mang Polo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. In this plantation, he needs the money to buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water to support the field. Thus, Mrs. Channa P. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She has four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. (Mrs. Sorn MA. did not come to take the loan but her husband did, so he is in the picture instead her.) 

All the members in this group loan have end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline to pump water

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 23 years old. She started her business by selling silver jewelry in her village. Later, she started into a direct selling business, which she has run for the past 6 years. She earns an income of PHP 4,000 each month. She hopes to increase her income by asking for a loan of PHP 18,000 from Kiva lenders. She remembers starting her business with only PHP 5,000 in initial capital. She just hopes to sustain the good performance of her direct selling business with the support of Kiva loans. 

She is married to Eduarne, an FX driver in Rizal, Antipolo. They have two children, Jed Mark, age  4, and Cyrile, age 2. She lives with five family members in Barangay Nungnungan in Cauayan City. Every week, her husband sends her PHP 3,000 for their daily expenses. She works hard and patiently to gain more income to support her son and daughter.

loans.use: Additional capital

loans.name: Isidra

texts.en:
Isidra S. is from the village of Purok Santan, Cabantian, Magsaysay. She is 47 years old, married, and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Isidra owns and operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of foods, snacks, and other delicacies in the local community. Isidra has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Isidra joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Isidra is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients to make the food she sells. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Isidra from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients to produce the food.

loans.name: Reyna Margarita

texts.es: Reyna Margarita R. Hernandes, 28 years old, plans to use this loan to purchase cosmetics, perfume and clothes to sell in her fledgling store. Reyna worked for eight years in a health center but has decided to make a career move and wants to open a small store which she believes will provide a better income. Her grand vision is to have a store from which she can sell her perfumes and things, for now, her store is based in the home that she shares with her parents. So far Reyna reports that she is off to a good start, especially with her mother to help her run the store, they have been without any major problems for the business. Reyna isn’t married and doesn’t have any children.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: María De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
María de los Ángeles V. Muñoz es una señora de 51 años, vecina de Los Tijos de Upala, localizado en la provincia de Alajuela. Es una comunidad rural  con una extensión relativamente grande, con topografía semi montañosa ubicada en Costa Rica, Centroamérica.  La comunidad se dedica especialmente a la agricultura de granos básicos, y en menor escala a la ganadería. Vive con su esposo y dos de sus hijos.

Desde hace 2 años doña María se dedica a la siembra de papaya, por lo tanto, dice que posee bastante experiencia en el cuidado y mantenimiento de esta clase de cultivo, tiene un pequeño  terreno en el cual ha sembrado papaya anteriormente y le ha dado muy buenos resultados a la hora de distribuirla por lo cual desea expandir su plantación, ya que gracias a este negocio la calidad de vida de su familia ha mejorado considerablemente.

Lo que en estos momentos solicita doña María es un micro crédito de ¢680,000 (seiscientos ochenta mil colones), para comprar fertilizantes, semillas, y diferentes insumos para dar el mejor mantenimiento y asistencia posible a su cosecha, así al final podrá ser recompensada y podrá tener una muy buena producción. 

Doña María forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Los Tijos, una de las 100 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será  su segundo crédito y dice que con el espera seguir creciendo como microempresaria y sacar su negocio adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
María de los Ángeles V. Muñoz is 51 years old and a resident of Los Tijos de Upala, which is located in Alajuela province. She lives with her husband and two children. Her rural community lies within the semi-mountainous topography of Costa Rica in Central America. The main industry in the community is centered on agriculture, especially the cultivation of grains, and livestock breeding to a lesser extent.

For two years, Doña María has been cultivating papayas. She says she has enough experience in the care and maintenance of this type of crop. She has a small area designated for planting papaya and has achieved very good results harvesting and distributing her crops in previous seasons. Therefore, she wants to expand her plantation. Thanks to the success of her business, the quality of life for her family has improved considerably.

At the moment, Doña María is requesting a microloan of 680,000 colones to buy fertilizers, seeds, and different supplies in order to maintain and promote the growth of her crop with hopes of being rewarded by a good harvest.

Doña María is a member of the Community Credit Enterprise of Los Tijos, one of 100 partner organizations that make up EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be her second loan and says that she hopes to continue growing as a micro-entrepreneur and move her business forward. She also thanks these types of organizations and credit facilitators who enable her to spend more time on productive activities.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inputs & supplies for growing papaya

loans.name: Jjagwe

texts.en:
Jjagwe S. is 38 years old. He is married with three children who are all in school. He has four dependents he is taking care of as well, and they are also in school.

He has a clothing business through which he sells both retail and wholesale. He has been in this business for over eight years. He is using the loan to purchase and stock more clothes in order to expand the business. He wants to buy more skirts, trousers, tops, bed covers, carpets, shirts and blankets.

His dream is to expand his business and improve on his daily average sales for more profit. He also intends to educate his children to higher levels and to care for his family.

loans.use: To purchase and stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia es casada, es madre de 07 hijos (05 varones y 02mujeres), estudió primaria completa, vive en el Distrito de Pilcuyo, de la  Provincia el Collao, Departamento de Puno.

Desde hace 01 año integra el Banco Comunal “Miraflores”, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa (chompa, buzos), negocio que se dedica desde los 18 años de edad, compra sus productos en las ciudades de Desaguadero, Juliaca y vende en la ciudad de Ilave, con su primer crédito  de 300.00 nuevos soles aumentó su mercadería.

Ella continuará trabajando en su negocio y para incrementar su capital requiere un nuevo  crédito de 500.00 nuevos soles para la compra de más chompas y buzos.

Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos sean profesionales y seguir aumentando más capital a su negocio.
texts.en:
Virginia is married, and is the mother of 7 children (5 boys and 2 girls.) She completed her primary education, and lives in the Pilcuyo district of Collao province, in the Puno region. For one year she has been a member of the communal bank "Miraflores." She has had a business selling clothes (jackets, sweatshirts) since she was 18 years old. She buys her products in the cities of Desaguadero and Juliaca and sells them in the city of Llave. With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she increased her merchandise. She will continue working on her business, and in order to increase her capital she needs a loan of 500 nuevos soles to buy more jackets and sweatshirts. She dreams of her sons becoming professionals, and of continuing to increase the capital in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy jackets and sweatshirts

loans.name: Nemia

texts.en:
Nemia M. is 40 years old. She lives in the village of Brgy Narawis, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. Her husband works in an Electric Company in Negros Occidental with a good salary. They have 3 children ages 18 to 22 years, 2 of whom are in college taking Marine Engineering and HRM courses. In spite of her husband's salary, she wants to help him with their children's education.

Nemia started her business in 2004 when she joined NWTF-Project Dungganon and borrowed the capital to invest in a frozen foods business. Different kinds of frozen products are sold from their house, around their community, and in other villages. She is able to earn a minimum of Php 2,000 per month. Most of the income goes to transportation, school expenses, and projects for the schools of her children.

Her previous loan of Php 15,000 as additional capital for her frozen foods sales was fully repaid on time, without any delay. She recently borrowed Php 13,000 for the needs of her business. Income from it will be used to help with the children's education.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project 'Dungganon'; (a Hiligaynon word that means 'Honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than US$ 1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Araba

texts.en: Araba is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children who are all in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a fishing dominated community in the central region of Ghana. Araba is a trader. She trades in secondhand clothes. She hawks and treks to nearby communities to sell on their market days. Araba has been in business for five years and wants to upgrade her business. Therefore, she wants the loan to procure bales of textile goods.

loans.use: To buy bales of secondhand clothes to sell

loans.name: Loira Pricila

texts.es: Loira Pricila Ávalos de 46 años de edad, reside en el Municipio de Ilopango, vive junto a tres hijos los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda, en la cual vende productos alimenticios y de primera necesidad, negocio el cual es de mucha importancia para Loira ya que ha sido a través de este como ha logrado solventar todos los gastos del hogar, esforzándose mucho para poder hacerlo. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar más productos como leche, pan, cereales, granos básicos y otros más, los cuales le aseguren nuevos clientes y el poder mejorar sus ingresos, ya que tanto ella como sus hijos tienen la necesidad y el deseo de mejorar su economía y debido a que la tienda es la única fuente de ingresos que poseen es necesario invertir en ella para tener una mejor vida.
texts.en:
Loira Pricila Ávalos, 46, lives in Ilopango with her three children, who are students. She has a grocery store where she sells food and basic needs items. This business is very important for Loira in that it has allowed her, through much effort, to meet her household expenses. She is requesting funding so that she can buy basic items like: milk, bread, cereals, basic grains, etc. which will attract more customers and improve her earnings since both she and her children need and wish to improve their economic situation and because the store is the family's only source of income; she needs to invest in it in order to have a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic needs items.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna A. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 53 years old. Myrna is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Myrna sells seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Inocencio

texts.es:
El Sr. Inocencio Ortíz es de la compañía Calixtro de la ciudad de Carapeguá, el mismo está casado y  es propietario de un establecimiento dedicado a la venta de leche y queso, actividad que realiza en compañía de su esposa e hijos.

 Cuenta con todas las comodidades para el desarrollo de su trabajo y es muy conocido por la zona gracias a la calidad de sus productos. Se acercó a  nuestra entidad para solicitar préstamo para la compra de animales vacunos de manera aumentar su nivel de producción y así satisfacer la demanda que actualmente tiene de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mr. Inocencio Ortíz lives in the village of Calixtro near the city of Carapeguá. He is married and sells milk and cheese out of an establishment that he operates with the help of his wife and children. He has the ability to take his work to the next level, and is well known in the area thanks to the quality of his products. He visited Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya to request a loan to buy cows and in that way increase production and meet his customers' demand.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cows for milk production

loans.name: Agbéhomilo

texts.fr:
Cette femme  exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce en gros de bijoux et bazins, elle s’approvisionne  à  Dubaï, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2008, beaucoup de revendeuse du grand marché viennent s’approvisionner chez elle, voulant se réapprovisionner elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour se réapprovisionner en bijoux et bazins
Elle est célibataire et c’est avec le revenu de son commerce qu’elle subvient à ses besoins.
texts.en:
To make a living, Agbéhomilo A. buys and sells wholesale jewelery and damask fabric. She stocks up on supplies in Dubai. She has done this work since 2008. Many traders from the central market come to buy supplies from her. Wanting to restock, she is asking for a loan from WAGES to purchase more jewelery and damask. She is single, and she meets her needs with the revenue made from her trade.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelery and damask fabric

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 20-year-old single man living with his parents and five siblings. As the area he came from is primarily agricultural, he has learned about this occupation for the past 5 years. He started working as a farmer on his own in 2008. He cultivates all types of vegetables depending on the season, and he sells the products in a big agriculture market widely known in the area. He and his father are the only providers for the family. With his business income, he helps his father satisfy the family expenses. 

Salah is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy fertilizers and summer seeds to cultivate his land for the summer season.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and summer seeds

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been a widow for some years now and she has five children. They are three boys and two girls; she cares for them alone. She sells groceries and foodstuffs in her shop and she has been in the business for the past six years. She is very happy with the growth of her business and she hopes for the loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all lenders for their wonderful support.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Jamillah

texts.en:
Jamillah A. is from the village of  Tagoloan, Misamis Bukidnon. She is 45 years old. Jamillah is single and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Jamillah owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling "ukay ukay," or used clothing, in the local community. Jamillah has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2009, Jamillah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wanted to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Jamillah has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jamillah is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jamillah from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her used-clothing sales business

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Don Francisco V.  vive en la zona # 7 de Nueva Guinea, es casado y  tiene 5 hijos: 4 mujeres y un varon, todos estudian.  Francisco trabaja como Guarda de seguridad  desde hace 19 años,  el se caracteriza por ser muy responsable, honesto y trabajador  desde  niño a aprendido a trabajar y a valorar lo que mas ama su familia, su esposa labora como operaria de una planta procesadora de tuberculos, ambos comparten los gastos familiares del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos.  

Está solicitando financiamiento de su 6to credito, con el cual pretende construir  una habitaciòn y asi brindarles a sus hijos mayor privacidad y seguridad, ya que son una familia de escasos recursos econòmicos.  Expresa que se siente muy agradecido con AFODENIC ya que poco a poco han mejorado su nivel de vida, pues los creditos anteriores los ha invertido en la mejora de su casa.  

Su sueños es tener estabilidad laboral, una vivienda digna y que sus hijos sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Francisco V. lives in zone #7 of Nueva Guinea, is married and the father of 5 children: 4 girls and a boy, who are all studying. Francisco has worked as a security guard for the past 19 years, and is a responsible, honest and hard worker who as a child learned to value work and family above all. Francisco shares responsibility for household expenditures with his wife, who works in a plant processing root vegetables. Mr. Velazques seeks his 6th microcredit loan in order to constuct an additional room on his house in order to provide for his children with increased space, privacy and security in their modest home. He is very grateful to AFODENIC for its microlending services, which have greatly benefited his family and household. Francisco hopes for continued work stability, a dignified home and success for his children in their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Matthew Cassetta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Room addition for house

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe sont  des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 34 ans, 4 enfants et vivant  dans des  familles polygames à Bougoula Ville, un des quartiers de la ville de Sikasso (3ème région administrative du Mali). 
Elles sont à leur onzième collaboration avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle et tous les prêts passés se sont bien dénoués. 
Ce groupe de femmes fait   le commerce  d’articles divers tels que la pomme de terre  avec  Sali B.,  le savon, de la friperie etc.
Sali compte acheter avec son  prêt, 30 caisses  de pommes de terre au grand  marché de Médine à Sikasso et effectuera sa vente au marché du centre de Sikasso et en famille à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes, au comptant. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 17.500fcfa dont une partie sera utilisée  dans les dépenses familiales et les évènements sociaux et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group are married women in polygamous families with a median age of 34 and four children. They live in Bougoula Ville, one of the quarters of Sikasso (third administrative region of Mali). They are on their 11th loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to satisfy their clients' needs. All of their previous loans have been repaid in full. This group of women sells diverse articles like potatoes, soap, second-hand clothes, etc. Sali B. (a group member) counts on purchasing 20 cases of potatoes with her loan at the large market of Médine in Sikasso. She will make her sales at the market and at home to a male and female clientele. Sales are done in cash. Sali envisions making a monthly median profit of 17,500 FCFA. A part of the profit will be used to support her family's needs and for social events and the other part will be invested in her business.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of potatoes

loans.name: Renabel

texts.en:
Renabel A., age 33, is from the village of Rang-Ayan. She and her husband have one school-aged child. To make a living, Renabel runs a general store, selling a variety of different products in  her local community. Renabel has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Renabel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and to increase her ability to engage in business activities. Renabel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Renabel is now requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Renabel from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 29 years old. He is married with one child age 4, who is currently attending school.

He is a farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been practising mixed farming for 5 years and has employed 5 people from his community. His main product is milk which he sells on the local market. He also sells tea to Kenya Tea Development Authority.

His biggest challenge is limited land for expansion and lack of good dairy breeds.

Bernard has a good record with Juhudi Kilimo, after successfully completing his second loan of Kes.40,000. He has requested this loan for Kes.50,000 to purchase a dairy cow. He will be able to get a good source of income from the dairy cow which will assist him to pay school fees and get other basic necessities for his family.

In future, he would like to purchase more land to expand his dairy farming and purchase a plot of land to build an agrovet shop.

He is grateful to Juhudi for giving borrowers a chance to access credit facilities.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 43-year-old single lady who operates her shop, “Lily Cosmetics”, to earn her daily bread. Lilian, who is a single mother of two, works hard to educate her children.

Lilian joined Millenium group under Faulu Kenya so as to save her money and to more easily access loans. She previously took out a loan of 15,453 KES to boost her business and has successfully repaid it.

Lilian wants to service another loan, this time KES 50,000. She wants to buy more cosmetics and beauty products with this money.

loans.use: To add to her stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda A. is from the village of Estefania, Amulung Cagayan. She is 46 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a general store, selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $130 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Nilda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. Nilda is requesting a new loan of 27,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: El Señor Luis Antonio Trabaja como obrero en una Maquiladora de la localidad, es un hombre muy trabajador. Su esposa la señora Rosalva también trabaja, ella labora como encargada de una tienda de abarrotes.  Entre los dos solventan los gastos del hogar, solo tienen una pequeña hija pero se preocupan por darle una mejor calidad de vida y tratan de ir poco a poco hacerle mejoras a la vivienda de interés social que el Señor Luis Antonio esta pagando. Requieren de este crédito para la colocación de Vitro piso en el frente de su casa. La Familia R. les agradece su Apoyo.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio works as a laborer at a manufacturing plant in his region. He is a very hard working person. His wife Rosalva also works. She is the manager of a convenience store. Between the two of them they manage to cover all the household expenses. They have only one little girl but their wish is to give her a better quality of life and they try to improve their living space. He requires this loan to install a tile floor in the front of their house. The R. family is grateful for your support.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To install tile flooring in his home.

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en: Loyce K. is currently in the business of selling groundnut paste, charcoal, rice and beans at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more bags of charcoal to sell.  Loyce is 48 years old and is widowed.   She has 6 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to have a small farm for growing green vegetables for sale.

loans.use: Stock more bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Our God Is Able Group

texts.en:
R. W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Our God Is Able.  He is 31 years old, married, and has one child who is six years old. He was only able to attend school through twelfth grade due to financial constraints. 

For 10 years, he has been sewing garments and school uniforms in the Red Light Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 36,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more cloth. 
He describes himself as a good man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more cloth.

loans.name: Sala Sambila Plus Group

texts.en:
Mayimona N. is the manager of a community bank called “Sala Sambila Plus”. It is composed of 13 members united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.
Mayimona is a carpenter and owns a sawmill. He has been a micro-entrepreneur since 1992 and has acquired solid experience in woodwork. His business became stable thanks to hard work and accumulated profits that he reinvested. Currently, his business brings in a profit of $180 each week. Last August, Mayimona decided to join one of Hope’s groups named “Sala Sambila Plus” meaning “Work and Pray” in English. His business has been strengthened through the loans. With his next loan, Mayimona plans to buy some sawmill tools in order to meet customer requirements and generate additional profits. He is 49 years old and a father of a son aged 20 who goes to school.

loans.use: To buy some sawmill tools

loans.name: Norma Margarita

texts.es: La Sra. S. gracias a fundacion a estado arreglando su casa para comodidad de ella y su familia el papa de sus hijos trabaja fuera y le envia dinero, No obstante ella trabaja elaborando quesos siempre ha sido muy independiente, aun asi el padre de sus hijos nunca le ha dejado de mandar dinero, pero con la situacion economica tan dificil ella siempre ha tenido que trabajar en la elaboracion de queso, a ella siempre le ha gustado tener su hogar limpio y agradable es por eso que ahora quiere ampliar su cocina para eso requiere el dinero.
texts.en: Thanks to the support of the organization Mrs. S. has been remodeling her home for her family’s greater comfort. The father of the family works and sends them money. She sells cheeses and she has always been very independent. But even so, the father of her children has never stopped sending her money. Their financial situation was so difficult that she has always kept up her business making cheese. She has always enjoyed having a clean and comfortable home. She wants to expand her kitchen and to this end she requests a loan.

loans.use: To expand her kitchen.

loans.name: Badamtuya

texts.en:
Badamtuya L. is a 39 year old single mother who lives with her two sons in Uvs province, Mongolia. She and her two sons live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son currently attends a local high school. Her husband passed away 2 years ago.

Badamtuya operates a clothing retail business out of a rented stall at the local market. She started her business in 2003 with the help of her husband. Her sibling has helped her in the summertime. She has found success in her trade and has used her earnings to support her family. Today, her working capital exceeds 3,000,000 MNT. She imports a variety of clothing items once every quarter of the year from Erlian, a border city of China. She pays 45,000 MNT in monthly rent fees. Moreover, she plants vegetables in her yard. Badamtuya is a very open minded and hardworking woman and says, "I work hard to provide for my two sons." She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to import more inventory at wholesale prices from China to sell at her stall.

loans.use: To import more inventory.

loans.name: Wana Wa Ngurumo Group

texts.en:
Mariam K. is in her late thirties. She is married with one son, who is in school. She runs a business as a food vendor, and is also running a business selling second-hand clothes. She works from 6 am to 7 pm. She buys her clothes from the Kariakoo market in Dar es Salaam and sells them in Morogoro, a town about four hours' drive southwest of Dar es Salaam.

This will be Mariam's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her first loans, which she successfully repaid, to increase her food business and begin her clothing business. She wishes to use the current loan to buy more clothes, as well as to keep some in the bank, because her husband is sick. 

Mariam will share this loan with the other members of Wana wa Ngurumo Group, sixteen in total. The members will hold each other accountable in repaying the loan. In the photo, Mariam can be seen on the far left in the first row.
