loans.use: To buy more used clothing for resale

loans.name: Nixon Cruz

texts.es:
Nixon de 36 años, tiene tres hijos de 7, 5 y 1 años con su esposa trabaja en una tienda de víveres para poder mantener el hogar. Vive en una zona periurbana en el Fortín de Guayaquil caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra.  

Hace tres años comenzó con su tienda para poder mantener a sus hijos. En la actualidad trabaja con su esposa desde las 06h00am hasta las 22h00pm atendiendo la tienda. En su tienda vende arroz, aceites, enlatados etc. En los tres años que ha tenido la tienda la ha podido surtir gracias al buen trabajo que realiza con su esposa pero uno de los inconvenientes que siempre ha tenido es el polvo que le ocasiona la calle de tierra. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar víveres como arroz, enlatados, bebidas para tener más variedad en sus productos. En el futuro quiere surtir más la tienda y que sus hijos tengan los estudios que se merecen.
texts.en:
Nixon is 36 years old.  He has three children aged 7, 5 and 1.  He works together with his wife in a grocery store so that they can support their household.  He lives in a peri-urban area in Fortín de Guayaquil which is noted for its dirt roads.

Three years ago he began working in his store so that he could support his children.  He currently works with his wife from 6.00am to 10.00pm serving in the store.  In the store they sell rice, oil and  canned goods, etc.  In the three years that he has had the store, he has been able to stock it thanks to the good work which he does with his wife.  However, one of the problems which he has always had is the dust which is created by the dirt road outside.

He would like to use his loan to buy groceries such as rice, canned goods and drinks so that he can have more variety in his products.  In the future, he would like to better stock his store and he would like for his children to receive the education which they deserve.

loans.use: To buy rice, chicken and oil

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn M. is from the village of Port Area, Iligan City. She is 29 years old, single and has 1 infant child. To make a living, Jocelyn owns & operates a furniture-making business. The main source of income for the business comes from making & selling general household furniture to local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Jocelyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. She is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. This will be Jocelyn’s 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

location.town: Port Area, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en: Tsetsgee B. is a 38-year-old, single woman who lives with her 2 sons in the Songinohairhan district in the capital of Mongolia. Tsetsgee lives with her family in a rented home.  Both of her children attend university. She has been selling underwear since 2010 with her sister Odonchimeg. Her sister has significant work experience in trade. She has been growing her business for many months. Tsetsgee  is a hardworking and modest women. She wants to grow her business and make money for her children's education.   She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to increase her working capital and her income.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and her income

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Gaudencia

texts.en:
Gaudencia is a widow who lives in Siaton, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a variety store and a carenderia (mini-restaurant). She has two children who are 26 and 20 years old. Gaudencia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1991 because she wanted something better for her family. 

With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gaudencia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of about $207, raising the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing 25,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital so that she can continue to save up for future household expenses and for her family’s future. Gaudencia is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Pariken Ole

texts.en:
Pariken Ole P. is 38 years old, married, and is the father of five children. He is a farmer and works his own piece of land, which he has been doing for the last four years. He makes a good income.

He learned about KADET LTD from other members in a group already registered with KADET in his area of residence. This will be his 2nd loan, which he is planning to spend to prepare his land for maize planting. Maize has been doing well in his area due to good climatic conditions. 

Pariken hopes to use the profit from the proceeds of this loan to expand his farming activity from small scale to commercial farming. His dream is to do large scale farming and be an exporter of maize overseas.  He is a punctilious man who is determined to achieve his set goals.

loans.use: to prepare land for maize planting.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
Clara tiene 47 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agricola que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un kiosco instalado en el paradero de carros de la ruta Chepén - Chiclayo. Allí ella ofrece en venta a sus clientes diversos productos como golosinas, chocolates, y gaseosas. El negocio cuenta con una antigüedad de 10 años y actualmente cuenta con una clientela fija y fidelizada. Gracias a esta actividad Clara apoya a su esposo a mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante durante todo este tiempo.

Clara desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería y asi  ofrecer variedad de productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Clara is 47 years old, married and lives with her family in the Chepen district.  This is an agricultural area that is located in the La Libertad region, more than 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Clara has a kiosk that is set up at one of the car stops on the Chepen-Chiclayo route.  There she offers her customers a variety of products for sale, including candy, chocolates and soft drinks.  She has had this business for 10 years, and now has a regular and loyal customer base.  Thanks to this business, Clara helps her husband to support their family and this has helped them to get ahead over time.

Clara wants to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can offer a greater variety of products and satisfy the demand of her customers.  To do this, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles.

loans.use: to acquire more products for her store

loans.name: Rosa Arabel

texts.es: Rosa Arabel R. S. de 38 años de edad, reside en Colón, en el departamento de La Libertad, vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como mecánico, y así mismo junto a cuatro hijos todos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Rosa posee una venta de frutas, sodas, y golosinas y huevos, la cual está ubicada frente a su casa de habitación, gracias a dicho negocio, ella puede brindarle toda la ayuda necesaria a su esposo para darles todo lo posible a sus cuatro hijos. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para invertir en su venta, aumentando los productos que posee, de esta forma Rosa espera mejorar sus ventas y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Rosa Arabel R. S. is 38 years old and lives in Colón, in La Libertad department.  She lives together with her husband, who works as a mechanic, and her four children who are in school.  

Rosa owns a stall where she sells fruit, soda, candy and eggs.  It is located in front of her home.  Thanks to her business, Rosa is able to provide her husband with all the help he needs in providing their four children with everything they can.  She is requesting a loan so that she will have the money she needs to invest in her sales stall, increasing the products that she has to offer.  In this way, Rosa hopes to improve her sales and get ahead.

loans.use: Compra de frutas, golosinas y sodas.

loans.name: Mirzorajab

texts.ru: Муминов Мирзорачаб проживает в районе Рудаки. Ему 39 лет. Он женат. Имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Сам Мирзорачаб имеет высшее образование, химик. По профессии проработал 18 лет. На сегодняшний день он занимается изготовлением и ремонтом ювелирных изделий. В этой сфере имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для приобретения оборудования, чтобы изготовить более качественное изделие.
texts.en: Mirzorajab M. lives in the Rudaki Region. He is 39 years old. He is married, with three children. His wife is a homemaker. Mirzorajab has graduated from college. He is a chemist. He has worked in his profession for 18 years. At present his line of work is making and repairing jewelry. He has a lot of experience in this area. He is taking out a loan to purchase equipment in order to ensure higher quality of his products.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for making jewelry

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Arona A., who is in her mid-twenties, is single. She has had a tailoring business for 6 months.  She works from 8:00am to 6:00pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Arona's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She hopes for a loan to buy more materials and start making dresses for sale.  Her dream is to buy more sewing machines and open a school for tailoring.

Arona will share this loan with her loan group "Nadia", which has a total of 15 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable is paying back their loans.

In the picture Arona is second from left, second row.

loans.use: To buy more material for tailoring.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a resident of Murang'a in Central Kenya and has been farming for ten years producing poultry, maize and beans, which she sells to the local market. She is married with six adult children. She relies solely on farming for the family upkeep.
Alice has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva partner, Juhudi Kilimo, to purchase poultry chicks and poultry feed. She says her target is to increase her birds to 2,000 in number. She believes that this, in turn, will generate enough income to feed her family and educate her last-born daughter. Alice says she is optimistic about the future, despite challenging poultry diseases, because of the financial services available to her.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and feed

loans.name: Zainabu

texts.en:
Zainabu is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, she has operated a business selling lesos, a traditional rectangular cloth used for clothing. She sells from door to door to her neighbors and passers-by. In addition, she also sells handbags to bring in more income. Zainabu faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing a restaurant business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of clothes for sale

loans.name: Rodgers

texts.en:
Rodgers is married to a businesswoman who operates a tailoring business. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

For the past five years, he has operated a retail shop business, selling to his neighboring community members. He sells household items like wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, salt and detergents. He dreams of expanding his business and selling at wholesale in the future. Rodgers faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in his business. 

With the 30,000 KES he wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for his retail shop. Rodgers decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour and sugar for his retail shop.

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is engaged in fishing. Her husband is a fisherman and is the one who operates their fishing boat. Leonila sells all his catch at the market. She works hard to help sustain her family. 

She requested a loan to buy paint and gasoline for the pump boat (an outrigger canoe powered by a small engine). This will maintain Leonila's boat in a good condition.

In the future, Leonila hopes to expand their business by acquiring an additional pump boat.

loans.use: to buy paint and gasoline for the pump boat.

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Amir is a 51-year-old married man who lives in Aley with his wife and four children.  Amir sells fish, work he has done for 12 years. He loves his job and works hard to improve it.  Amir owns the only fish shop in his region, which helps increase his income since there is no competition.  He tries his best to keep his customers satisfied and loyA..

Amir requests a loan from Kiva partner A. Majmoua to buy a Renault Rapid car that is necessary for his business.  The vehicle helps him transport large quantities of fish safely from the wholesale market to his shop.  Amir hopes to expand his business and continue to improve his customer service in the future.

loans.use: To buy a Renault Rapid car to transport large quantities of fish from the wholesale market to his fish shop.

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is married and has three children. All of her children go to school. She doesn't have to care for any additional family members.

Sylvia sells second hand clothes. She has been in this business for the last nine years. She sells her clothes in the market. She has requested for a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of clothes. 

Sylvia's major business challenge is seasonality and ever increasing prices of second hand clothes. Sylvia is aspiring to see her business grow big. She wants to start importing clothes from Mombasa and also to sell on a wholesale basis only. She resides in a rented house and her family has access to electricity, but not piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees, rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bales of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Myrlyn

texts.en:
Myrlyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Myrlyn has a retail shop that sells fish like sardines and milk fish. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy fish to sell.
Myrlyn is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Myrlyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Americo

texts.en: Americo is 36 years old and lives with his partner. He has two daughters who are 3 and 13 years old. Americo works as a taxi driver seven days a week in the city of Cusco. He enjoys his job and takes great pride in the upkeep and care of his taxi. Americo is asking for a 500-dollar loan in order to improve his taxi. Specifically, he plans to purchase new tires and probably a new motor. He is committed to making all of the necessary loan payments on time.

loans.use: to buy new tires and a new motor for his taxi

loans.name: Sameh

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old, married and has one child.

Sameh has been an owner of a food market since 2008 selling soft drinks, juices, and cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by. 

He decided to apply for a $2400 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his market. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his market.

loans.name: José Rodrigo

texts.es:
José Rodrigo  tiene 54 años de edad  es casado vive con su esposa y con sus tres hijos de 10, 8 y 3 años en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar. 

La V.R.C NUEVA UNION se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia  San José del Tambo, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, los miembros de esta ventanilla se dedican a la agricultura, principalmente al cultivo de maíz y cacao, arroz, naranja, plátano, café.

José Rodrigo se dedica al cultivo de cacao y naranja. Compra y vende sus productos en el mercado de San José del Tambo cada fin de semana. 

Solicita el crédito para compra de abonos e insumos, fertilizantes, abonos agrícolas,  para sus cultivos y mejorar las huertas de cacao. El crédito le servirá de apoyo para suplir sus necesidades económicas y mejorar sus actividades agrícolas. Enfrenta desafíos como la caída de precios de los productos que comercializa, así como los intermediarios. Su sueño es seguir trabajando y poder dar la educación a los hijos.

Le gusta salir de paseo con la familia.
texts.en:
José Rodrigo, 54, is married living with his wife and three children who are 10, 8 and 3 years old in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “Nueva Union” (New Unity) communal bank is located in San José del Tambo Parish belonging to Chillanes Canton.  The members of this communal bank are farmers, especially of corn, cocoa beans, rice, oranges, bananas and coffee.

José Rodrigo farms cocoa beans and oranges.  His purchases and the sale of his products take place at the San José del Tambo market every weekend.

He is requesting the loan to buy farming supplies, manure and fertilizer for his crops and to improve his cocoa bean crops.  The loan will help him meet his economic needs and improve his farming activities.  He faces challenges like the drop in prices of the products he sells as well as dealing with middlemen.  His dream is to stay in business and be able to provide his children with an education.  He enjoys going on family outings.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en:
Batbileg is 27 years old and lives with his two daughters and wife in a ger, a Mongolian yurt, in Uvs province of Mongolia. His first daughter is a high school student. His wife is currently staying at home and taking care of their youngest daughter. 

Batbileg started to repair cell phones and sell spare parts. Now he rents a commercial space at the local market and provides services. He is planning to expand his business and his rented space at the market by selling a diverse range of cell phone parts and services. Last month, he brought spare parts and phones from Erlian city, China. His monthly sale volumes are between 1,500,000 to 2,000,000 MNT. His monthly income is from 300,000 to 500,000 MNT and is spent for family consumption. His business is the only income source. 

With the profits he earned, he purchased a piece of land and yurt in April 2011. He is a very open-minded and hardworking man who says "I want to expand my business in the near future." He is requesting a 3,500,000 MNT loan to purchase cell phones and spare parts for phones from China.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones and spare parts

loans.name: Jose Adan

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la agricultura, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos,  él está trabajando en una milpa actualmente, ya que aprendió desde pequeño el proceso por medio de su padre, trabaja de lunes a sábado.
Él necesita comprar abono, herbicidas y semilla para realizar la siembra, que a través de un préstamo espera realizar este trabajo.
Su aspiración es contar con lo básico en su familia, para que puedan tener garantizada la alimentación.
texts.en:
José is a farmer. He lives with his wife and four children. He is currently working with corn, as his father taught him this process at a young age. He works Monday through Saturday.

He needs to buy fertilizer, weed-killer and seeds for the sowing season, so he has requested a loan so that he can carry out this work.

He aspires is to provide the basic needs for his family and guarantee their food supply.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed-killer and seeds.

loans.name: Natividad De Maria Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formó gracias a una D. las miembros. Este es un grupo muy bueno, todas las mujeres son muy trabajadoras y responsables. Todas las del grupo tambien todas son mujeres que siguen adelante con sus emprendimientos con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación y su mayor anhelo es sacar adelante sus negocios a sus hijos y tambien a ellas mismas y por tal agradecen a la Fundacion por la oportunidad que les da.
La señora Marta se dedica a la venta D. frutas, comenta que su trabajo es un poco cansador, pero le gusta lo que hace. Ella por medio D. su trabajo sacrificado ha podido salir adelante con toda su familia, ya que gracias a este trabajo ella logra mantenerlos. Comenta que tiene muchos clientes que siempre acuden a ella en busca D. las frutas que venD..
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. manzanas, piñas, bananas, duraznos y otras frutas, con lo cual podrá abastecerse y cumplir con la demanda D. sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed thanks to one of the members.  It’s a very good group; all the women are very hardworking and responsible.  All of the members of the group are also women who continue forward with their enterprises with much effort and dedication and their greatest wish is to succeed with their businesses and move their children, as well as themselves, forward.  Because of this they thank the Fundación for the opportunity it gives them.

Marta is a fruit vendor.  She comments that her work is a bit tiring but she likes what she does.  Through her demanding work she’s been able to get ahead together with her entire family because thanks to this work she’s able to support them.  She comments that she has many customers who always seek her out in search of the fruit she sells.

She asks for the loan to buy apples, pineapples, bananas, peaches and other fruit to stock up and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy fruit for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Samer

texts.en:
Samer is a 27-year-old man. He owns a barber shop that is located in a good area and has a lot of permanent customers. 

Samer wants to improve the look of his barber shop by purchasing new furniture such as chairs, tables and mirrors, but he hasn't enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan from FATEN. 

When Samer gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, he will purchase the furniture he needs to improve its look and attract more customers. This way he will be able to work extra and increase his income to live in better conditions. 

Samer is photographed in his barber shop. 


About this loan product:

FATEN offers loan products that are designed to serve borrowers all over Palestine, including some religiously conservative areas. A key tenet of Islam is the prohibition of interest in the lending or accepting of money. This prohibition is based on the belief that money should be seen only as a medium of exchange and that it has no value in itself. FATEN has adapted the terms of this loan to fit the cultural context by attaching a 0% interest rate to the loan. In order to cover its costs, FATEN does charge a servicing fee. The amount you see fundraising includes both the principal loan and the loan servicing fees. As with all Kiva loans, you should expect to have your funds returned to you in accordance with the repayment schedule attached to this loan. For more information on lending in the Muslim world, please visit Kiva's Muslim World Lending helptext: http://tinyurl.com/3aekx8m.

loans.use: To purchase barber shop furniture.

loans.name: Rabi

texts.ru: Раби замужем, на воспитании имеет троих детей. Муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Для содержания детей она занимается сушкой абрикосов. По дешёвой цене она закупает сушеные абрикосы с соседнего города, обрабатывает его и продает. В зимний период продает по высоким ценам. Также оптом закупает сухофрукты у дехкан. Займ она запрашивает на покупку сухофруктов и расширения бизнеса. Раби заранее благодарить всех кредиторов за поддержку и доброту.
texts.en: Rabi is married and is raising three children.  Her husband is working in the Russian Federation.  In order to support her children, Rabi is involved in drying apricots.  She buys dried apricots from a neighboring town at a cheap price, processes and sells them.  In the winter, she sells dried apricots at high prices.  Rabi also buys dried fruits wholesale from dekhan farmers.  She is requesting this loan for the purchase of dried fruits and expanding her business.  Rabi thanks all creditors in advance for the support and kindness.

loans.use: to purchase dried fruits

loans.name: Irlanda

texts.es: Irlanda, de 35 años, es una mujer muy buena y amable. Convive con su pareja, con quien tiene tres hijos de 18, 12 y 9 años, el mayor ya es independiente, mientras que sus dos menores hijos aun dependen mucho de ella para su educación y crianza. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en donde vive a lado de su pareja y sus dos menores hijos. EL trabajo de irlanda, consiste en dos diferentes actividades, el primero es  la venta de comida y bebidas, esta actividad la realiza en su casa por las noches; el segundo, tiene un taller de mecánica de motos, y al mismo tiempo  es vulcanizador de llantas. Tiene tres años realizando este trabajo, y hasta el momento lo ha hecho en compañía de su hijo el mayo y la de su pareja, con quienes trabajan en conjunto para poder generar ingresos en su hogar. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es que genera ingresos todos los días, con su taller de mecánica y  vulcanizador generan para los gastos generales. Le esta yendo bien, ya que siempre tienen clientes que están en espera de ser atendidos, claro que le gustaría progresar mas, es por eso que tiene en mente montar una fuente de soda en su casa para así vender gaseosas y jugos y cervezas. Este será el segundo préstamo con la institución MFP, le esta yendo bien en su grupo. Además menciona que está muy agradecida por los préstamos recibidos anteriormente. Con el monto solicitado 1200 soles, comprará bebidas, ingredientes para la preparación de comida, asimismo  comprará  herramientas para implementar su taller de mecánica.
texts.en:
Irlanda, 35, is a very good, kind woman.  She lives with her spouse.  They have three children who are 18, 12 and 9 years old; the oldest is already independent while her two youngest still depend on her very much for their education and support.  She lives in her own house together with her spouse and two younger children.

Irlanda’s work consists in two different activities.  The first is selling food and beverages, an activity she carries out at home in the evening and the second which is a motorcycle repair shop and a tire shop.  She’s been in business three years and to date has been working with her spouse and her oldest son; they all work together to generate household income.

What she likes about her work is that she generates income every day; her repair shop and tire shop generate income for general expenses.  She’s doing well because she always has customers and they are well tended to.  Of course, she’d like to progress even more and this is why she’s thinking about setting up a soda fountain at home to sell soft-drinks, juices and beer.

This will be her second MFP loan and she is doing well in her group.  She also mentions that she is very grateful for the previous loan.  She will use the requested 1200 soles to buy beverages and ingredients to prepare her food as well as to buy tools for her repair shop.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food and also tools for her workshop.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: La señora Sonia es comerciante de venta de pescados y mariscos semanalmente en la ciudad de El Alto, y viaja al departamento de Santa Cruz una vez por semana para vender su producto. El crédito lo requiere para adquirir una mayor variedad de mariscos y pescados para ofrecer a su clientela. Vive en casa de sus padres la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Río Seco en la ciudad de El Alto; es casada, tiene una hija. Es la primera vez que le cliente obtiene un crédito esperando mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Sonia is a merchant who sells fish and shellfish every week in the city of El Alto. She travels to the Department of Santa Cruz once a week in order to sell her product. The loan she is requesting will be used to acquire a wider variety of shellfish and fish to offer to her customers. Sonia lives at her parents’ home in the District of Río Seco in the city of El Alto. She is married and has a daughter.

This is the first time she has obtained a loan and she hopes to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish and shellfish in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items like powdered milk, Tang juice, sugar, rice and many others.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. She has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

Amy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Dulce Maria

texts.es:
La  sra. Dulce es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo diario, tiene una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, muchas personas la prefieren ya que sus precios son bajos y la calidad de sus productos es buena, ademas el trato con que atiende a sus clientes es especial, Dulce es una mujer muy querida en su comunidad, todos los dias se levanta a las 6 de la mañana para atender  a sus clientes. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia y asi surtir su negocio, las ventas en esta epoca son muy buenas y desea estar preparada para cubrir con todas las exigencias de sus clientes.
\
texts.en: Sra. Dulce is an enterprising and hardworking woman. She sells staple, everyday products. She has a small grocery store where she lives. Many people prefer to buy from her as her prices are cheap and the quality of the products is good. In addition, she treats her customers as being special. Dulce is very well-loved in the community. She gets up every day at 6 in the morning to serve her customers. She will use the loan to buy goods and so stock her store. Sales at this time of the year are very good and she wants to be prepared to meet all her customers demands.

loans.use: to buy groceries, dry grains, soft drinks, dairy products and cured meats and sausages.

loans.name: Vagharshak

texts.en:
Vagharshak lives in Akhalkalaki, in the Southern part of Georgia with his family: his wife Marina and two sons (16 and 12 years old). The family earns their living through agriculture. They grow potatoes on a family-owned plot of the land. They sell the potatoes locally to retailers. Vagharshak also has three bee-hives with bee-colonies. They sell gathered honey locally as well. The total average monthly income for the family is 650 Laris.

Vagharshak has requested credit to purchase potatoes for sowing. This year he will sow more potatoes and increase the income of the family. They will use increased income for purchasing additional household goods to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing.

loans.name: Segnon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe SEGNON est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier.  Baï Léocadie Joselle, la représentante du groupe (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 48 ans est mariée à un certain Gaston. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Baï Léocadie Joselle vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Les différentes charges de ménage sont supportées par Baï Léocadie Joselle et son mari. Baï Léocadie Joselle a très peu fréquenté l’école. Depuis quinze ans, Baï Léocadie Joselle vend de la nourriture à son domicile et par la technique de distribution ce qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Baï Léocadie Joselle s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité, Baï Léocadie Joselle sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe SEGNON un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des vivres et des condiments.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 58 years old,a resident of Militar,Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur,married, with 5 children, 4 are married and 1 still single and lived with her.

She already fully paid her previous loan and take another loan for additional capital of her fishing business which she and her husband manage.

She plans to purchase another unit of fishing boat in the future.

loans.use: for additional capital for her fishing business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a mother of 2 at the age of 30. She sells alcoholic drinks and locally-brewed gin. She is located in a predominantly lower middle class community, as such, patronage for her products is very high. A lot of social activities take place over the weekends which invariably create a market for her business. She has undergone the TEACH sessions organised by KRABAN SUPPORT FOUN-DATION. She therefore seeks KIVA\'S assistance to stock up products. With this she will be able to enjoy regular deliveries from her suppliers.

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Gladys Wanja intends to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Rein

texts.en:
Mrs. Rein Bona, 27 years old and the mother of 1 child, lives with her husband (pictured here because Bona was unavailable) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works in a local garment factory and normally makes on average about $3/day, while her husband is an electrician and typically generates around $6/day in revenue. In order to satisfy his clients' needs, Bona's husband is requesting $1000 loan fun to purchase more electrical supplies for his inventory, so that he has sufficient materials to fix televisions, radios, microphones, speakers, video players and so on.

In the future, this couple hopes to own an electrical shop, in which they can make additional money to offer a better education to their children.

loans.use: To purchase some electrical tools for a business.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Mrs. Josephine O. specializes in the sale of provisions and foodstuffs. She is 56 years old, mother of eight children. She has been running a little grocery store for 5 years. She is requesting a loan of $800 to buy a wider range of goods for her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale in her little grocery store

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Mrs. Leng S., aged 44, sells fish at an open air market, which earns her about $3 per day. Her husband, aged 47, is a policeman earning $2 per day. They have seven children. One is employed at a hotel earning $100 per month while two are students. She would like to borrow $500 to purchase fish to raise in her pond to generate additional profit.

loans.use: To purchase fish to raise in her pond to generate additional profit.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana Maria is hard-working and successful woman who 22 years ago, while she was raising two school-aged children, decided to open a grocery store. She had previously helped her mother at a market stand. She has been quite successful, yet she sees ways to improve the business. Ana Maria has benefited from CEPRODEL loans for the last two and a half years, using the credit to improve the shop and stock it adequately.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Hace 22 años Ana Maria Jefa de Familia, comienza su negocio con la vision de ir creciendo poco a poco y con el objetivo de dar sustento a su familia conformada por dos hijos estudiantes colegiales. Ha sido una mujer luchadora y a la vez triunfadora porque hasta el momento ha logrado su proposito.

Sin embargo a la fecha el local aun no presta las condiciones al 100%, sin embargo poco a poco Ana Maria lo ha ido acondicionando. Anterior a su negocio propio trabajaba junto a su mama en el mercado.

CEPRODEL ha jugado un papel muy importante desde hace aproximadamente 2½ años, ya que los creditos que le han sido otorgados le han ayudado a la mejora de su local y a la retroalimentacion de su inventario.

loans.use: To stock a grocery store.

loans.name: Pap Ndege Shg Group

texts.en:
Dorine used to work in Kenya’s capital, Nairobi, a busy industrial center. She was employed by an embroidery firm and learned how to use a variety of embroidery machines. Always ambitious, Dorine put aside a small portion of her salary every month to save for her own embroidery machine. She planned to move to a place near her rural home where she knew that embroidery work was not offered when she was able to purchase her own machine.

Once she became the proud owner of an embroidery machine in 2003, Dorine moved her business to Riat Market. In 2006, she used some of her savings from her embroidery business to start a new shoes business alongside her embroidery business. By 2007, she had accumulated enough money to start a new clothing business alongside her embroidery and new shoes businesses.

Although she is only 25, Dorine would like to start training other young women to embroider. In order to do this, she needs to buy another machine. A nice machine costs $230 dollars. She has over $70 in the bank. When she gets her loan, she plans to combine her savings and her loan and buy a new embroidery machine. She’ll take students in the morning and evening. With the profits from her business and the monthly fee her students will pay her, she’ll be able to pay back her loan.

Her additional profits will be used to send her two young children to private schools. As a single mother, Dorine’s business success is the only way her children will be able to attend school. This new sewing machine will ensure that she is able to continue paying their school fees.

loans.use: To buy a new embroidery machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria A. B. from San Jose de Sisa, San Martín, is 32 years old and has a business raising and selling pigs.  She started the business with $300 and a pen to raise the pigs in four years ago after her brother offered to teach her how to run the business.  She has had quite a bit of success, she sells as many pigs as she can raise for a high price.  She currently has 20 pigs but would love to have more.

Maria is married and has three young children.  Her husband is supportive and helps her with the business.  The business currently covers the expenses of all the families basic needs but Maria also dreams of sending her children to University.  Maria never had the opportunity to study and she wishes she would have.

Maria is requesting a loan of S/. 1,000 to buy medicines and food for the pigs. She is a member of the Maria Parado de Bellido community bank and will repay the loan over 6 months. The food and medicine will give her the ability of raise more pigs and earn more money for her family.

loans.use: To buy medicines and food for animals

location.town: San José de Sisa - San Martin

loans.name: Edward

texts.es:
Edward, despite the circumstances he has had to live, with the abandonment of his wife, who left without any explanation leaving him behind with his children and without caring about the need they would have for her, has been able to move forward and today, with his daily hard work in his electronic repair shop he pays for the bills of his home. There, he counts with the help of his mother who aids in raising his children. She has been a great support in pushing him to expand his shop. Edward is looking for a loan to acquire tools that can help optimize every one of his clients’ requests.

Translated from Spanish by Wendy, Kiva Volunteer

Edward a pesar de las circunstancias que le ha tocado vivir, con el abandono de su esposa, quien se marchó sin ninguna explicación dejándolo solo con sus hijos sin importarle la falta que les haría.Pese a estas dificultades y la enorme tristeza que aún lo consume ha podido salir adelante y hoy con su desempeño diario en su taller eléctrico solventa los gastos en casa contando con la importante ayuda de su querida madre que le ayuda a criar a sus niños y quien ha sido un gran motor para la consolidación de su taller. Solicita un préstamo para mejorar sus instalaciones de servicio y para adquirir herramientas que le ayuden a optimizar cada una de las peticiones de sus clientes.

loans.use: Mejoramiento de las instalaciones del taller eléctrico y compra de herramientas.  Improving his electronic repair shop facilities and purchasing tools.

loans.name: Agnes's Faith Group

texts.en:
Agnes M. is a 29-year-old single mother of one living in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania. She makes a living by running a food vending store, earning about $80 a month in profit.

Agnes hopes to expand her business so she can provide a better life for her nine-year-old child. That's why she has applied for a group loan of $400 along a woman she trusts, Hadija A.. Hadija earns a living by selling cloth and soap. Both women are extremely dedicated, so Agnes is certain they will be able to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy more food and supplies for a food vending store

loans.name: Mwantumu

texts.en:
Mwantumu is married with 6 children, ages 15 to 31 years old. Mwantumu is a charcoal and firewood seller. She started her business in 2006. Every day, she works from 7am to 8pm at her business, and can earn a monthly profit of about $190 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal  and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a teacher at SOS children's village in Makeni, a town in Sierra Leone. 47 years old and with four school-going chidren, Mariam needs additional income to meet her childrens' educational requirements. Mariam diversified her sources of income by establishing a small business selling agricultural products and has been running the business for a year.

She would like to expand her business and hire a part-time attendant to manage the business. She is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1500,000 and will repay the loan from her monthly salary.

loans.use: Increase her stock of rice, palm oil, chilli pepper and peanuts

loans.name: Daniel

texts.fr:
Daniel A. is 29 years old, single and has no children. He is a motorcycle taxi driver in Kpalime, a town located around 120 kilometers from Lome, the capital of Togo. He would like to purchase a new motorcycle with this loan, which will help him to improve his working conditions and services, as well as allow him to give his old motorcycle to his younger brother who has been out of work for a year. The profits from his business will help him to support his younger brothers who are still in school.

Translated from French to English by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Daniel A. est âgé de 29 ans, célibataire sans enfants. Il est conducteur de taxi moto à Kpalimé, une ville située à environ 120 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Il désire, par ce crédit, acheter une nouvelle moto qui lui permettra d’améliorer les conditions de son activité et de passer l’ancienne moto à son petit frère en chômage depuis un an. Les gains de son activité lui permettront de supporter ses petits frères qui sont encore sur les bancs de l’école.

loans.use: To purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir was born in 1974. He is  an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Khodjali town, and he settled in Baku city.  He has run this business of building houses for 4 years.  Now he needs a loan of $625 to buy necessary materials for building houses.

loans.use: to buy necessary materials for building the houses

loans.name: Leah's Alfa Na Omega Group

texts.en:
Leah is 40 years old. She is married with one 16-year-old child. She has been selling clothes since 2006. Every day, she works from 8am to 12pm at her business and earns a monthly profit of about $250 from her sales.

Leah will use her loan to buy more clothing inventory for her business. She will share this loan with her group members, who have businesses selling bites, shoes, cosmetics and operating a salon.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kay

texts.en:
Mrs. Kay T., 63, is a widow with three children: two sons and one daughter. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. One of her children is married and lives outside the family home. One son is a construction worker and one daughter is a silk weaver.

Mrs. Kay has been a silk weaver since she was 10 years old, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Now she is requesting a loan of $250 to purchase silk materials for her weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for weaving.

loans.name: Alice's Group

texts.en:
Alice N. is a very hardworking lady with a business selling women's, men's, and children's clothing in her locality. She is so grateful for the loans from Pearl Microfinance because she has been able to increase and build her capital as a result. Now school fees are no longer a burden because of the profits she makes selling a variety of high quality skirts, blouses, shirts, trousers and dresses.

She is seeking a loan to be able to buy more clothes to sell. She believes this will fetch her more income in preparation for restocking for the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary O. started her business in 2004, selling rechargeable phone cards and owning a phone booth where she makes phone calls for customers. Rosemary also does pedicures and manicures for her customers.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rechargeable phone cards for resale. Rosemary is 25-years-old, married and has two children. She thanks all people that will make her loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards for resale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary A. is 43 years old and is married with five children. She sells eggs wholesale and retail to her customers. She started the business in 2007. Rosemary's husband is an automobile mechanic.

Rosemary hopes to meet the demands of her customers, and needs a loan in the amount of 40,000 NGN to purchase more crates of eggs to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Fama's Group

texts.fr: Mariées et mére de famille ,ces femmes agées de 27 à 42 ans ,regroupées au sein sein d' une association s'activent dans la vente et la transformation des produits de la mer.Elles vivent à coté de la mer  .Quand les hommes partent en mer ,elles s'occupent de la maison .Avec le pret sollicité elles veulent renforcer leur activité en augmentant leur capacité de production.
texts.en:
Each one married and the mother of a family, the women in this group are between 27 and 42 years old. They live on the seaside, and their businesses consist in transforming and selling seafood. When the men go out to sea, they take care of the house. With the loan they are seeking, they want to bolster their businesses by increasing their capacity of production.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase their capacity of production

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz R. trabaja actualmente en un salón de belleza junto con una amiga. Hasta hace un mes ella manejaba sola su negocio en un local alquilado. No obstante, la dueña de este local decidió usar el espacio para otros fines, por lo que ella tuvo que asociarse con una compañera.

Al verse en problemas Luz no tuvo otra opción además de continuar trabajando en lo mismo, ya que con su larga experiencia de treinta y cinco años se ha convertido en una experta y piensa que es lo mejor que puede hacer. 

Por ahora lo que ella más desea es crecer En su nuevo negocio junto con su amiga.
texts.en:
Luz R. now works in a beauty salon with a friend. Until a month ago, she operated her own business in a rented shop. However, the owner of the shop decided to use it for something else and Luz had to partner with a friend. When she saw the trouble she was in, Luz had no other choice than to go on working because her long thirty-five year experience has made her an expert and she thinks that it is the best that she can do. For now, what she most wants is to grow her new business along with her friend.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for beauty salon business.

loans.name: Yasmeen M.shafiq Group
loans.use: To buy dry fruits to sell.

loans.name: Margarita Timotea,

texts.es:
Margarita ya lleva cuatro años recibiendo los préstamos de EDAPROSPO. En este tiempo los ha invertido en la mejora de su negocio vendiendo comida desde un pequeño puesto ambulante.
Empezó a dedicarse a este trabajo hace catorce años. Las circunstancias para las cuales se animó a comenzar fueron bastante drásticas. Ladrones entraron a su casa y le robaron todo, dejando su familia, ya pobre, en una situación aún peor. Entonces, para ayudar en la recuperación del nivel de vida después del robo empezó con su propio negocio.

Desde entonces ha ido bien, creciendo poco a poco, hasta ahora que gana bastante para contribuir de igual manera a su esposo a los gastos del hogar y de la crianza de la última hija menor de edad que todavía vive con ellos.

Habiendo llegado hasta este nivel con su negocio, a sus cincuenta años sueña poder, en un futuro, poder abrir un restaurante para tener un comercio más estable para la venta de comida.
texts.en:
Margarita has been receiving loans from EDAPROSPO for four years. During this time she has invested the majority of the money in her business selling food from a small mobile stand. She began this work 14 years ago. The circumstances surrounding this decision to start her business were rather dire. Robbers entered her home and robbed everything, leaving her family, which was already poor, in an even worse situation. So, to help restore their standard of living after the robbery she began her own business Since then her business has gone well, growing little by little, until now when she is earning enough to contribute in an equal manner as her husband, to the household expenses and to raising their youngest daughter who is still young and lives with them. Having arrived at this level with her business, at 50 years old she dreams of being able, in the future, to open a restaurant in order to have a more stable business to sell her food.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy an awning for her small mobile food stand

loans.name: Shova

texts.en:
Shova B. makes a living running a garment shop that she opened five years ago. In her shop, she sells many different types of clothes for both men and women. She opened the shop to raise the living standard of her family, and is applying for this loan to buy new and different types of clothes to improve her shop.

Mrs. B. is married and lives with her husband and their two sons. Her husband, Mr. Ratna Chandra, works in an office. Her older son in in the 12th grade and her younger son is in the 8th grade.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothing to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en:
Rodrigo M. is a seashell buyer. He markets the shells to his trusted buyers who use them make beautiful displays and decors. He is married and has seven children. He wants to expand his business to earn more for his family. Aside from buying and selling shells, he farms seaweeds. He also helps distribute his products to support the education of his children.

Now, he wants to avail a loan from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy more seashells and improve the size of his seaweed farm. The loan will truly help his family grow their business and have better income in the future.

CEVI is reaching out more people like Rodrigo to start and have their own business. CEVI is organized to respond the needs of small entrepreneurs to provide their families a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more seashells and improve the size of his seaweed farm.

loans.name: Rosaura Adelaida

texts.es:
Rosaura es socia del Banco Comunal Sarita.
Rosaura es casada, tiene 34 años y 2 hijos, Rosaura es Obstetriz de profesión y tiene una botica llamada Ángel Luz en un local alquilado, cuenta con la ayuda de dos empleadas. Además Rosaura tiene 2 consultorios obstétricos en locales alquilados.
Rosaura necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicamentos antiimflamatorios.
Rosaura sueña con tener una clínica que cuente con todos los equipos necesarios.
texts.en:
Rosaura is a member of the Sarita Community Bank. 34-year old Rosaura is married and has two children. She is an obstetrician by profession and runs a pharmacy called Ángel Luz in rented premises with the help of two employees. She also rents two consulting offices. Rosaura needs a loan of 1400 soles to buy anti-inflammatory medicines. Her dream is to own a fully-equipped clinic.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase anti-inflammatory medicines

loans.name: Gayrat

texts.ru: Абдуазимов Гайрат Пирмаматович 1973 год рождения ,женат имеет 4 детей .Жена Абдуазимова Турсуной . Место жительства Шахристанский район к/ул. Бураген . Клиент занимается животноводством уже около 10лет .Дома имеет 7 голов крупного рогатого скота .Клиент берёт заем 1000 сом. на 5 мес. Другой семейный доход  клиент занимается сельском хозяйством и переработкой молока. Кроме этого клиент работает на х/д «Бегбутабобо».На полученный кредит планирует купить бычка на откорм.
texts.en:
Gayrat A. was born in 1973. He is married and has four children. His wife is Tursuna Abduazimova, and they live on Buragen street in Shahristan district. Gayrat has raised cattle for nearly ten years. At home he has seven head of large-horned cattle, and would like to take out a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni. Other family income comes from agriculture and dairy products. In addition, Gayrat works at Begbutabobo. With the loan he will receive, Gayrat plans to purchase a steer to fatten.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
Luis has a baked goods delivery business. He began his business seven years ago and is proud of the success his venture has become. He is also happy and proud to be able to send his thirteen year old to a good school. He also has two sons who are serving in the Marines. 

He bought the business from another man and has increased from two delivery contracts to six major contracts with various bakeries throughout the city. Luis expanded in 2005 with the addition of a brand new van and the hire of an employee. This is his second loan from ACCION USA. Several years ago, Luis requested a loan to insulate the inside of his first van, which proved advantageous for his business by keeping his goods cold and preventing any damage. He has requested a loan to insulate his second van, which will be necessary to keep his goods fresh during the hot New York City summer.

Luis begins his morning with his first delivery route between one and two in the morning. He does three rounds of deliveries throughout the day. In the morning, he’s bringing fresh baked goods to cafes, delis, and coffee shops. Later in the day, he delivers pies and cakes to restaurants. He works with some of the most well-known bakeries in New York City, providing sweets and breads to hundreds of people daily.

video.title: Kiva Entrepreneur Luis from  United States

loans.use: Insulation for his delivary van

loans.name: Koténa

texts.fr: Ce monsieur a ouvert sa propre boutique dans laquelle il fait de la photocopie et des traitements de texte, il y a également ouvert une cabine téléphonique, après étude de besoins il a veut ouvrir une autre boutique dans un autre quartier, pour réaliser cela il s’adresse à WAGES et demande un autre crédit pour acheter une autre machine à copier et s’installer.
texts.en:
This gentleman has opened his own shop where he does photocopying and word processing. He has also opened a phone booth. After surveying the needs of the community, he wants to open a second shop in a different neighborhood and is asking WAGES for a loan to buy another photocopier so he can set up that shop.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of a photocopier

loans.name: Anton Y

texts.en: Antony U. is a married Tanzanian micro-entrepreneur and businessman. He runs a book shop at Yombo Buza Ward in Dar es Salaam. He sells varieties of school and story books at his shop for primary, secondary and college students. He purchases the business goods from wholesale shops at the Kariakoo City shopping center. He has been running the business for three years and he uses his business income to meet his family's daily demands and for capitalization. He is requesting a loan of Ths 800,000 to capitalize the business.

loans.use: To capitalize the business

loans.name: Zamirahon

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
      Замирахон - 37 лет, замужем и мать 3-х детей. Занимается продажей детской одежды на рынке Бунафша, находящийся в районе Панчшанбе города Худжанда. Её муж занимается торговлей фруктами и овощами на рынке Панчшанбе. Дочка Замирахон собирается поступать в Университет, поэтому Замирахон должна накопить на оплату за обучение дочери до сентября. Замирахон собирается закупить партию школьной одежды и для этого просит займ.
texts.en:
Zamirahon is 37 years old, married and is a mother of 3 children. She sells children's clothing at the Bunafsha market, located in the Panchshanbe district in the city of Khujand. Her husband sells fruits and vegetables at the Panchshanbe market. Zamirahon's daughter is getting ready to go to the University, and this is why Zamirahon has to save money prior to September to pay for her daughter's education. Zamirahon plans to purchase a stock of school uniforms and is requesting a loan for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of school uniforms

loans.name: Mr. Moa Soeun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eighteen people living in Preaek Ta Kaev village in Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mr. Moa S. is the 40-year-old village bank president. He is a fisherman. His wife, Mrs. M. San, is a fish seller in the local market, selling her husband's catch. Now Mr. Moa S. decided to ask for a loan to buy more fishnets to add to his fishing gear. He has six children, one of whom is a security guard in a garment factory while four are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Five members in this group loan have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy more fishnets to add to his fishing gear

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en:
Mrs. Mildred B., a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of one, is a resident of Prk. Balunggay, Palaka Norte, Pulupandan, Negros Occidental. She says that putting up a business was not easy – especially when they had virtually no money to start it – but she had an intense desire to have her own business and help her husband support their young family. Mildred joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 so that she could have access to start-up capital, even if it was just a small amount.

With the help and support of NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mildred started a sari-sari (general store) where she sells a variety of household commodities. She has slowly expanded her product offerings with subsequent loans, by re-investing some of her profits back into her business. Now, in the addition to the usual stuff sold in sari-sari stores, Mildred also sells frozen food, Ready-to-Wear dresses and offers an electronic loading service for pre-paid mobile phones to her neighbors. This earns her an average income of PHP 18,000 per month.

Mildred plans to use her tenth loan cycle of 20,000 PHP to expand the product offerings in her sari-sari even further, so that with the profits, she can finally make some improvements to her home.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of – not just of a few – but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day, to realities surpassing their dreams. They have learned to live a life that can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon!

loans.use: To purchase additional goods and invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida F. is a rice grower of a farm that is  1 and 1/2 hectare in size. She has working so hard to be able to improve their harvest and earn an income to buy food, clothes and other basic needs. In addition to rice, she also raises chickens and cow. The loan which she keeps on availing from Community Economic Ventures Inc. has helped sustained her business.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 15,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to fund her farm by buying the farming necessities. receiving this loan will help him to not pursue her loan form other loansharks who puts higher interest rate in their loans.

loans.use: Farm Financing

loans.name: Hiroito

texts.es:
Hiroito tiene 28 años, vive con su esposa con quien tiene 4 hijos, siendo 2 de ellos estudiantes y los 2 últimos bebés. Desde hace 10 años tiene un terreno donde habita con su familia, ahí mismo siembra plátano, frutos cítricos, yuca y arroz, pero también cuenta con árboles madereros (cedro, caoba, tornillo, entre otras variedades), los mismos que vende a los aserraderos. Lo que le gusta a Hiroito de su trabajo es que su negocio es propio, trabaja por horas y sin presión, además le es muy rentable porque la mayor parte de la madera que vende es producto de su chacra y las ganancias le permiten sostener los gastos de su familia.
Este es su segundo préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de su banco comunal es que entre todos los integrantes son unidos, no tienen problemas y sobre todo, son cumplidos en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará una herramienta para poder cortar sus árboles, ya que actualmente tiene que alquilarla y es gasta demasiado en eso.
texts.en:
Hiroito, aged 28, lives with his wife with whom he has four children. Two of them go to school and the two youngest are babies. He has owned a plot of land for ten years, where he lives with his family and grows bananas, citrus fruits, cassava and rice, but also trees for timber production (cedar, mahogany, screw beans and other varieties) which he sells to sawmills. Hiroito likes his work because it is his own business, he works for hours without stress, and it is very profitable. Indeed, most of the wood he sells is produced on his farm and the profit enables him to provide for his family.

This is his second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. In his communal bank he likes that all the members are united, that there are no problems between them and above all that they are punctual with their payments. He will use the requested loan to buy a tool to cut his trees, as he currently has to rent it and this is too expensive.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a tool to cut wood

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is 36 years old and married with two children who are pursuing their education at primary school. She started trading three years ago. She enjoys trading and has lots of marketing experience. She trades in lingerie and assorted perfumes.  Emma wants to use the loan to buy more stock of lingerie and perfume. She hopes to use part of her profits to finance her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase lingerie and perfume in bulk.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is single. He has been working as a home electrician since 2005 to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Currently, Mohamad wants to borrow $1,000, with which he will buy tools and a compressor; this will allow him to satisfy the demand for his services.

loans.use: purchasing tools and a compressor

loans.name: Hilcia

texts.es:
Hilcia es una socia trabajadora y dinámica, vive en la comunidad nativa Vista Alegre en la ciudad de Iparia, región de Ucayali, tiene 25 años, es madre de dos hijos menores. Hilcia se dedica a la confección y venta de trajes típicos, realiza sus ventas en la ciudad de Pucallpa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, es personal de servicio en la municipalidad de Iparia. Hilcia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Yabi II” desde hace un año. El primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que utilizó en la compra de telas.
Ahora ella necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, que será utilizado para comprar telas de tucuyo que luego pintara y bordará, una vez acabado venderá su producto en la ciudad. La meta de Hilcia es  tener un local propio donde poder vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Hilcia, 25, is a dynamic, hard-working member of the "Yabi II" communal bank; she has been a member for a year. She lives in Vista Alegre native village in the city of Iparia, Ucayali region. She has two minor children. She makes and sells outfits typical of the region. She sells her wares in the city of Pucallpa and her husband, who is a service employee for the city of Iparia, supports her efforts. Her first, 300 sol, loan was used to buy fabric. Now, she needs a 1000 sol loan which will be used to buy tocuyo (a type of cotton damask) fabric which she will paint and embroider. Once finished she will sell her wares in the city. Hilcia's goal is to have her own store in which to sell her creations.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buying agricultural inputs and increasing her acreage

loans.name: Leonardo Melecio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote, el señor Leonardo C. se dedica a trabajar muy arduamente todos los días vendiendo leña, sandías y pipianes todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Es importante destacar que él tiene una pequeña finca donde siembra algunas hortalizas y saca la leña pero para ir a esa finca y trasladar la leña y hortalizas se le es muy difícil porque está alejada y necesita un medio de transporte.

Esta es la razón por la que el señor Leonardo solicita un crédito ya que lo invertirá en la compra de un carretón y un caballo para utilizarlo en este trabajo y de esta manera trasladar los productos y darle el respectivo cuido y mantenimiento al caballo por medio de una buena alimentación y protección.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote, Leonardo Castellon works hard every day selling firewood, watermelons and nuts, starting early in the morning. It's important to mention that he has a small farm where he grows some vegetables and gets the firewood, however, to get to the farm and transport the wood and vegetables is difficult because it is far away and he needs a mode of transportation. This is why Leonardo requests a loan, which he will invest in the purchase of a horse and a cart to use on his job and this way transport the products and look after the horse by providing good nutrition and care.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a horse and a cart

loans.name: Seyidhuseyn

texts.en:
Seyidhuseyn J., age 52, is a sheep breeder and the responsible father of four children. He has always contributed to his family’s financial security by caring for his animals on a daily basis. He clearly remembers the time when he decided to become and independent businessman with a small number of animals and a small patch of land.

Seyidhuseyn has more than fifteen years of experience. Sheep-breeding is the main source of income for his family and generates the income that enables him to support his family and improve their living conditions. 

Seyidhuseyn has applied for a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase 16 sheep.

loans.use: To purchase 16 sheep

loans.name: Judie

texts.en:
Judie L. is from the village of Naawan, Misamis Oriental. She is 50 years old. Judie is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Judie owns and operates a business of making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Judie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $75 a month from these activities.

In 2009, Judie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Judie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making the products she sells

loans.name: Liberia Silvia

texts.es: La señora Liberia B. se ha dedicado desde hace 30 largos años a la actividad de pulpería atendiéndola ella misma y con el deseo de crecer en el negocio cada día más. Está solicitando un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de los productos para la pulpería. Ella comprará los productos comestibles como pan, galletas, golosinas y también productos como papel higiénico y otros. Espera que dicho crédito sea otorgado para continuar en su actividad de pulpería.
texts.en:
Señora Liberia B. has worked in her grocery shop for 30 long years, staffing it herself with the goal of increasing her business every day. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of stock for the shop. She will buy edibles such as bread, cookies, and sweets, and also products such as toilet paper. She hopes that this loan will be granted so she can maintain her grocery shop.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Sanford, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of grocery stock

loans.name: Erick Antonio

texts.es:
Erick Antonio G. H., tiene la edad de 29 años, está en unión libre, y tiene un hijo de 2 años.El crédito lo quiere para la compra de algunas novillas y darle una adecuada alimentación. Desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al ganado para obtener el mayor ingreso posible cuando se vendan. También desea aumentar el número de animales y poder mantenerlos en mejores condiciones, cuenta con un área de pasto idónea para el mantenimiento y desarrollo del ganado. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy contento con las facilidades que se le brindaron. Don Erick tiene varios años dedicado al ganado. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor.

About FUDECOSUR:
The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org
texts.en:
Erick Antonio Guzman Hernandez is 29 years old, in a civil union, and has a 2-year-old son. He would like this loan for the purchase of a few young cows and food to properly nourish them. He wants to give his livestock adequate care in order to obtain the greatest profit possible when he sells them. Also, he wants to increase his number of animals and maintain them in better conditions. He has a suitable pasture for the maintenance and development of his livestock. This is the first time he has requested a loan through FUDECOSUR and is very content, because it has made things easier for him. Erick has several years of experience working with livestock. In the future, he hopes to provide his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and also to continue growing as a person and producer. About FUDECOSUR: The Foundation for the Development of Southern Communities is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing credit and capacitating programs to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Southern Costa Rica. You can obtain more information on FUDECOSUR from the website: FUDECOSUR.org

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 45-year-old married man with two school-age children. He has owned a juice shop in his town for the past 30 years. He has a good reputation in the whole region due to the delicious fresh juices he makes. The availability of fresh juice all year round is one of Lebanon’s many great features. Depending on the season, it is possible to find juices such as mango, pomegranate, lemon, and blood orange. He’s thankful for his business because over the years, he has been able to meet his children's needs. 

Today, Abbas is requesting to borrow $1,200 to purchase more inventory and improve his business productivity.

loans.use: purchase more inventory for juice shop

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
La historia de Juan Carlos M. Pinillo, un hombre de 41 años de edad del barrio Modelo de Barranquilla, es de un éxito impresionante, ya que ha logrado muchas metas en los dos años cortos que está vinculado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Cuando ingresó en a finales del año 2007 pasó de ser comerciante independiente a iniciar un negocio de llamadas. A pesar de haber empezado con un celular prestado y de no haber tenido tanto éxito vendiendo minutos cerca de una universidad, siguió intentándolo en otras partes y se estableció en su casa. Usó sus dos créditos anteriores para comprar los computadores que hoy en día forman parte principal de su café Internet. Al lado del servicio de Internet con sus cuatro computadores, sigue vendiendo minutos con sus cuatro líneas telefónicas y también se dedica a la venta de refrescos, dulcería y pasabolas. El crédito que actualmente solicita es de $2.300.000 que invertirá en la adquisición de una fotocopiadora y la compra de otro computador, que le permitirán prestar un mejor servicio.
En los dos años que tiene su negocio, siente que ha crecido mucho en muy corto tiempo, que las posibilidades de capacitaciones le han ayudado mucho y que se ha organizado en su negocio y  aporta más dinero a su familia. A pesar de su éxito, considera algunas veces que no posee todos los recursos disponibles para tener más equipos y ampliar el negocio como lo desea, ya que sus clientes tienen mayores exigencias. Además de enfrentar este desafío, su meta es de ampliar y llegar a vender todo relacionado con papelería; y sueña con comprar una casa propia, ya que actualmente vive con su familia en casa de un tío.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos M. Pinillo’s success story is impressive. The 41-year-old man lives in Barranquilla’s Modelo neighborhood. He has reached several goals in the two short years he has been associated with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. When he joined in 2007 he went from being an independent merchant to establishing his phone call service. Despite starting out with a borrowed cell phone and not being very successful at selling service minutes near the university, he kept trying in other parts of town and he set himself up for business in his home.
