He used his two prior loans to buy computers that today make up the core of his Internet café business. In addition to his four computer Internet service, he has four phone lines available and also sells soft-drinks, candy and snacks. He is currently asking for a $2.300.000 loan to buy a photocopying machine and another computer which will allow him to provide better service. He feels that he has grown a lot in the two years that he’s had his business; that the training opportunities have helped him quite a bit and he has become better organized in his business thus producing higher income for his family. Despite his success, however, he sometimes feels that he doesn’t have the necessary resources to have more equipment and enlarge his business as he’d like to in order to meet increased customer demand. In addition to facing this challenge, his goal is to enlarge his business to have everything related to stationery. He also dreams with owning his own house because he and his family currently live in an uncle’s house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a photocopying machine and a computer.

loans.name: Nelma

texts.en:
Nelma Y. is from the village of Poblacion, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 58 years old, married and has four school-aged children.To make a living, Nelma owns & operates a business venture in services sector specifically in dressmaking. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making and sewing dresses. Nelma has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

 In 2004, Nelma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Nelma is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the 10th loan taken out by Nelma from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional capital for the business

loans.name: Benita

texts.es:
Nuestra socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN INMACULADA CONCEPCIÓN”; Nuestra socia vive en el distrito de Anta provincia de Anta departamento de Cusco.

Nuestra socia es la  Sra. BENITA,  ella tiene 42 años de edad, es separada y tiene 2 menores hijos, Nuestra socia alterna su trabajo con el comercio minorista, ella se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de  animales menores, Nuestra socia solicita el préstamo para comprar chanchos, y cuyes.

La socia agradece y valora el apoyo brindado mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de su deuda en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción” (Virgin of the Immaculate Conception). She lives in the District and Province of Anta, Department of Cusco.

Benita is 42 years old, separated from her spouse, and has two dependent children. She divides her time between her housework and her small business that includes farming and raising small animals. Benita is requesting a loan to buy pigs and guinea pigs.

She appreciates and values the support that has been provided. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pigs & guinea pigs

loans.name: Safiatou

texts.fr:
Âgée de 49 ans, Madame Safiatou D. réside dans une grande famille avec son époux et ses six enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Safiatou D., après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et  de vente de pâtes et tubercules de manioc afin d’en faire l’Attieke qu’ elle appris avec une voisine venue de la république de Côte d’Ivoire depuis plus de vingt ans. 
Elle mène son activité au domicile conjugal et est beaucoup sollicitée de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits. 
Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a six ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association SABALY de Sanooubougou I), elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel, tous correctement remboursés. Madame   Safiatou D.  vend ses marchandises au comptant ou à crédit à une clientèle composée très généralement de femmes. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt, 35 sacs de manioc à Sikasso et environnants  et 60 sacs de pâtes de manioc (Tièkèdoro) à Bouaké (République de la Côte d Ivoire) afin de les mélanger pour donner  un Attièkè de bonne qualité.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 230 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
At 49 years old, Mrs. Safiatou D. lives in a large family with her husband and her six children in Sanoubougou I, a popular neighborhood in the city of Sikasso (in the Republic of Mali's third administrative district). Mrs. Safiatou D., having headed many businesses unsuccessfully, has learned this occupation of the purchase and sale of cassava mash and tubers in order to make Attièkè [a couscous-like dish made from cassava], which she learned from a neighbor who came from the Republic of Côte d’Ivoire more than twenty years ago. She runs her business from her marital home and is highly sought after by her customers for the quality of her goods. In order to accommodate her increasingly growing customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso six years ago. After 3 group loans in partnership with the women of her neighborhood (Association SABALY from Sanoubougou I), she is on her 4th individual loan, all properly repaid. Mrs. Safiatou D. sells her wares for cash or credit to a customer base made up mostly of women. With this loan, she plans to buy 35 bags of cassava in and around Sikasso and 60 bags of cassava mash (Tièkèdoro) in Bouaké (the Republic of Côte d'Ivoire) in order to blend them and create a good quality Attièkè. She anticipates making a monthly profit of 230,000 CFA francs with this loan, which will mainly be used to grow her business, contribute to the family expenses and pay the interest on her loan.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying cassava mash and tubers

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. is a 43 year old widow who supports her family by engaging in raising ducks for sale and selling eggs. She lives in Prk Calumpang, Barangay Mabini, Valladolid, Negros Occidental with her 4 adult children.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her raising of ducks for sale and selling of eggs, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP10,000.

Tessie is now borrowing PHP20,000 so that she can continue to raise ducks and eggs for sale. This will be her 14th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Tessie aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital.

loans.name: Laetitie

texts.en:
Laetitie is 38 years old, married with 3 children who are 3, 6, and 13 years old.  Laetitie is an experienced woman selling Irish potatoes, and she is very proud of her business.  Laetitie's business hours are from 8 am to 6 pm every day.

Laetitie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business through adding a large quantity of Irish potatoes.  With this additional quantity of Irish potatoes, Laetitie will hopefully earn more profits which in turn will allow her to keep reinvesting for a better financial stability and continue building a secure future for her family.

loans.use: buying a large quantity of Irish potatoes

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a 37 and married with one child. He is a butcher, a business he has been in for four years. He joined the Rafiki group under Faulu Kenya so as to access loans. He has requested a loan of 20, 000 KES to buy an electrc weighing machine, a cooker and a warmer. He hopes to expand his business, purchase a plot of land, and build commercial houses where his butcher's store will be housed.

loans.use: To buy an electric weighing machine, cooker and warmer.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane B. is from the village of Batangan, Valencia City, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jane owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Mary Jane has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2009, Mary Jane joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in future. Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional animals. This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional animals

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima es casada, tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Máxima es socia del Banco Comunal Futuro hace 10 años y lo que aprendió en este tiempo es ser puntual.
Máxima tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la noche.
Máxima necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, jabón.
Los sueños de Máxima son tener casa propia pues vive en casa alquilada.
texts.en:
Máxima is married and has two children who are students. She has been a member of the “Futuro” (Future) communal bank for 10 years. What she learned during this time is to be punctual. Máxima has a stand in the 12 de Abril market where she sells groceries every day from 7am until 6pm. Máxima needs a 1500 sol loan to buy rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil and soap. Her dream is to own her own house since she currently rents her house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, soap.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a 27-year-old single woman who owns a computer and Internet shop. Khadija’s shop is visited by teenagers and adults in order to chat, play games and do certain university projects using the Internet. Her work improves during weekends, holidays and the summer season. She also sells CDs.

Her clients can be anyone but for the most part are her neighbors and villagers. She had financial challenges at the beginning, especially while starting her business. Khadija is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy new products, such as CDs and games, in addition to an important personal issue she has to solve.

loans.use: To buy new products

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “PADRE URRACA”; Este banco está situado en el distrito de Huanchac perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Mery tiene 44 años de edad y es casada, ella tiene 5 hijos  La socia trabaja junto a su esposo cuidando y administrando los pedidos porque tiene una carpintería,  La socia es la encargada de apuntar los pedidos y de cobrar, ella ahora necesita el dinero para invertir en la compra de madera. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de madera.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
Mery is a member of the "Padre Urraca" communal bank, situated in the Huanchac district of Cusco province. Mery is 44 years old, and is married with 5 children. She works with her husband in their carpentry workshop, looking after the orders and administration. She is in charge of filling the orders and invoicing clients, and is seeking the loan to invest in purchasing timber. She is grateful for the loan through this organisation and vows to make her repayments on schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva P. is a married woman who lives in Fisheries, Brgy. Caradio-an, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: pig fattening and fishing businesses. Her husband, Jim, who is 60 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living , and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have five children who are between 30 and 36 years old. 

Eva joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000, because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 15 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eva has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 29,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,500 PHP, improving the family's standard of living. This time, for her 16th cycle loan, she is borrowing 29,500 PHP, which she intends to use as additional capital for her livestock business and for maintenance on her husband's fishing boat so that her family can continue to save up for future home repairs. 

Eva P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Additional capital to help fund her business operations

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 42 años, es un hombre muy alegre y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Nancy de 36 años y sus 7 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. La siembra de papa, habas y arveja es la actividad a la que se dedica Félix, todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras para poderlas hacer más fértiles y productivas. Sus cultivos los lleva a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, donde obtiene muy buenos precios, debido a la buena calidad de sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden perjudicar su producción. Lleva 5 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado. Con el tiempo, espera comprar o alquilar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual es un socio muy responsable y puntual. Con los tres mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Felix is 42 years old and he is a very happy and hard working individual. He lives in a home that he owns together with his wife Nancy, 36 years old, and their 7 beloved children. He wishes to provide them with a better quality of life.  Felix's business is the harvest of potatoes, fava beans and peas. Every morning he sets out for his fields and works to make them more fertile and more productive. He brings the harvest to the wholesalers' market in Tarma. There, he is able to acquire very good prices for his products, given their excellent quality. What he most enjoys about his work warding off plagues that may decimate production. He has had 5 years in the field and in time he hopes to purchase or rent more land to increase production. This is his sixth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to making his payments on time, not wanting to cause any trouble for his community bank. He is a very responsible and punctual member of the bank. The three thousand nuevos soles he requests will be used to purchase more fertilizer for his plantations.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For the expenses of his wedding

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona Y. is from the village of Sibaroc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 45 years old. Alona is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Alona owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale. Alona has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Alona joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alona has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Alona is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the third loan taken out by Alona from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Blanca

texts.es:
La Sra. Blanca S.  tiene 36 años de edad está casada con el Sr. Aníbal Gómez  hace más 13 años  y vive en su casa propia en la  ciudad de Carapeguá, tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar.
        Desde jóven empezó a ayudar a su madre a confeccionar las colchas artesanales, de quién aprendió el oficio, también compra ropas en general para volver a venderlo, hoy en día  lleva a  vender sus productos en la zona de la capital del país con la ayuda de su marido, gracias a este trabajo logró construir una modesta casa y brindar buena atención a su hijo.  	

            Solicita el préstamo para la compra de sobrecamas, sábanas y hamaca.
texts.en:
Mrs Blanca S. is 36 years old and has been married to Mr Aníbal Gómez for more than 13 years.  She lives in her own home in the town of Carapeguá.  She and her husband have 2 school-age children.

When she was a young girl, Blanca started helping her mother to make hand-made bedspreads.  She learned the trade from her mother.  She also buys general bed linen to re-sell.  These days she takes her products to sell in the capital city with the help of her husband.  Thanks to this work she has managed to build a modest house and look after her children.

She is requesting this loan to buy bedspreads, sheets and hammocks.

loans.use: To buy bedspreads, sheets and hammocks

loans.name: David  Ndirangu

texts.en:
David has been selling clothes in Njabini town for the last four years.  He is 32 years old, married to Rachael Muthoni, and has one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend, and this will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan amount to buy more clothes to sell during the Christmas season as the demand is very high.

In the future, David hopes to own a big boutique in Njabini town.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita D. is from the village of Rizal, West San Isidro. She is 46 years old, married and has 6 adult-aged children. To make a living, Lolita owns and operates a business venture in the arts sector operating a weaving business. While not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for her business comes primarily from selling specialty hand-woven products to tourists and local community members. Lolita has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month.

In 2008, Lolita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make woven products. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos which will be used to purchase raw materials to make woven products. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Lolita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to make woven products.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David has been practicing mixed farming for the last seven years in Murang'a town, central Kenya. His mixed farm produces coffee, which he sells through a local co-operative society, tea and milk, which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority and Kenya Co-operative Creameries, respectively. He also employs 1-2 casual laborers daily.

David has requested this loan of 53,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will go towards the education of his child. His major challenge has been lack of artificial insemination services in the region. In the future, he would like to acquire at least five dairy cows producing 100 litres of milk daily.

David is 33 years old and married with one child age 5 who attends school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en:
39-year-old Cleofe is a farmer from the town of Banga, South Cotabato. She plants and harvests rice and corn crops. Cleofe then sells her harvest to the market. Cleofe is also very happy to share with us that she was able to put up a small sari-sari store. She sells various products like sugar, soy sauce and others. Cleofe hopes for her store to grow as well.

Cleofe joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Cleofe has successfully repaid a previous loan  from CEVI. Cleofe is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Ignacio Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ignacio C. tiene 60 años de edad, está casado con la Sra. Hilda Liduvina Meza C..
El señor Ignacio se dedica a la reparación de toda clase de vehículos como así también a la herrería.
Nos cuenta que para empezar con esta actividad desde muy joven trabajaba con su tío, el cual le enseñó este oficio, posteriormente se independizó y comenzó a trabajar en su propio taller, empezando a ser conocido por casi todos los habitantes de la ciudad en donde vive.
Ya hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este rubro y obteniendo excelentes resultados, llegando a construir hasta para su casa propia en un terreno, el cual lo había adquirido a partir de la ganancia que le daba su trabajo.
El préstamo solicitado es para la compra de una máquina que le servirá para agilizar algunos trabajos.
La intención del señor es lograr rendir mejor en su trabajo, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya el crédito otorgado.
texts.en:
Ignacio C. is 60 years old and married to Hilda Liduvina Meza C.. He repairs all types of vehicles and also works as a blacksmith. He told us that he started this activity at a very young age with his uncle, who taught him this craft. Later on, Señor Ignacio became independent and worked in his own workshop, gradually becoming known by almost everyone in town.

He has now been active in this trade for over 15 years and is proud of his achievement. He was able to construct his own house on a plot of land that he bought with money earned from his work.

He intends to use his loan to buy a machine to speed up certain tasks. He wants to become a better craftsman and thanks the microfinance institution Fundación Paraguaya for the granted loan.

loans.use: To buy a machine for his blacksmith workshop

loans.name: Delia Carmita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Banco Comunal Esperanza Nueva, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Delia, ella tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos pero uno de ellos falleció hace tiempo. En la actualidad sus dos hijos son mayores de edad y su hija vive donde ella con su familia. Su esposo es comerciante.

Trabaja de maestra en una escuela en Tosagua, pero además de esto se dedica al comercio, vende productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todas las tardes, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra todas las  semanas, nos cuenta que lleva en este negocio ya por 10 años y que le va muy bien, lo mas vende es la bisutería.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Esta desde el tercer ciclo que se formo el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos le han ayudado mucho. Sus sueños son que sus hijas sigan superándose, una de ellas estudia medicina.
texts.en:
The “Nueva Esperanza” (New Hope) communal bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua, a place known for being very dynamic where most of its residents are farmers or raise livestock; it is an area with much vegetation.

This is where we met Delia, 50.  She’s married and had three children but one of them died some time ago.  Currently, her two children are adults but her daughter and her family live with her.  Her husband is a merchant.

She’s employed as a Teacher in a school in Tosagua but she’s also a merchant; she sells Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and women’s accessories).  She works every afternoon.  She sells on credit and collects weekly.  She tells us that she’s been in this business for 10 years already and does very well.  What she sells most is the costume jewelry.

This loan is to buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.  She’s been a member since the bank’s third cycle and she likes it because the loans have helped her quite a bit.  Her dreams are that her daughters continue to better themselves; one of them is studying Medicine.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, creams, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a divorced woman with three children, two girls and one boy, two of whom still attend school while one is employed. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Amina was previously making dumplings and selling them from home to her neighbours and passersby. She now operates a food stall at a trading center and her business has become more stable. She hopes to establish real estate houses in the future.

Amina is a hard-working and polite person who wants to expand her business and increase her profit. She is requesting a loan of 25,000 Kshs to purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of Irish potatoes, rice, beans and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en: Evangeline is a married woman who lives in Narra, Palawan. She earns her living by raising pigs, catering food and tailoring. Her husband Felipe, who is 51 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 18 and 31 years old. Evangeline joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evangeline has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 15,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing PHP 17,000 to purchase pigs and feed so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children. Evangeline is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase feed and additional pigs to raise

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is a young man from Tulkarem, a father of four sons and a husband. Sulaiman is a school guard; he also works in a blacksmith workshop after school duty.

Sulaiman wants to start his own business. He used the money he had saved to purchase goats and took a loan from FATEN to install a corral in his backyard. 

Sulaiman who is photographed here will start breeding and producing dairy products and sell in Tulkarem area.

loans.use: to install a goat corral to be have better conditions and start a business.

loans.name: Bernardina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN MARTIN DE ZURITE”; Este banco está ubicado en el Poblado de Zurite,  provincia de Anta y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Bernardina, es soltera y tiene 53 años de edad,  tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 de ellos son independientes y 1 de ellos tiene 22 años de edad, y aún depende de su madre, la socia tiene como principal actividad la agricultura y tiene sus terrenos de cultivo, la socia siembra y cosecha maíz, cebada, trigo, papa, ella vende en las ferias al por mayor todos sus productos, la socia requiere el préstamo para cubrir la nueva siembra lo que significa remover la tierra para prepararla y comprar semillas, abono, y a media etapa deshierbar, quiere decir deberán limpiar las hierbas que crecieron alrededor del cultivo y limpiar la zona cultivada. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la nueva siembra de productos andinos agrícolas.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Bernadina is a member of the community bank San Martin de Zurite, located in the town of Zurite in the Anta province and Cusco department.  Bernadina is 53 years old, single, and has six children, of whom five are independent and one is 22 years old and still depends on his mother.  

She works in agriculture and has land to cultivate. She plants and harvests corn, barley, wheat, and potatoes.  She sells her crops in the wholesale market.  

She is asking for this loan to cover her new planting, which means removing the soil to prepare it, purchasing seeds and fertilizer, weeding at the middle stage to clear the grasses that grow near the crops, and cleaning the cultivated area.  She is asking for this loan to invest in a new planting of Andean agricultural products.

Bernadina values and is thankful for the loan given and promises to make her payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to cover the costs of planting a new crop of Andean agricultural products.

loans.name: Mergelyn

texts.en:
Mergelyn C. is 26 years old and married.  She works as a farmer in the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She started growing rice four years ago. Mergelyn and her husband work together to keep their farm productive. Her husband is also a driver. Mergelyn’s family relies on the farm. She hopes for their business to be stable.

Mergelyn is requesting a loan for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Jacklyn

texts.en: Jacklyn currently sells beans, she is 23 years old and married. Jacklyn took out a loan to stock more beans to sell. She hopes to open a big shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more beans to sell.
